- Three divisions - Championship (gross only), Middle (gross and net), and Forward Division (gross and net)
- Teams must select their division at the time of entry
- The overall Champion will be the team from the Championship Division with the lowest 36- hole total score

Eligibility
- Female amateur golfers
- One entrant must be at least 16 years of age as of the first day of the Championship
- A valid Florida GHIN Handicap Index not exceeding 34.0
- Both entrants are required to be members of the FSGA
courseName: Mission Inn Resort - Las Colinas Course

title: Florida Women's Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
Championship Format
- 36 holes of individual stroke play
- 84 total competitors
- Four Divisions - Senior Championship, Senior Field, Super-Senior Championship and Super-Senior Field Division.
- Players must select their division at the time of entry, provided they meet the eligibility requirements.
- The overall Champions will be the individuals from the Senior and Super-Senior Championship Divisions with the lowest 36-hole total score.

Eligibility
- Female amateur golfer
- At least 50 years of age as of the first day of the Championship
- At least 65 years of age as of the first day of the Championship to select to play in the Super-Senior Division at time of entry
- A valid Florida GHIN Handicap Index not exceeding 34.0
- Entrant is required to be a member of the FSGA

title: Arizona Women's Partners Tournament
notes:
This tournament shall consist of Day 1 - 18 holes to be played under Rule 31, Four-Ball Stroke Play and Day 2 - 18 holes of individual stroke play with aggregate score of partners. Scoring for both rounds will be a modified stableford.

Day 1- Each partner receives 95% of her course handicap. Course handicap, after allowance, of the members of a side may not differ by more than eight strokes. Day 2- Each partner receives 100% of her course handicap.

Prizes will be awarded to the Overall Team Champions along with gross and net team flight prizes.
courseName: Ventana Canyon Golf Club - Mountain Course

title: Arizona Women's State Senior Championship
notes:
The Championship shall consist of 54 holes of stroke play. The tournament is open to senior women amateur golfers (age 50 and older) who have a USGA Handicap Index of 40.4 or lower and are AGA members in good standing for at least 30 days prior to the first day of the tournament.

The flights will be: 1. Championship Flight 2. Field Flights 3. Super Seniors (70 – 74 Years old) 4. Masters (75 - 79 Years old) 5. Legends (80+ Years old)

1) The Mary Lou Sauer Memorial Trophy is a team combined net trophy for the field flights. 2) The Mo Cruikshank Memorial Trophy is a team combined gross trophy for the Championship flight. 3) The Dr. Ann PIttman Memorial Trophy is a team combined net trophy for the Super Seniors flight. 4) The Legends Championship Trophy shall be awarded to the lowest gross scorer of the Masters and Legends Divisions combined. 5) The Legends Net Championship Trophy will be awarded for the Masters and Legends Divisions combined.

title: California High School Boys Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The California Interscholastic Federation is divided into four districts, and each provides contestants in the events based on district student population. The State Championship is a one-day event run by the NCGA and SCGA, with teams and individual students competing in 18 holes of stroke play. The top six individuals and top three teams of each region (Northern and Southern) advance to the State Championship, which rotates each year between Northern and Southern sites.

title: Palm Beach County Senior Classic
notes:
Individual Stroke Play for 18 Holes. There are 
two 
divisions: Gross and Net. Prizes will be awarded 
in 
both divisions.  Open to all PBCGA Members will 
will have reached their 50th Birthday by the 
start 
of the tournament.
courseName: Boca Lago Country Club - East Course

title: Palm Beach Stableford
notes:
Individual Modified Stableford for 36 Holes. 
Competitors lose 1 point for a Double 
Bogey or worse. 1 point for Bogey, 2 points 
for Par, 4 points for Birdie, 6 points for 
Eagle, 8 points for 
Double Eagle.  Open to all PBCGA 
Members. Open, Senior and Super Senior divisions. 
Maximum handicap 
allowed 
is 18.
courseName: PGA National Golf Club - Estates Course

title: Palm Beach County Four-Ball Championship
notes:
54-hole two-man team event with Open, Senior (ages 50-59) and Super Senior (60+) divisions.

First Round: Better Ball – Both players play their own ball and the lower score of the partners is the score for the hole. If one partner fails to complete the play of a hole, there is no penalty.

Final Round: Modified Alternate Shot – Both players tee off on every hole. You then play your partners drive for your second shot. After second shots have been played, one ball is selected to complete the hole and that ball must be played alternately until holed out.
courseName: PGA National Golf Club - Champion Course

title: Tommy Belen Better Ball Championship
notes:
The Tommy Belen Better Ball Championship a 36-
hole Four-Ball Stroke Play Championship (two person 
teams), with Open, Senior (50+) and Super Senior 
(60+) divisions. 
Named in honor of past PBCGA Executive Director, 
Thomas Belen.

title: Palm Beach County Amateur Championship
notes:
54-hole Individual Stroke Play Championship with a 
single Open division; the field will be cut to the low 
70 
+ ties after the second round.

title: Palm Beach County Nicklaus Junior Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournaments for boys and girls, 
with Overall championships for boys and girls, plus 
additional divisions for boys 13-15 and boys 10-12.

title: Palm Beach County Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
Format is 36-holes of stroke play with Senior (50-
59), 
Super Senior (60-69), and Legend (70+) divisions.  
Open to all PBCGA members who have reached their 
50th 
birthday by the start of the tournament.

title: National Senior Junior Championship
notes:
Mid Amateur, Senior Amateur.  Unique 54 hole 
stroke play invitational features a "junior" (mid 
am) and a senior. There is also a Legends division 
that pairs legends and super seniors. Started in 1991 
by some 
Society of Seniors members. Played on a 
wonderful course re-done by Pete Dye. Best Ball 
Format Round 1 – Pinehurst Format Round 2 – 
Scramble Format Round 3.

title: Old Corkscrew Senior
notes:
Opening "major" event of the Senior season which earns players points in the Golfweek and AmateurGolf.com senior rankings. The event is a 54 hole individual stroke play tournament for amateurs fifty-five years and over. The tournament includes a Senior Division (age 55- 64); Super-Senior Division (65 and over); and a Legends Division (70 and over), the Legends Division plays from the same yardage and tees as the Super-Senior Division. Participants must reach the minimum age requirement in each division bracket by the first tournament round.

Old Corkscrew Golf Club is a Jack Nicklaus ‘Signature Design’ that has received many coveted awards.

title: Kingsway Senior Invitational
notes:
54-hole stroke play event created by Virginia's Dave King, now part of the Senior Florida Swing.

Entries are open by invitation only to amateur golfers who have a verifiable handicap of eight (8) or less. Seniors: age 55 & above; Super Seniors: age 65 & above; Legends: age 70 & above; Super Legends: age 75 and above.

title: Mid Pines Invitational
notes:
Of the seven Donald Ross courses in the 
Sandhills 
area, this is the only one with the original 
routing 
left in place. A fun 36 hole team event played on 
a wonderful 6500 yard golf course. Open Division, 
Senior Division (both players must be 50+).

title: American Seniors Better-Ball of Pairs
notes:
54-hole four-ball stroke play event open to American 
Seniors Golf Association members. There will be 
men's 
gross and net divisions along with women's 
individual 
stroke play and stableford divisions.

title: Jones Cup Invitational
notes:
The Jones Cup is probably the biggest of the springtime amateur majors in the United States, and the reason is the venue and the strong U.S. and international field. The past champions list is littered with PGA Tour stars, including Justin Thomas, Patrick Reed, Luke List, Kyle Stanley, Beau Hossler and several others.

This 54-hole individual stroke-play event, inaugurated in 2001, is played at Ocean Forest Golf Club. The Rees Jones design opened in 1995 and has hosted the Georgia State Amateur Championship, the Southern Amateur Championship and the 2001 Walker Cup Match. The Jones Cup brings together many of the finest amateurs from the United States and abroad for a three-day competition.

The Jones Cup was born from a deep commitment to amateur golf by the A.W. Jones family, who founded the Cloister and Sea Island Golf Club in 1928. The Sea Island Golf Club has played host to seven USGA championships. The Jones Cup is yet another extension of the family's strong involvement in amateur golf.

title: Pine Needles Men's Invitational
notes:
54 holes four-ball stroke play championship with open 
and senior (both players ages 50+) divisions. The field 
will be cut to the low 48 teams split between both 
divisions following the second round. The Consolation 
Round will be played at Mid Pines. Priority is given to 
past players.
courseName: Pine Needles Lodge and Golf Club

title: Bluffs Dogwood Invitational
notes:
36-hole best ball event that attracts good players 
from all over the south. Field is limited to 64 
teams. Tournament will be flighted using the lowest 
handicap of the two team members.

title: American Seniors Spring Championship
notes:
54 hole stroke play event open to American Seniors 
Golf Association members. The format includes 
gross, 
net, and stableford divisions for both men and 
women.

title: George L. Coleman Invitational - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak. Next event will be in 2022.

One of the very best amateur events all year long played on the last great private course designed by Donald Ross. The course, not long by today's standards, lies hard by the Atlantic Ocean. Oceanic winds and very fast greens give this course teeth. Ben Hogan once said 'If you can play Seminole, you can play any course in the world.'

The tournament is a 54-hole stroke play invitational that draws an elite field of mid- amateurs and seniors.

title: Richardson Memorial Invitational - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Event honors William Richardson, legendary New York Times golf writer. Regional field plays on a Devereaux Emmet golf course that has been restored to his original vision. 18 hole qualifier establishes match play brackets.

title: Horace Havemeyer Invitational Tournament - POSTPONED
notes:
**Postponed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Regional event played on Southward Ho, a A.W. Tilinghast-designed course that was bailed out by Horace Havemeyer during the Depression era. Since 1951, the Havemeyer Invitational has attracted top metropolitan region amateur golfers to compete at Southward Ho in a three day event. 18 hole qualifier establishes match play contestants in both championship and senior divisions.

title: International Seniors Mid-Winter Championship
notes:
The Society conducts two championships per year: a Summer Championship and a Mid-Winter Championship. The championships are conducted over 72 holes and are played in three divisions:

Championship (Scratch)
Age 65+ Championship (Scratch)
Stableford (Par points)
Super Seniors - 70 years and older (Stableford)

title: Middle Atlantic Senior Amateur Championship - POSTPONED
notes:
**Postponed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36-hole stroke play championship for seniors and super seniors. Overall, pre-senior (ages 45-54), senior (ages 55-64), super senior (65-74) and legend (ages 75+) divisions. The USGA handicap index for an entrant must not exceed 9.4 as of April 1.

title: St. Andrews Links Trophy - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

72-hole stroke play that draws one of the top amateur fields in Europe. Field plays two rounds, one at the Old Course and one additional (sometimes the Jubilee, sometimes the New), then the field is cut to the low 40 and ties. The final two rounds are played on the Old Course.

title: Walter J. Travis Invitational - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Tournament honors Walter Travis, three time U.S. Amateur champ and the first American to win the British Amateur. Travis reworked the original Devereaux Emmet design. 18 hole qualifier establishes match play flights. Great event, great golf course.

title: Irish Seniors Amateur Open Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

First played for in 1970 when the legendary Cecil Ewing (Co Sligo) won the title at Lahinch, this event has grown in strength and popularity since then. The Championship has proven to be a breeding ground for the Irish Seniors Home International Team and the European Seniors Team, as the recent list of winners proves.

This Championship attracts a quality entry from overseas, and no fewer than seven winners have come from outside of Ireland. Competitive entry process, but a handicap of 2.5-3.0 should get you in this 54 hole stroke play event.

title: John T. Lupton Memorial - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

This event, named after club founder John T. Lupton, debuted in 2005 on a spectacular Pete Dye golf course near Chatanooga. Mitch Voges won the 1991 U.S. Amateur here, and Tiger Woods won the 1996 NCAA Championship here despite a final round 80. 54 hole individual event with a 36 hole cut. Stroke play format for the Championship division and Stableford format for the Senior division. Committee will invite 72 mid ams and 54 senior ams. The field will be cut to approximately 75% in each division following the 2nd round.

title: Cascades Invitational - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

54-hole four-ball stroke play event with Mid- amateur, Senior and Legends divisions. Played at the Cascades Course at The Homestead over Memorial Day weekend, Friday to Monday.

title: Birmingham National Invitational
notes:
This 54-hole stroke play event, traditionally held 
the weekend after Memorial Day, dates back to 
the early 1900's and has "Vintage" division 
for seniors with special accomplishments.
courseName: Country Club of Birmingham - West Course

title: U.S. Senior Challenge
notes:
The U.S. Senior Challenge is the nation's only senior amateur event conducted in a state-team format.

Originally encompassing 15 states in 1985, the U.S. Senior Challenge now consists of teams and players from 37 states. Each member state is led by a State Captain selected and approved by the Board of Directors.

The championship is played each year at Gross Stroke play and includes participants 55 years of age and over with a maximum handicap of 4.

TEAM COMPETITION:
Teams consist of 4 men including the State Captain who selects the players. The field is limited to the first 30 teams entered.
courseName: Pumpkin Ridge Golf Club - Witch Hollow Course

title: Clay Dykes Senior Invitational
notes:
Four Ball Invitational honors a charter member 
of The Farm, which hosted the 2005 U.S. Senior 
Amateur and currently hosts the Carpet Capital 
Intercollegiate.

title: National Senior Hall of Fame
notes:
54 hole invitational started in honor of Dale 
Morey 
(a member at Willow Creek) typically draws one 
of the strongest fields of the year. The tournament 
organizers desire to create and maintain a true and 
meaningful Hall of Fame that recognizes the best in 
amateur golf of national and international acclaim. 
Their list of previous inductees and champions attest 
to our success in these efforts, most have won 
either 
the U.S. or the British Senior Amateur Championship 
or innumerable other prestigious championships 
such 
as the U.S. Amateur.
courseName: Willow Creek Course at High Point CC

title: Anderson Memorial Four-Ball - CANCELLED
notes:
**Due to hosting the U.S. Open, the Anderson Memorial, which had moved to September due to COVID-19, has been cancelled.

Perhaps the most coveted best-ball invitation in all of amateur golf. Created in 1933 to honor Winged Foot founding member and two time U.S. Amateur runner-up John G. Anderson, the event consists of a 36 hole qualifier followed by two days of match play competition in both Championship and Senior divisions.
courseName: Winged Foot Golf Club - West Course

title: American Seniors Two-Man Team Championship
notes:
54 hole four-ball stroke play event open 
American Seniors Golf Association members. The field 
will 
include men's four-ball gross and net divisions along 
with women's individual stroke play gross, net, and 
stableford divisions.
courseName: Red Sky Golf Club - Fazio Course

title: Oglethorpe Invitational - POSTPONED
notes:
**Postponed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

This 54-hole stroke play event (with 36-hole cut) has been a good mix of collegiate, mid-amateur, and senior players since its inaugural playing in 1983, which was won by three-time PGA Tour winner Gene Sauers. Entries open to amateurs with USGA handicap index of 5 or less.

title: Columbus Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
Match play championship for senior members of 
the Columbus District Golf 
Association. 18 hole of stroke play qualifying 
determines a match play bracket of 16 players.

title: Mittelmark Invitational - POSTPONED
notes:
**Postponed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Invitation only 36 hole event for the best amateurs in the New York Metro area. Played on what some term "Little Winged Foot". This 1924 Tillinghast layout isn't 6600 yards long, but it's all you want. Small field has returned this event to its former glory.

title: Pacific Northwest Women's Amateur and Mid-Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The Championship will be conducted in two stages:

Stroke Play – All players must complete the 36-hole stroke play qualifying in order to determine the 32 players who will advance to match play. In the event of a tie for the final qualifying spot(s), a sudden-death playoff will be used to determine the qualfiiers. In the event of a tie for the Qualifying Medalist, a sudden-death playoff will commence.

Match Play – The General Numerical Draw will be in effect. Single elimination match play, with a 36-hole Championship Final Match. All other matches are 18 holes.

title: Senior Azalea Invitational - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

54 hole stroke play on a 1925 Seth Raynor design. Senior (ages 55+) and super senior (ages 65+) divisions.

title: Geranium Senior Invitational - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Formerly known as the Georgia Senior Invitational, Charlie Busbee and Paul Cobb launched this 54 hole invitational event in 2004. The tournament name was changed to the Geranium Senior Invitational in 2017. This 54-hole tournament has three divisions: Senior - Age 55-64, Super Senior - Age 65-69, Legend - Age 70 and above

title: International Seniors Summer Championship
notes:
The Society conducts two championships per year: a Summer Championship and a Mid-Winter Championship. The championships are conducted over 72 holes and are played in three divisions:

Championship (Scratch)
Age 65+ Championship (Scratch)
Stableford (Par points)
Super Seniors - 70 years and older (Stableford)

title: Society of Seniors Ralph Bogart Tournament
notes:
54-hole stroke play event open to members of the 
Society of Seniors Golf Association. There will be 
senior (ages 55+), super senior (65+) and grand 
master (70+) divisions.

title: Massachusetts Four-Ball Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Entries are open to two-person teams of amateur golfers who hold membership in an MGA member club and have an up-to-date combined MGA/USGA GHIN Handicap Index not exceeding 6.0, or who have completed their handicap certification as defined on the Entry Form. Competition will be 36 holes at Four-Ball Stroke Play.

title: Massachusetts Open Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

54 hole stroke play championship open to professional golfers and amateur golfers with an active USGA GHIN Handicap Index not exceeding 2.4, or who have completed their handicap certification. Nonexempt players must pre-qualify.

title: Massachusetts Amateur Championship
notes:
Qualifying - 18 Holes at Stroke Play to determine
32 Qualifiers for Match Play. Entries are open to 
amateur golfers who have an active MGA/GHIN 
Handicap Index at any public, private, semi-private, 
municipal or non-real estate MGA member course/club 
not exceeding 4.4.

title: Massachusetts Junior Amateur Championship
notes:
Junior Division: Entries are open to amateur
golfers who play at an MGA member club, who
have reached their 16th birthday and will not 
reach
their 18th birthday by midnight on the first day 
of the tournament.
Pre-Junior Division: Entries are open to 
amateur
golfers who play at an MGA member club,
who have reached their 14th birthday and will
not reach their 16th birthday by the first day 
of the tournament.

Boys Division: Entries are open to amateur 
golfers
who play at an MGA member club who will
not reach their 14th birthday by midnight the 
first day of the tournament.

title: Massachusetts Senior Four-Ball Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Entries are open to two-person teams of amateur golfers who hold membership in an MGA member club, who have reached their 55th birthday and who have an up-to-date MGA/USGA GHIN combined Handicap Index not exceeding 12.0 (16.0 for super seniors) or have completed their handicap certification as defined on the Entry Form.

title: Massachusetts Amateur Public Links Championship
notes:
Entries are open to amateur golfers who are bona fide public course players at a public MGA member club (a course/club that provides playing opportunities for the general public seven days a week) and maintain an up-to-date MGA/GHIN Handicap Index not exceeding 12.0. Players who have playing privileges or who have an established handicap at any private club are ineligible, with the exception of:

a) Players competing on a school golf team, provided those privileges are limited to scheduled practices and competitions; or
b) Players employed by a private club, provided their playing privileges
I. Are limited in nature;
II. Are consistent with those offered other employees;
III. Do not allow participation in any club tournaments; and
IV. No handicap is maintained at the private club.

The competition will be stroke play with 18 hole qualifier and the Championship proper at 36 holes.

title: Massachusetts Father-Daughter Championship
notes:
Entries are open to any Father and Daughter
team who are both members of an MGA
member club. A father may only play one
round, with one daughter, in the Championship.  
Competition will be 18 Holes at Foursomes
Stroke Play (selected drive). The field is limited
to 50 teams.

title: Massachusetts Father-Son Championship
notes:
The best father and son pair in the state compete 
annually at this popular MGA event. The Father & 
Son 
Championship features father & son teams from 
MGA 
Member Clubs who compete in 18 holes at 
foursomes 
stroke play (selected drive - alternate shot). The 
event 
currently features a Junior Division (sons - ages 14 
to 
18) and Senior Division (sons - 19 & older), with 
each 
division playing one day.

title: Massachusetts Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
Entries are open to amateur golfers who 
have
reached their 25th birthday by the first 
day of 
the tournament,
who hold membership in an MGA member 
club
and have an up-to-date MGA/USGA GHIN
Handicap Index not exceeding 5.4, or
who have completed their handicap 
certification
as defined on the Entry Form.  
Competition will 
be in two (2) stages
at Stroke Play: 18 hole qualifier; 
Championship 
Proper - 54 Holes.

title: Massachusetts Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
Entries are open to amateur golfers who hold
membership in an MGA member club, who
have reached their 55th birthday by
the first day of the tournament and have an 
up-
to-date
MGA/USGA GHIN Handicap Index not 
exceeding
8.0 or have completed
their handicap certification as defined on the
Entry Form. Competition will be 36 Holes 
at 
Stroke Play.

title: Kentucky Challenge Cup
notes:
Team matches between the Kentucky Golf Association and the Kentucky PGA. This event is currently on a three site rotation including three of the most prestigious golf venues in the Commonwealth; Idle Hour Country Club, Valhalla Golf Club and The Club @ Olde Stone. Since its establishment in the 1970’s, Kentucky’s finest amateur and professional golfers have gone head to head to retain or regain the “Cup”.

Teams from the KGA and the KPGA are now composed of 12 members chosen by the use of the past year’s Player of the Year standings. Team captains will continue using their two at- large selections after the initial 10 players have been confirmed.

The team and individual match play format will use 27 holes. The first 9 hole – Four-Ball Team, Second 9 holes – Alternate Shot Team and the third 9 holes – Singles Match Play.

title: Kentucky Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship with the following divisions: Open (ages 25+), Mid-Senior (40-49), Senior (50-59), and Masters (60+). Open division is gross scoring only, while the other divisions are gross and net.

Entrants in all KGA tournaments shall be required to have an active Handicap Index at a Kentucky Golf Association Member Club at the time of entry and meet the championship’s residency requirements.

title: Maryland Junior Amateur Championship
notes:
This tournament is open to male junior amateurs 
who are residents of Maryland or are 
members of member clubs of the MSGA.
Each entrant must have reached 12 years 
of age but not 18 years of age by the 
start of the tournament. Each contestant 
must also have an up-to-
date USGA index. The tournament 
will be 
36 holes stroke play conducted as follows. 
All competitors regardless of age will play 
the first 18
holes. The low 24 scores and ties and 
those within 8 strokes of the leading score 
will play a second 18 holes the following 
day.

title: Maryland Father-Son Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled for 2020.

This tournament is open to amateur fathers and sons or stepsons, at least one of whom on each team must be a member of a MSGA member club. The tournament will be conducted on the basis of selective drives and alternate shots thereafter.

title: AT&T Pebble Beach National Pro-Am
notes:
One of the most exciting events on the PGA TOUR, 
the 
AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am is contested annually in 
front of over 190,000 spectators and millions of 
television viewers on three of the Monterey 
Peninsula’s 
premier golf courses: Pebble Beach Golf Links, 
Spyglass 
Hill Golf Course, and Monterey Peninsula Country 
Club 
Shore.

title: Delaware Four-Ball #1 - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Four-ball stroke play tournament open to male amateur golfers, with open and senior flights.
courseName: Chester River Yacht and Country Club

title: Delaware Mid-Open Championship
notes:
Stroke play tournament for male amateurs and 
professional aged 30 and over.

title: Delaware 27-Hole Challenge
notes:
27-hole flighted stroke play tournament open to 
male 
amateur golfers. Format: Nine (9) hole scramble, nine 
(9) hole alternate shot, nine (9) hole four-ball.

title: New Hampshire Four-Ball Championship
notes:
Tournament is 36 holes stroke play, 2-man
best-ball. One of the two players must have below a 
12.0 Handicap Index. Entries 
are open to male amateurs who are 
members in 
good standing of member NHGA Clubs 
who are 
legal residents of New Hampshire.

title: New Hampshire Junior Championship
notes:
Tournament is 18 holes qualifying Monday 
morning. Sixty-four players will begin 
match play Monday afternoon. 
Championship flight will contain 16 
players, the other six divisions will have 
eight players each. Matches will continue 
on Tuesday morning and Tuesday 
afternoon. Championship flight finals will 
be played on Wednesday morning.
Entries are open to male members in good 
standing of member NHGA Clubs who are 
legal residents of New Hampshire. 
Applicants must not have reached their 
18th birthday by the last day of the 
tournament.

title: New Hampshire Amateur Championship
notes:
Competition will be held at ten pre-qualifying 
sites and will be 18 holes at Stroke Play.  
The 
low qualifiers and ties from all the sites 
along 
with the players exempt from 
prequalifying, will 
be eligible for the 36-hole qualifying on 
the 
first two days of the tournament proper. 
Sixty-four players will begin match play the 
following day. Entries are open to males 
who 
are members in good standing of member 
NHGA 
Clubs who are legal residents of New 
Hampshire. An eligible non-resident can 
play in 
NHGA Championships if he has been a 
member 
in good standing of an NHGA member club 
for 
the last three complete golf seasons and 
has 
played a minimum of 25 rounds of golf at 
this 
club in each of the three seasons. A letter 
signed by the President of the member 
club 
must accompany his first entry, stating 
that 
the player complies with NHGA eligibility 
requirements.

title: New Hampshire Open Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Tournament is 36 holes stroke play. Field will be cut for Tuesday to the low 72 and ties. Entries are open to professional golfers and to those amateurs whose USGA Handicap index is 4.0 or less. Amateur entrants must have an up-to-date USGA GHIN Handicap Index. The amateur field will be limited to the first 20 entries.

title: New Hampshire Stroke Play Championship
notes:
Tournament is 72 holes stroke play, 18 
holes 
for each of the first two days; field will be 
cut 
to low 40 plus ties and anyone within 10 
shots 
of the lead after 36 holes. 
Entries are open to male members in good 
standing of member NHGA clubs who are 
legal 
residents of New Hampshire.

title: New Hampshire Parent-Child Championship
notes:
Tournament is 18 holes stroke play: Both hit tee shot, 
alternate for second shot, then 
select one ball and alternate until holed. Eligible to 
teams of two golfers of parent & child or grandparent & 
grandchild. One of the players must have an active 
New 
Hampshire GHIN Handicap Index.

title: New Hampshire Senior Championship
notes:
Tournament is 36 holes stroke play, gross, 
in four age divisions: 55-62, 63-69, 70-74, 
75 and up.  All gross division players will 
play from back tees. Any tie for overall first 
will be played off at sudden death stroke 
play after regular play has finished.
Entries are open to male members of 
member NHGA Clubs who are legal 
residents of New Hampshire.  Applicants 
must be 55 years of age.

title: New Hampshire Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
The tournament will consist of 54 holes 
stroke 
play with a cut for Saturday to low 27 
players 
and ties. Entries are 
open to male members in good standing 
of 
member NHGA Clubs who are legal 
residents of 
New Hampshire. Applicants must be 30 
years 
of age by the first day of the tournament.

title: Women's Southern Senior Championship
notes:
The WSGA Senior Championship is a 54 hole 
stroke play event. The field is divided into flights 
after 36 holes of play.

title: Northern California Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
The NCGA Women’s Amateur Championship is the 
association’s premier event for female 
golfers. Field limited to 76 eligible players in the 
championship division and 24 players in 
the senior division. All female golfers with a handicap 
index of 7.4 or less (or 18.4 or less 
for seniors) are eligible to enter. Format: 36 holes 
stroke play (18 holes per day).

title: Marin County Amateur & Senior Four-Ball Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Annual best-ball event played at 36-holes in one day on a mid-July Monday. The host club, the Alister Mackenzie-designed Meadow Club, is one of the finest courses in California and typically finds itself in the top-100 in the USA. Playing the tournament is a tremendous opportunity to play a very exclusive club.

title: Golfweek Senior Player of the Year Classic
notes:
Premier tournament featuring the world’s elite senior amateurs age 55 and up, in three separate divisions: Senior (age 55-64), Super Senior (age 65-69), Legends (age 70-74) and Super Legends (age 75+). Max handicap 8.0.

The tournament honors Golfweek's top three nationally ranked players in the Senior, Super Senior and Legends division. The "Yancey Ford Award" is also presented, honoring an individual who has made significant lifetime contributions to amateur golf.

Formerly known as the Golfweek Senior National Championship.

title: Chicago City Amateur Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play championship with a cut to the low 
60% of the field plus ties after round two. Field limited 
to 96 players.

title: Cook County Amateur Championship - POSTPONED
notes:
Three-day tournament with a field limit of 32 players. 
Medal play seeding round followed 
by five rounds of match play.

title: Midwest Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play event at Sydney Marovitz Golf 
Course in Chicago. First played in the 1920s. Run by 
the Chicago Park District.

title: Chicago International Championship
notes:
Modified Stableford Scoring System. 36-hole 
tournament played at Robert Black Golf Course in 
Chicago. Run by the Chicago Park District.

title: Chicago Senior Amateur Championship - POSTPONED
notes:
**Postponed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36-hole stroke play championship for seniors aged 50 and over. Entry fee includes green fees, prize fund, tee gifts and daily lunch.

title: Los Angeles City Men's Match Play Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

18 Hole stroke play qualifying round from which the low 64 players advance to match play. Players USGA index must not have exceeded 4.2 during the months of May, June, July.
courseName: Griffith Park Golf Course - Harding Course

title: Oceanside City Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
One of the older City Amateur Championships in 
Southern California.  36 hole Stroke Play with 
Senior flights (50-59 & 60-69) and a Super Senior flight 
(70&up). Gross and Net prizes. Participants must have 
a valid SCGA or USGA 
handicap.

title: Oceanside Men's City Amateur Championship
notes:
One of the oldest City Championships in 
Southern 
California.  Participants must have valid SCGA or 
USGA Handicap.  Championship 
Flight and 3 Handicap Flights.  36 Hole Stroke 
Play with Gross and Net prizes.

title: New Jersey Women's Public Links Championship
notes:
18-hole stroke play championship is open to female, 
amateur golfers. Entrant must have an ACTIVE and 
VALID USGA Handicap Index
of 30.0 or less through a NJSGA Member Club, which 
is in good standing with the NJSGA, and must 
appear 
on that
club’s Official Handicap Roster. Entrant must NOT 
hold playing privileges, incidental or otherwise, at 
any facility which
is not open to the general public.

title: New Jersey Men's Public Links Championship
notes:
The Championship will be 36-Holes, Stroke-Play. The 
Champion will be the player with the lowest 36 hole 
aggregate
score. The starting field will consist of 40 players, 
plus ties, from the three qualifying sites and
those exempt from qualifying.  Entrant must be a 
permanent resident of New Jersey and must NOT 
hold playing privileges, incidental or otherwise, at 
any facility which is not
open to the general public.

title: The Peninsula Cup
notes:
The Peninsula Cup is a 2-person Better Ball Invitational 
comprised of Mid-Amateur and Senior Amateur 
Divisions.  The Peninsula Cup takes place over 3 days 
with a practice round and two 18-hole competition 
rounds.  The Overall Champions earn an Honorary 
Membership for a year at the Kingsley Club.

notes:

annually at the

Amateur, Senior, Super 
Senior, and Numbered Flights that are based on

notes:
The Resorters is one of Minnesota’s largest and most

divisions: Men's Champion, Men's 
Regular, Men's Executive, Men's Senior, Men's 
Masters, Ladies Regular, Ladies Executive, Ladies 
Combo,

title: Eddie Hogan Cup Team Matches - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The Hogan Cup 36-hole team matches pit the best junior golfers from the Western United States and Canada against each other in a team format with the three lowest scores each day determining the team total. Awards are presented to the top three teams as well as the top three individuals in the field.

Matches are held at Riverside CC, named in honor of Eddie Hogan, the long time Golf Professional at Riverside who was the victim of a drowning accident in 1968. The four man teams use their three lowest 18 hole scores each day to determine their team total. Medals are awarded to the top three teams as well as the top three individuals in the field.

title: Florida Junior Amateur Match Play Championship
notes:
**For 2020, this will be a 54-hole stroke play championship.

This match play invitation-only event features the top junior golfers ages 13-18. Boys 16-18 play on one course, and boys 13- 15 and all girls play on another. Invitations are based on the Junior Championship and Florida Junior Tour (FJT) rankings.

title: Washington Senior & Super Senior Men's Amateur Championship
notes:
54-hole gross stroke play competition (overall 
and by age division). Senior Division 55 years of 
age or older. Super Senior Division 65 years of 
age or older.

title: Santa Barbara County Championship
notes:
La Purisima Golf Course is the host of the 
Santa Barbara County Championship. This 
36 
hole amateur  event typically boasts a 
large 
number of entries in the Championship 
Flight 
but also fields a Handicap Flight. Located 
15 
minutes west of Hwy 101 just outside of 
Lompoc, California, La Purisima is known 
for its 
fair but rigorous test of pure golf that has 
challenged PGA Tour Qualifiers and earned 
a 
spot on Golf Magazine's Top 100 Places to 
Play 
in the United States. It is the only course 
in 
California between Monterrey and Simi 
Valley 
to be named to this prestigious list.

title: Palm Beach County Bobby Bryant Championship
notes:
Open to all PBCGA members and non-members. 
Format is 36-holes of stroke play with Open, Senior 
(50-59), and Super Senior (60+) divisions. This 
tournament is named in memory of the late Bobby 
Bryant, a former PBCGA president, long-time 
executive 
board member and five-time Volunteer of the Year. 
He 
was inducted into the PBCGA Hall of Fame in 2001.
courseName: PGA Golf Club in PGA Village - Dye Course

title: New Jersey Senior Four-Ball Championship
notes:
18-hole four-ball stroke play championship for senior

title: Florida Cup Challenge Matches
notes:
Held every two years, the Florida Cup 
Matches vie 16 of the top amateurs from 
North Florida versus 16 of the top 
amateurs from South Florida. Using a 
Ryder-Cup format, the winner is 
determined by the number of points 
earned throughout the two days. Players 
are invited based on their performance 
from the previous two seasons. Some 
automatic selections are based on the 
FSGA two-year point's standings.

title: Women's World Amateur Team Golf Championship (Espirito Santo Trophy) - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

In 1958 the United States Golf Association asked The R&A to join them in sponsoring a world-wide amateur golf team event to be played biennially in non-Walker Cup years. Between 35 and 40 nations were represented at the first meeting and President Dwight D. Eisenhower presented the trophy which bears his name. The committee of the event was to be known as the World Amateur Golf Council and is now the International Golf Federation. Teams of four players from each country competed over 72 holes with the leading three scores from each round to count. The first competition was held between 29 nations at St Andrews, with Australia beating the United States in a play-off. In 2002 the format changed to teams of three with the two leading scores to count.

title: British Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
**For 2020, the starting field will be 100 players, from which exactly 64 players will advance to match play using a card count back to break ties.

This championship, along with the US Women’s Amateur Golf Championship, is considered the most important in women’s amateur golf.

The first stage of the Championship involves 144 players each of whom plays two rounds of 18 holes. The 64 lowest scores over the 36 holes will compete in the match play stage of the Championship. Each match will consist of one round of 18 holes, including the Final.

The ‘Pam Barton Memorial Salver’ is awarded to the winner of the Championship, while the runner- up receives The Diana Fishwick Cup. An international team award is presented after the stroke play qualifying rounds.

title: Senior British Open Championship
notes:
The Senior British Open Championship has been 
part of the European Seniors Tour since 1987 
and from 2003 is included in the Champions 
Tour as one of the five major world events in 
senior golf. The event is jointly administered by 
the European Seniors Tour and The R&A. 
Previous winners include former Open 
champions Gary Player, Bob Charles and Tom 
Watson.

title: Golfweek Senior Amateur Championship
Texas Shootout
notes:
This Ryder Cup-style team event is the final tournament of the Texas Golf Association competitive amateur golf season. Each team consists of 8 players who qualify for their respective teams via TGA State and Regional Player of the Year points accumulated throughout the TGA season.

Eligibility: The field will be made up of 16 competitors, 8 players from each region (North / South). Of the 8 players chosen from each region, 5 players will be selected from the TGA Statewide Player of the Year point standings, and 3 players will be selected from the TGA Regional Player of the Year point standings. All statewide players will have up to the completion of the current year USGA Mid Amateur Championship to earn points toward the event. All Regional players will have up to the completion of the Regional Mid Amateur Championship to earn points towards the event. If a player qualifies by both criteria, he will be selected based on the higher rank. The next highest ranked player from within the Regional or Statewide points will be added to ensure 5 players from the statewide rankings and three players from the Regional rankings will be chosen.

Format: Ryder Cup format: Four-ball Matches, Foursome (Alternate shot) Matches, and Singles Matches. 3 point system, 1 point for the winner of each nine holes, and 1 point for the overall match winner

title: West Texas Amateur Championship
notes:
Eligibility: Entries are open to male amateur golfers who reside in either region (North/South) of the state of Texas. Applicants must have a certified GHIN Handicap Index of 10.0 or less. Senior division players must be 55 years of age as of the first round of tournament play. Super Senior players must be 65 years of age as of the first round of tournament play.

Format/Field Size and Cut: The championship will be contested over 54 holes of stroke play with three (3) divisions; Championship, Senior and Super Senior. Each division will play from separate tees/yardages and separate champions will be recognized in each division. At the conclusion of 36 holes the field will be cut to the low 72 players (and ties), with a pro-rated representation from each division. The pro-rated allocation of players making the cut from each division will be reflective of the number of players in each division, relative to the total field size. The determination of total field size, number of players in each division and pro-rated representation of players making the cut (before ties) will be announced in conjunction with pairings being posted.

The field is limited to 144, as outlined below:
Championship: Open (84 players)
Senior: 55 & Over (42 players)
Super Senior: 65 & Over (18 players)

title: Texas Women's Partnership - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Eligibility: Entries are open to female amateur golfers with a certified GHIN Handicap Index.

Format: Play will be contested over 36 holes using a quota system. Teams will be pre-flighted based on the two players' combined handicap indexes (Revision Date - April 1, 2019). Quotas will be determined based on players' course handicap. Points earned by each partner will be combined for the team total. Each player's quota will be adjusted 50% on the final day.

Points: Over a Double Bogey = 0 points; Double Bogey = 1 point; Bogey = 2 points; Par = 3 points; Birdie = 5 points; Eagle = 8 points; Double Eagle = 10 points; Hole in One = 12 points

title: Texas Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
Eligibility: Entries are open to female amateur golfers with a certified GHIN Handicap index.

Player Field: Lowest handicap indexes in multiples of 8 with a maximum of 88 players. In the event the championship becomes over-subscribed, entries will be accepted in order of handicap index.

Format: The starting field will consist of 88 total players. The 32 players with the lowest qualifying scores will fill the championship flight and contend for the championship title. The qualifying round is optional for all but the players with the 32 lowest handicap indexes on the date the entries close. The 16 players eliminated in the first round of the championship flight match play may participate in an 18-hole stroke play consolation round. The remaining players will be flighted into seven flights of eight based on handicap indexes. The four players eliminated in the first round of flight matches will proceed to a consolation match play bracket for each flight.

title: Texas Women's Senior Stroke Play Championship
notes:
Eligibility: Entries are open to female amateur golfers with a certified GHIN Handicap Index, and who are 50 years of age or older by the first round of the Championship.

Player Field: The starting field will consist of 96 players. In the event the championship becomes over-subscribed, entries will be accepted in order of handicap index.

Format: The championship will be a 54 hole stroke play championship. Upon completion of Round 2, the field will be broken into flights based on 36-hole scores.

notes:

notes:

title: Tri-State Matches
notes:
The history of the Tri-State Matches dates back to 1907 when the team from Massachusetts was victorious at the Agawam Hunt Club in Providence, Rhode Island.

Since that time, teams from Massachusetts, Rhode Island and Connecticut have come together each fall to compete for the regional title. Individual amateur golfers are selected each year by the respective state golf associations.

title: Women's International Four-Ball Championship
notes:
The Women's International Four-Ball is conducted by the Florida State Golf Association at the Wanderer's Club in Wellington Florida.

Championship Format
- 36 holes of four-ball stroke play, (commonly known as a two-person, best-ball)
- Maximum of 48 total teams
- Two divisions - Championship and Middle Division
- Teams must select their division at the time of entry
- The overall Champion will be the team from the Championship Division with the lowest 36-hole total score

Eligibility
- Female amateur golfers
- Both entrants must be at least 18 years of age as of the first day of the Championship
- A valid USGA Handicap Index not exceeding 18.0 at time of entry
- Entrants are not required to be a member of the FSGA
- Championship Division - At time of entry, all teams in the Championship Division must have a combined team handicap index of 14.0 or less
- Middle Division - 95% of each player's handicap will be used. The course handicap differential between partners may be no more than eight (8) strokes. (If the differential is more than eight (8) strokes, the higher course handicap will be reduced to allow for the difference)

title: Men's World Amateur Team Golf Championship (Eisenhower Trophy) - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

In 1958 the United States Golf Association asked The R&A to join them in sponsoring a world-wide amateur golf team event to be played biennially in non-Walker Cup years. Between 35 and 40 nations were represented at the first meeting and President Dwight D. Eisenhower presented the trophy which bears his name. The committee of the event was to be known as the World Amateur Golf Council and is now the International Golf Federation. Teams of four players from each country competed over 72 holes with the leading three scores from each round to count. The first competition was held between 29 nations at St Andrews, with Australia beating the United States in a play-off. In 2002 the format changed to teams of three with the two leading scores to count.

**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

title: New Jersey Women's Amateur and Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
The Women’s Amateur and Women’s Mid-Amateur Championships will be conducted concurrently.

Women's Amateur: 36 holes of Stroke Play qualifying round to determine placement into the Match Play championship flight of sixteen players.

Women's Mid-Amateur: The Mid-Amateur Champion will be the player age 30 and above with the lowest 36-hole score in Stroke Play qualifying. Players aged 30 and above will automatically be placed into the Mid-Amateur Championship. A Mid-Amateur Player may: 1) Compete in both the Amateur and Mid-Amateur Championships; 2) Compete in only the Mid-Amateur Championship.

title: New Jersey Father & Son Championship
notes:
The Championship consists of 18 Holes, Stroke Play - Gross and Net Scoring. Selected Drive, Alternate- Shot format. The team Handicap is calculated by taking 40% of the father’s plus 40% of the son’s course handicap and combining the two to create a Team Handicap.

Teams are formed by two male amateur players who are father and son, whose individual USGA Handicap Indexes DO NOT exceed 30.0, that are members of any NJSGA member club or course, public or private. Players need NOT be members of the same facility but BOTH must be members of a NJSGA club/course. Entrants must have an ACTIVE and VALID USGA Handicap Index through a NJSGA Member Club (public or private), which is in good standing with the NJSGA, and must appear on that club’s Official Handicap Roster. If a player enters a NJSGA Championship from a public facility or a Club Without Real Estate, he must be a permanent resident of NJ. *A father may not play with more than one son.*

The Honors Matches are a biennial team event between the top players from the SCGA and SCPGA. The inaugural match was played in 2007. title: Missouri Parent-Child Championship
notes:
Eligibility: This competition is open to teams of Father-Son, Father-Daughter, Mother-Son or Mother- Daughter. The minimum age is 12 on the first day of the tournament. At least one team member must live in the State of Missouri. At least one team member must play at clubs or courses who are members of the Missouri Golf Association. At least one member must have a current USGA handicap index.

Flights:
- Open: The top 12 teams with the lowest combined handicaps will compete in this flight. Any team may opt out of this Flight. This flight will play 6 holes scramble, 6 holes alternate shot, 6 holes best ball both days. This flight will compete for Overall Champion.
- Championship: This division will be broken down into several flights based on team handicaps. This flight will play 36 holes Scramble.
- Century: This division is for teams with combined ages of 100 or more. This flight will play 36 holes scramble. Teams in this flight will only be competing against each other.
- Super Senior Flight: This division is for teams when one player is age 70 or older. This flight will play 36 holes scramble. Teams in this flight will only be competing against each other.
- Pro Division Flight: Teams in this flight will play 6 scramble, 6 alternate shot, 6 best ball.

Four-ball matches are followed by foursomes (alternate shot) matches and singles.

Each Fore State Team shall be comprised as follows: four (4) players shall be designated as Amateur players who will be age 39 or less by July 14 of the Championship year; four (4) players shall be designated as Mid- Amateur players who will be age 40 to 59 by July 14 of the Championship year; and four (4) players shall be designated as Master players who will be age 60 or older by July 14 of the Championship year.
