Championship Flight - 5.0 and below
First Flight - 5.1 to 9.0
Second Flight - 9.1 to 15.0

title: Arcola Cup
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament played over a single 
day, with a cut after the first round.

title: Boff Invitational
notes:
36-hole, one-day invitational tournament that honors 
Greg Boff, 
an outstanding Met area golfer killed in a drunk 
driving accident in 1989.

title: Gateway Senior Invitational
notes:
Second tournament of the major senior amateur 
season. 54-hole stroke play tournament with Senior 
(ages 55+), super senior (65+), legends (70+) and 
super legends (75+) divisions.

title: Chanticleer National Senior Invitational
notes:
The Chanticleer National Senior Invitational started in 2011 with the vision that it would provide a superbly conditioned, very challenging course on which to present a premier invitational tournament for elite senior and super senior golfers recognized for their playing accomplishments on a national and international scale. The limited field is determined from the pool of applicants with preference given to players' performance in national and international events as well as the current rankings. As an integral part of our vision, we provide extraordinary hospitality and great value to both our players and their significant others.

The Senior Division competition will be for players 55-64, as well as other older qualified players who may desire to play in this division. The Super Senior division will be for players 65-70, as well as other older qualified players who prefer to play at Chanticleer. There will be a cut after 36 holes. As an option for Legends, we will host a separate 70+ Legends division at our Riverside course provided we have a minimum number of 16 players. There will NOT be a cut.

title: Carson Valley Senior Amateur - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Scratch and Net Divisions. Must be 50 years or older by day of event; 60 and over for Silver Division. Player must appear on the current active list of members for NNGA (Northern Nevada Golf Association) prior to tournament deadline.

title: St. George Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship for men and seniors, 
with gross and net payouts.

title: Washington County Amateur Championship
notes:
36 hole individual stroke play tournament with 
Championship and Senior (age 50+) flights. Gross and 
Net within Championship flight. Max 
handicap 18.

title: Junior America's Cup - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The Junior Americas Cup has showcased some of the best junior golfers throughout the western region. The competition brings together an elite international field of 17 teams of the top four boys representing 12 western states, 2 Canadian Provinces and Mexico competing in a team format. Team results are based on the lowest three gross scores of the four team members. Players also compete for low individual medalist honors.
courseName: The Golf Club at Genoa Lakes

title: Southern Nevada Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play event with Championship, Net, 
Senior (ages 51+) and Silver (61+) divisions. Senior 
and Silver divisions have gross and net prizes. Must be 
a SNGA member.

title: Jones Cup Senior Invitational
notes:
54-hole senior invitational event inaugurated 
in 2012, that follows in the footsteps of the 
Jones Cup, an event that unofficially kicks off 
the amateur circuit each year.
courseName: Sea Island Golf Club - Seaside Course

title: New York Men's Amateur & Senior Amateur Four-Ball Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The format of this championship is 36 holes of four- ball stroke play. Entries are open to teams consisting of two (2) male amateur golfers. Both entrants must be members of the NYSGA and have an active Handicap Index issued by a golf club which is licensed to use the USGA Handicap System.

title: Western Pennsylvania Four-Ball Championship
notes:
Four-Ball is the most common form of play 
in western Pennsylvania. The Association's 
Four-Ball Championship was first played in 
1939, and the winners of the inaugural 
were L.R. Siebert and Jack Benson. The 
Siebert and Benson team also won the 
second in 1940. Originally open only to 
teams with members from the same 
Member Club, the event is now open to 
any players who reside in the western 
Pennsylvania district who meet handicap 
eligibility. The championship is thirty-six 
holes.

Many of the names on the Joseph Shea 
Alexander Memorial Trophy are scattered 
across the record books of our 
championships. Former Amateur 
Champions to be a part of a winning Four-
Ball team include Knox Young, Jack 
Benson, Frank Souchak, Bob Reilly, John 
Birmingham, Frank Fuhrer, III, Marshall 
Marraccini, Sean Knapp, and David Brown.

title: Northern Nevada Capital City Classic
notes:
Scratch and Net divisions.  State Amateur 
Qualifier Scratch is attached to this 
tournament. If you wish to play in the qualifier 
also you will need to use Capital City Classic 
with Qualifier.

title: Pure Insurance Championship at Pebble Beach
notes:
Players from the Champions Tour team up with 
juniors from First Tee chapters all over the 
country in a best ball competition. Formerly the 
Nature 
Valley Open.

title: Nebraska Senior Match Play Championship
notes:
Entries are open to amateur golfers ages 50 and 
over 
who are residents of Nebraska and a member
of the Nebraska Golf Association (NGA).
The field will be limited to 96 players (48 gross & 48 
net). Format is 18-holes of stroke play to determine 
flights and seeds for match play.

title: Southern California Senior Match Play Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The Match Play and Senior Match Play championships began in 2008 as a means of bringing new credence and incentive to the SCGA points program. The SCGA points program awards points to golfers who give strong performances in SCGA, USGA, CGA and other selected outside tournaments. The championship fields consist of 32 players in single elimination match play. The top 24 players on the Senior Match Play Points List earn automatic invitations to compete. The remaining 8 spots into the field are filled through a one day qualifying event. Senior Match Play qualifying is open to members 55 and older with a Handicap Index of 10.4 and below.

title: Minnesota Women's Match Play Championship
notes:
Players in the Open Division must play an 18-hole qualifying round to establish the Championship Flight and all other flight brackets. The top fifteen (15) players from the qualifying round will join the Defending Champion (who will be seeded #1 if entered) to complete the Championship Flight. All other players will be assigned to a flight (of 8) based on qualifying score.

The Senior (age 50+) Championship Flight will be the Defending Champion (who will be seeded #1), the top four (4) players to enter from the previous year's MGA Women's Senior Player Points List and the top three (3) players to enter, not otherwise included, based on lowest handicap index.

title: Minnesota Women's Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play event with championship, 
master 
(65 and over) gross and net, and flighted divisions.

title: Phoenix City Women's Team Championship
notes:
36-hole two-person team tournament for women 
amateurs in the Phoenix Metro area. Day one is a 
modified alternate shot, and day two is best-ball.

title: Hawaii Senior Women's Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

18-Hole flighted Medal Play competition with gross and net prizes.

title: Oklahoma Women's Stableford Partnership - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

18 holes per day NET (stroke play). Field will be divided into flights based on combined handicaps. Overall Low Net award plus Low Net awards in each flight. Players must be 18 years of age by the first day of the tournament. Participants must be a WOGA member and have a current USGA handicap index listed on the member's club/course complete handicap printout sheet unless waived for a specific event. The participant's home club/course must be a WOGA member club/course.

title: Peach Blossom Invitational - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

A premier Four-Ball tournament in Georgia started in 1947. Three rounds of medal play with flights determined after the first two rounds. Par 3 tournament and putting contest held the day before the first round.
courseName: Idle Hour Golf and Country Club

title: Patriot All-America Invitational
notes:
The Wigwam and the Golf Coaches Association of America (GCAA), in partnership with the Folds of Honor Foundation present the Patriot All- America Invitational. It's one of the most unique events in all of golf.

84 top collegiate players named to the PING All- America team in NCAA Division I,II and III, NAIA and NJCAA, AJGA, one player from each military academy and select international players compete in a 54- hole championship.

Each player honors our military by carrying a bag with the name, rank and service of a fallen or severely wounded soldier embroidered on the pocket. Following the championship, the bags go to the players’ school for auction, with proceeds benefiting the Folds of Honor.

title: Fort Worth Junior Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Format is 36 holes stroke play. For juniors aged 8 to 17, flighted by age. No county restrictions, open to all juniors.
courseName: Pecan Valley Golf Course - Hills Course

title: Granite Bay Four-Ball Championship
notes:
36-hole better-ball played at scratch. 
Regular and senior division. To compete in senior 
division both players must be 55 by date of 
tournament. Maximum handicap 7.4. Field 
Limited to the First 50 Teams. NCGA points event.

title: Ohio Women's Amateur & Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
18 holes of stroke play to determine a championship 
bracket and flighted brackets. Open and mid-
amateur 
divisions. Entries are open to amateur golfers who 
are 
legal residents of Ohio prior to entry deadline.

title: Ohio Women's Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole flighted stroke play championship for women 
seniors. Entries are open to amateur golfers who are 
legal residents of Ohio prior to entry deadline.

title: Australian Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
The Australian Women's Amateur Championship is contested over 36-holes stroke play qualifying, with the leading 32 players progressing to elimination match play. It is open to players of all ages with an initial field size of 72 players.

It was first played in 1894 and past winners include touring professionals Nikki Campbell, Sarah Oh and Kristie Smith.

title: Nebraska Women's Pinehurst
notes:
Started in 2018, this is a 36-hole competition comprised of two- person teams. In Pinehurst, each partner plays from the teeing ground and then plays their partner’s ball for their second shot. After the second shot, partners select the ball with which they wish to score and play that ball alternately to complete the hole. Team Handicap in Pinehurst combines 60 percent of the lower player’s Course Handicap and 40 percent of the higher player’s Course Handicap.

Players must be a current member of NWAGA, except for Qualified Juniors. Upon receipt of a Valid Entry, any Qualified Junior (defined as a member of NJGT and with a Handicap index of 20.0 or less), may compete in NWAGA events. Each Player must have an active USGA Handicap index.

title: Nebraska Women's Four-Ball Championship
notes:
36-hole net four-ball stroke play event. Tournament 
field is limited to the first 50 teams. Players must be a 
current member of NWAGA. Each Player must have an 
active USGA Handicap index.

title: Nebraska Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
Limited to the first 60 entries. Format is 54 holes of 
stroke play with multiple flights. Players must be a 
current member of NWAGA, except for Qualified 
Juniors. Upon receipt of a Valid Entry, any Qualified 
Junior (defined as a member of NJGT and with a 
Handicap index of 20.0 or less), may compete in 
NWAGA events. Each Player must have an active USGA 
Handicap index.

title: Nebraska Women's Match Play Championship
notes:
First played in 1916, this championship begins with 
an 
18-hole qualifying round followed by a round of 16 
match play. Players must be a current member of 
NWAGA, except for Qualified Juniors. Upon receipt of 
a Valid Entry, any Qualified Junior (defined as a 
member of NJGT and with a Handicap index of 20.0 
or less), may compete in NWAGA events. Each 
Player 
must have an active USGA Handicap index.

title: Nebraska Women's Senior Championship
notes:
This event is a three day four-ball style event, with 
partners the first two days and an individual stroke 
play 
the third day. All three days of competition are 
stroke 
play with the four-ball format. Players must be a 
current member of NWAGA. Each Player must have 
an 
active USGA Handicap index.

title: Jacques Leglise Trophy - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

An annual boys' team competition between Great Britain & Ireland and the Continent of Europe. The nine player teams compete over two days in foursomes and single matches

title: Lamkin San Diego Classic
notes:
Collegiate event hosted by San Diego State and 
played at their home course, San Diego Country 
Club. Team (best four scores of five players each 
day) 
and individual competitions.

title: Timuquana Cup Invitational
notes:
Invitational tournament with a field consisting of 40 of the top Mid Amateur players in the country, together with 20 of the top Senior Amateurs and 18 more Super Senior amateurs .

The theme of the event will be a "Gathering of Friends" with a small, select field dedicated to those individuals whose passion is amateur golf. The Timuquana Cup will be a celebration of amateur golf.

The tournament chairman is Steve Melnyk, and USGA Rules Official Tom Dudley will be in charge of course set up and the rules of competition. One of the highlights of this year's event will be a cocktail cruise on the St. Johns River departing from the Timuquana Country Club dock and housing will be available for many competitors in members' homes.

title: Dan L. Lanier Memorial Invitational - POSTPONED
notes:
**Postponed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36 hole stroke play. Will have a regular, senior and super senior division. A points tournament for the Skeadas Cup.

title: Golden Isles Invitational
notes:
The Golden Isles Invitational dates back to 1949. That year, 'Dynamite' Goodloe claimed the inaugural championship - marking the beginning of a long-standing tradition at Brunswick Country Club. Through the years, this event has gained notoriety and popularity and continues to attract players of all ages and ability levels.

The Golden Isles Invitational is traditionally played over the July 4th holiday week and many players and their families travel to Brunswick and St. Simons to enjoy the golf, the beach and the celebration of our nation's independence. Invitations are mailed out the first week of May.

title: Norfolk County Classic
notes:
Invitation only 36 hole stroke play event 
that caters to amateurs throughout New England.

title: Norfolk County Four-Ball Classic
notes:
36-hole Four-Ball invitational tournament catering 
to 
amateurs throughout New England.

title: Riverside Best-Ball Tournament
notes:
The Riverside Best Ball is one of the 
oldest invitational golf tournaments in 
the Pacific Northwest, having been first played in 
1939.  Played 
on one of 
the Northwest’s classic and historic golf 
courses, the Riverside Best Ball has 
attracted some of the region’s best 
amateurs during its history. Format is 36-hole of 
four-ball stroke play.

title: Australian Boys Amateur - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The Australian Boys' Amateur Championship is open to players aged under 18 years on the first day of play. It is contested over 72-holes stroke play (cut after 36-holes). The first Australian Boys’ Amateur Championship was played in 1982 over 54-holes stroke play for players under 21 years of age. Past winners include Adam Scott, Jason Day, Stuart Appleby, Ryan Ruffels and Robert Allenby.

title: The Junior Invitational at Sage Valley
notes:
The Junior Invitational at Sage Valley's mission 
is to operate the most prestigious junior golf 
championship in the world—an invitation-only 
annual event for the top 54 players from 
around the globe, hosted by the renowned Sage 
Valley Golf Club. The event is held each year the first 
full week after the Masters.

title: Arnold Palmer Cup Matches
notes:
The annual Ryder Cup-style competition features top men and women collegiate players from the United States against their International counterparts.

Each team will be comprised of 12 men's and 12 women's golfers. Day one will feature Mixed Four-Ball competition, day two will see Mixed Foursomes in the morning and Four-Ball in the afternoon, with 24 singles matches on the final day.

title: Sir Michael Bonallack Trophy - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Biennial "Ryder Cup" style event between European amateurs and Asia/Pacific amateurs, with 12 on each team. There are three days of play. The first two days comprise five foursomes matches each morning and five four-ball matches each afternoon. On the final day, all twelve team players compete in singles match play. A win counts as one point, a half yields half a point and a lost match returns zero. In the event of a tie, the trophy shall be retained by the holders.

title: Carolinas Open Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play. The field will be reduced to the 
low 60 contestants (or 1/3 of the field if 140 or less) 
and ties after 36 holes. Open to CPGA Members and 
Apprentices who are otherwise eligible as prescribed 
by the CPGA Tournament Rules and Regulations and 
Amateurs who reside in North or South Carolina and 
have a current USGA Handicap Index of 5.5 or less 
at the time of entry deadline, verified by a CPGA 
Professional.

title: Belle Haven Four-Ball - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Each year, 90 two-man teams compete in the three-round Belle Haven Four Ball. Each two-man team plays better ball, stroke play, at scratch. If the tournament is oversubscribed, exempt teams are accepted first and then the committee fills the field based on the golf accomplishments and resumes of the applicants.

title: The Magnolia Amateur
notes:
The Magnolia Amateur is a limited field event of 156 players consisting of a collegiate division and a mid-amateur division. The field will be cut to the low 60 players and ties after 36 holes of competition has been completed. The overall champion may come from either division, with the competition taking place over 3 days and 54 holes.

Along with the individual tournament, there is a college team competition that will be based on the combined scores of two players on the same team over the 3 rounds.

It is an exclusive amateur tournament, where players are reviewed and accepted by the Tournament Committee.

title: Georgia Senior Match Play Championship
notes:
Open to male amateur golfers age 55 or older for the Senior Division and age 65 or older for the Super Senior Division as of the first day of the competition.

Field: 120 players with the lowest USGA Handicap Indexes

Format: Match play preceded by 36 holes of stroke play qualifying; low 16 players advance to match play in both divisions if there are at least 32 entries in that division; otherwise, eight players.

title: Future Champions Golf International Junior Championship
notes:
Founded in 2008 by PGA Teaching Professional 
Chris Smeal as the ultimate preparation event 
to compete in prior to Junior World. Creates 
an 
opportunity for local and international players 
to compete in an event prior to the Junior 
World to get the kinks out and know where 
your game is and what needs work prior to the 
Main Event. All winners gain exemptions into the 
Junior World Championship.
courseName: Singing Hills Resort - Willow Glen Course

title: Future Champions Golf Callaway World Championship
notes:
Stroke play championship for invited and qualified 
boys 
and girls with the following age divisions: 15-18, 13-
14, 11-12, 9-10, 8 and under.

title: Wisconsin Junior Girls' Match Play Championship
notes:
Match play championship for junior girls. Open to 
Wisconsin residents or members of a club in the 
Wisconsin Section PGA, age 12-18 on the day of the 
tournament.

title: AJGA Invitational
notes:
72-hole invitational stroke play championship for boys 
aged 12-19. Cut after 54 holes. Almost 100 past 
participants have made the jump from playing the 
AJGA Invitational at Sedgefield to the PGA Tour. Past 
champions include 12-time PGA Tour winner Justin 
Thomas and 2-time winner Brian Harman.

title: The Harmon Invitational Four-Ball Tournament - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Four person club-team event honoring Butch Harmon that puts some of the top golf clubs in the country against each other; Winged Foot, Seminole, Pine Valley, and of course the home course Floridian are represented. Head professionals compete with three amateurs.

title: U.S. Junior Amateur Qualifying - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The U.S. Junior qualifier is open to all competitors with an index of 4.4 or lower who haven't reached their 19th birthday by the last date of the championship. Format is 18-holes of stroke play with the number of qualifiers dependent on the size of field. Qualifying sites scattered across the U.S.
courseName: Various sites across the United States

title: U.S. Girls' Junior Amateur Qualifying - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The U.S. Girls' Junior qualifier is open to all competitors with an index of 9.4 or lower who haven't reached their 19th birthday by the last date of the championship. Format is 18-holes of stroke play with the number of qualifiers dependent on the size of field. Qualifying sites scattered across the U.S.
courseName: Various sites across the United States

title: Yorba Linda City Championship
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play tournament open 
to all 
amateur golfers with a USGA 
handicap index and who are 15 years of age or 
older. 
Senior flight for those aged 55 and 
older. Players assigned to flights based on 
handicap 
index. Championship flight handicap 
index limit is 4.9; for women's and senior 
championship flights it is 7.9.

title: Army Invitational Golf Tournament - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

54 hole stroke play event with a cut after 36 holes. Flights: Championship, Mid-Amateur Flight (age 25+), “A” Flight, “B” Flight, “C” Flight. Entrants must be at least 13 years of age. U.S. Army and civilians are invited to play.

title: Greater Jacksonville Amateur Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play tournament with a 36-hole cut to 
the low half of the field plus ties. Open to those 
players with an 
index 
of 6.0 or less. There will be a maximum of 78 
players 
in the 
field. The majority of players reside in JAGA’s North 
Florida region, with entries accepted from up to 15 
players who reside outside the region (in Florida and 
elsewhere).

title: Florida Senior Open Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Fifty-four holes of individual stroke play. The field will be cut to the low sixty and ties after thirty-six holes. The lowest score for 54 holes will be the Champion. Open to male Florida Golf Professionals and Amateurs at least 50 years of age who are residents of Florida. For amateurs, a valid USGA Handicap Index not exceeding 6.4 at time of entry is required.

title: Country Club of North Carolina Amateur
notes:
72-hole stroke play event with a cut after 36 holes to 
the low 40 players and ties. The 
collegiate/amateur 
tournament, presented by the Tarheel Golf 
Foundation, will be played on the 
championship Dogwood course. The Dogwood 
has hosted many CGA and USGA events, 
including six Southern Amateurs and a US 
Amateur.
courseName: Country Club of North Carolina - Dogwood Course

title: St. Andrews Trophy
notes:
An biennial men's team competition between 
Great Britain & Ireland and the Continent of Europe 
played during non Walker Cup years. The nine 
player teams compete over two days in 
foursomes and single matches.

title: Captain’s Putter Team Matches
notes:
The Captain’s Putter is an annual set of matches 
pitting top golfers from North 
Carolina and South Carolina (Carolinas Golf 
Association) against top players 
from Virginia and West Virginia (Virginia State Golf 
Association and West 
Virginia State Golf Association). Rosters contain 14 
regular, 8 senior (age 55+) 
and 2 super senior (65+) players. The matches 
consist of two days of 
competition, with opening round four-ball and 
foursome matches, followed by 
final day singles matches. A victory in each match 
scores one point in the 
Ryder Cup-style format, and if a match goes 18 
holes without a decision, one-half point is awarded to 
each side.

title: Northern California Women's Swingin' Seniors Tournament - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Four Ball Stroke Play – two day better ball of partners - Stableford Competition (95% handicap). Swingin’ Seniors is open to members age 70 and up. Entrant must be a member of WGANC and a member of the 18- hole women’s group at her club. USGA Handicap Index: 36.0 (over 40 handicap must play to a 40).

title: George L. Coleman Senior Invitational - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak. Next event will be in 2022.

Senior Division of one of the very best amateur events all year long played on the last great private course designed by Donald Ross. The course, not long by today's standards, lies hard by the Atlantic Ocean. Oceanic winds and very fast greens give this course teeth. Ben Hogan once said 'If you can play Seminole, you can play any course in the world.'

The tournament is a 54-hole stroke play invitational that draws an elite field of mid-amateurs and seniors.

title: French-American Challenge
notes:
The French-American Challenge is a biennial competition between top players from the Metropolitan Golf Association (MGA) and the Ligue de Paris, pitting against each other the top amateurs from the New York City metro area and Paris.

Four-ball, foursomes and singles matches are contested between the six-man, four-woman teams.

title: Northern California Senior Match Play Championship
notes:
The NCGA Senior Match Play Championship was historically an invite-only event in which the top 16 players on the NCGA Senior points list were invited to participate in the Senior Match Play Championship, held concurrently with the NCGA Amateur Match Play at Spyglass Hill, over a three- day period. However, beginning in 2012 the event was modified to a 32-player match play field, still allotting 16 spots to the top 16 of the NCGA Senior points list, while allowing the other half of the field to qualify.

Senior players (ages 55+) must have a handicap index of 7.4 or less. There is no handicap limit for super seniors (ages 65+).

title: Cape Cod Amateur Championship
notes:
Open to male amateur golfers. One round of stroke 
play determines the round of 32 match play bracket 
to be completed over two weekends. Senior division 
has a match play bracket of 16 players.

title: Mississippi Cup Matches
notes:
Team matches between the Mississippi Golf Association and the Gulf States PGA.

Eligibility: Invitation Only. Team will be made up of 12 competitors, 10 regular and 2 senior players. The team is selected from the player of the year points from the previous year. The top 9 non-college regular players along with a captain's pick make up 10 players. The top 2 Senior players.

Format: Four-Ball Match Play, Foursome (Alternate shot) Match Play, and Singles Match Play. Each match is worth 1 point.

title: Turlock Two-Man Championship
notes:
NCGA points event with championship, senior, super 
senior 
and handicap flights. Format is 36-holes of four-ball 
stroke play.

title: Eden Tournament - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36 hole qualifying scratch and handicap match play tournament – for gentleman golfers with a handicap not exceeding 15 – 240 places.

First played in 1919, the Eden Tournament for gentleman golfers became one of the most important events in the Scottish calendar and has remained a popular amateur event for many local and visiting golfers to St Andrews. The competitors play qualifying rounds on the New and Eden Courses before the match play stages for both scratch and handicap conclude on the Eden Course, with consolation events on the Strathtyrum and Jubilee Courses.

The golfers compete for prestigious trophies including the Eden Trophy, presented by the former Town Council of St Andrews, the Duke of York Cup, presented in 1933 by the then Duke of York, and the Victory Cup, presented in 1919 by Lt Col Bethune as Captain of The Royal and Ancient Golf Club.

title: Strathyrum Tournament - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36 hole qualifying scratch and handicap match play tournament – for lady golfers with a handicap not exceeding 28 – 102 places.

This ladies tournament was first played in 1989 to complement the success of the Eden Tournament and attracts many lady golfers who compete in the same competition format as the men’s event.

The Strathtyrum Trophy, presented by the Cheape family, owners of the Strathtyrum Estate, is awarded to the scratch winner with the Strathtyrum Salver awarded to the handicap winner.

title: Carolinas Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
The championship is conducted at 54 holes of stroke play (no cut). All players, regardless of Handicap Index, have the option to play in the Championship Division or the Carolinas Division. The Overall Champion will be determined from the contestants playing in the Championship Division. Awards will also be given for the low senior in the Championship and Carolinas divisions (age 50-64), the low Super Senior in the Carolinas Division (ages 65 and older), and the medalist in the Championship Division (low score after 36 holes).

Entry is open to any female amateur golfer who has reached her 13th birthday by the first day of the championship, is a legal resident of North Carolina or South Carolina, is a member in good standing of a club which is a member of the Carolinas Golf Association and has an active USGA Handicap Index at a CGA member club that does not exceed 40.4.

title: Hardscrabble Four-Ball Invitational
notes:
Teams are primarily comprised of members of 
the 
club and their guests. Invitations are extended 
to 
teams of non-members to fill the balance of 
the tournament. 54-hole four-ball stroke play event.

title: The Railer, Kansas Stroke Play Championship
notes:
Must be a member of the Kansas Golf 
Association. 54 holes of individual stroke play with 
two 
age divisions: Open (any age) and Senior (age 
50+).  
Overall Champion to be determined in each division.

title: Palmetto Cup Matches
notes:
The Palmetto Cup Matches, the annual grudge match between South Carolina’s best amateurs and club professionals, has become one of the top team competitions of the year.

The Palmetto Cup matches feature 14 regular South Carolina Golf Association amateurs and four senior amateurs, competing against the top 18 South Carolina Professional Golf Association pros, four of those being senior players as well. The amateurs, along with the pros, are selected by points earned in each association’s major events throughout the year.

The matches have two forms of competition involved in the two-day event. The first day, matches features a Four Ball format while the second day is being played as Captain's Choice matches. The scoring system allows for three points a match for a total of 54 points available.

title: Harry Bartholomew Four-Ball
notes:
Connecticut's premier four ball match play event has a who's-who list of past champions that includes all the state's best players. The tournament is played in honor of Harry Bartholomew, one of the founding members of the Central Connecticut Golf Association who was instrumental in the expansion of the course and establishing a affordable golf club. In 1945 the Pinehurst (NC) Outlook recognized Mr. Bartholomew by publishing the following: “Harry Bartholomew is one of too few individuals who long ago decided that golf is such a grand game that working men ought to be come acquainted with. He founded a working man’s golf Club in Bristol, Connecticut – The Pequabuck Golf Club”.

Friday - 18-Holes Better Ball of 2 gross qualifying with the low 64 teams advancing to match play. (4 Flights of 16 teams per Flight)

72 holes of Stroke Play, with the low 32 scores and ties after 36 Holes qualifying for weekend play. There also Mid-Amateur, Senior, and Women's divisions.

Contestants must be a resident of one of the following counties: Auglaize, Butler, Champaign, Clark, Clinton, Darke, Greene, Logan, Mercer, Miami, Montgomery, Preble, Shelby, or Warren.

title: Miami Valley Senior Metropolitan and Mid-Amateur Championships
notes:
36 holes of Stroke Play.

Senior Contestants must be 50 years old on the first day of championship. Mid-Amateur Contestants must be 25 years old on the first day of championship.

All contestants must be residents of one of the following counties: Auglaize, Butler, Champaign, Clark, Clinton, Darke, Greene, Logan, Mercer, Miami, Montgomery, Preble, Shelby, or Warren.

DIVISIONS OF PLAY: Mid-Amateur, Overall Senior, Ages 65-74, Ages 75 & Older Ages 60-69 and Ages 70 and over.

title: Northern Kentucky Amateur Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play event open to amateurs who are 
members of the GCGA. Championship (27 holes each 
day) and Senior (18 holes each day) divisions.

title: Northern Kentucky Four-Ball Championship
notes:
18 holes of four-ball stroke play open to teams of 
amateurs who are members of the GCGA. 
Championship, Women and Senior divisions.

title: Zigfield Troy Open Par-3 Tournament
notes:
A 36 hole stroke play event, entries are open to Professional or Amateur golfers with USGA handicap indexes not exceeding 24.4. Handicaps shall be certified by the entrant’s club official or Golf Professional. Open to men and women having attained 16 years of age by the start of the tournament. The Zigfield Troy Open Tournament Committee reserves the right to grant special exceptions to the above conditions.

Players will compete in 5 Divisions - Open Division, Women's, Senior’s (ages 55-64), Super Senior’s (65 and up) and High School. The overall champion wins the Zigfield Troy Straw Hat.

title: Illinois State Scramble - POSTPONED
notes:
**Postponed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

This 36 hole two-person scramble is played at scratch. The winners are determined by low gross score. All golfers are eligible to register for this tournament. Payouts will be in the form of merchandise credit and will be awarded to approximately one-third of the field. In addition, there will be an optional skins game at $40 per team per day.
courseName: Village Greens of Woodridge Golf Course

title: Greater Omaha Golf Championship
notes:
36 holes of stroke play, maximum 144 player 
field. Six flights including Championship and Senior, 
flighted by handicap.

title: Mobile Metro Championship
notes:
72-hole individual stroke play event, with 54 holes for 
the senior division.

title: Lincoln Men's City Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play event. Open to players 16 and older 
who live within a 30 mile radius of Lincoln. A current 
U.S.G.A. handicap will be required to enter the event.

title: Lincoln Senior City Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship for seniors and 
super seniors. A player may declare the 
Championship Flight
or be placed in an appropriate flight based on
their handicap index. Players with a handicap
index of 4.0 or less will automatically be
placed in the Championship Flight. Play within
Championship flight will be scratch. Play in all
other flights will be gross and net divisions. Must 
live within a 30 mile radius of Lincoln.

title: Des Moines City Amateur Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play championship held at Waveland 
Golf Course, the oldest municipal golf course west of 
the Mississippi. Open and Senior flighted divisions.

title: Lubbock City Amateur Championship
notes:
54-hole individual stroke play tournament, with 
Championship, Open and Second flights, as well as a 
Senior flight.

title: Salt Lake City Amateur Championship
notes:
One of the most popular tournaments in Utah that 
always fills up quickly. Most of the state’s top 
amateurs 
will be in the 100-player championship flight, with 
another 100 or so in the A and B flights. 36 holes of 
stroke play.

title: Greater Albuquerque Men's City Championship
notes:
54 holes of stroke play played on three courses. All 
players must live or work in 
the greater Albuquerque area, and have an active 
GHIN#. Championship, President's, Senior (50+) and 
Net Flights.

title: The Columbia City Golf Tournament - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

54 holes of stroke play with 36 hole cut; amateur, senior (ages 55+), super senior (ages 65+) and professional divisions. All players must be residents of Richland or Lexington County, SC (Note: The Committee reserves the right to exempt former champions and others who reside in counties adjacent to Richland and Lexington Counties.)
courseName: The Spur at Northwoods Golf Club

title: West of England Open Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

54-hole individual medal play open amateur championship for low handicap players.

title: Florida Women's Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
Championship Format
- 36 holes of individual stroke play
- 84 total competitors
- Three Divisions - Championship, Middle and Forward
- Players must select their division at the time of entry, as long as they meet the eligibility requirements.
- The Overall Champion will be the individual from the Championship Division with the lowest 36-hole total score.

Eligibility
- Female amateur golfer
- At least 25 years of age as of the first day of the Championship
- A valid Florida GHIN Handicap Index not exceeding 34.0
- Entrant is required to be a member of the FSGA

title: Bermuda Stroke Play Championship
notes:
54 hole national stroke play event. Open to members in 
good standing of the Bermuda Golf Association and any 
overseas visitor to Bermuda with an up-to-date 
handicap index.

title: World Par 3 Championship
notes:
An international field featuring former Ryder Cup players, PGA and European Tour winners and some of the best club professionals from the United States, Australia and Canada highlight the World Par 3 Championship in Bermuda.

Professionals and Amateurs compete. From the Tournament Website:

The world’s premier par 3 tournament, hosted on one of the top five par-3 courses in the world, The World Par 3 Championship is one of the most exciting events in Bermuda's golf calendar. The tournament attracts over 190 players made up of qualified Bermudian golfers, noted professional golfers, and golf enthusiasts from over 20 countries. The tournament is a 36 hole stroke play individual competition, with both professional and amateur, women's and senior divisions.
courseName: Fairmont Southampton Turtle Hill Golf Club

title: Hong Kong Seniors Open Amateur Championship
notes:
1) The Hong Kong Seniors Open Amateur Championship will be decided by stroke play over three rounds, which will be played in accordance with the Rules of Golf as approved by the Royal & Ancient Rules Limited and with the Local Rules approved by the Tournament Committee.

2) Entries will be accepted from male amateur players who have reached the age of 55. The handicap limit for those aged 55-64 is 12 (or USGA index of 12.3). The handicap limit for players of 65 or over is 15 (USGA index of 15.3).

3) The 50 lowest scores over 36 holes and any tying for the 50th place will qualify for the final 18 holes.

title: Louisiana Women's Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
36 hole individual stroke play event for women mid-
ams and seniors, with flights in each division 
determined by handicap.

title: Louisiana Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
State championship for Louisnana women amateurs. 18 
holes of stroke play qualifying to determine match play 
brackets. Consolation brackets in each flight.

title: Louisiana Women's Four-Ball Championship
notes:
36-hole flighted four-ball stroke play championship with 
gross and net competitions in each flight.
courseName: The Atchafalaya At Idlewild Golf Course

title: Spartanburg County Amateur Championship
notes:
54 hole stroke play tournament with one division 
and 
no cut. Benefits First Tee of the Upstate.

title: LANCO Amateur Championship
notes:
36 hole Individual Stroke Play open to residents of 
Lancaster County, Pennsylvania.
Field cut to the low 40% and ties after round 
one.
In case of a tie, there will be a 3 hole playoff 
(daylight permitting).
All play will be from the championship tees.
Field is limited to 140 players (first come-first 
serve basis).

title: LANCO Better-Ball Championship
notes:
36 hole Better Ball Gross Stroke Play. Open to 
residents 
of Lancaster County, Pennsylvania
Flights will be based on team handicap.
All play will be from the back tees.
The overall Champion can come from any flight.
Field is limited to 60 teams (first come-first 
serve basis).

title: Harrisburg District Individual Championship
notes:
36 holes: Open to all amateur golfers 16 years 
of age or older residing or maintaining a 
handicap with HDGA member clubs or affiliate 
member clubs. Maximum handicap index is 9.0.

title: York County Amateur Championship
notes:
36 Hole: Individual stroke play over 36 holes 
with the field being cut to the low 40 and ties 
after 18 holes.
Eligibility:  Must hold current handicap at 
YCAGA 
member club or be a resident of York County 
with a current USGA Handicap issued by a 
USGA 
Certified Club .  Field is limited to 120 players.  
Field will be determined by the low handicap 
indexes.

title: Beaver Brook Invitational
notes:
36 holes of stroke play with championship (ages 50 
and 
over), 
senior, and regular divisions. Regular division will be 
flighted based on first round score.

title: Knox County Amateur Championship
notes:
36 holes of stroke play with 5 different flights. 
Championship and senior flights must declare 
prior to rounds. Celebrated its 25th year 
anniversary in 2017.

title: Greater Knoxville Amateur Championship
notes:
54 holes of stroke play played at three 
different 
area golf courses. Open to residents and members of 
clubs in the following counties: Knox, Blount, Loudon, 
Anderson, Roane, Cumberland, Sevier, Jefferson.

title: Wake County Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36 holes of stroke play. Championship and senior divisions, along with other flighted divisions. Open to all golfers; not restricted to Wake County residents.

title: Wayne County Men’s Amateur Championship
notes:
54 holes of stroke play. Open, senior, super senior 
and 
masters divisions. New in 2020: a women's division 
playing 36 holes. Must live in Wayne 
County, North Carolina or be member of a Wayne 
County golf 
course.

title: Phoenix City Men's Senior Stroke Play Championship
notes:
36 holes of stroke play for senior golfers in the Phoenix 
Metro area.

title: Cleveland County Amateur Championship
notes:
54 holes of stroke play. After a 36-hole cut (down to 
60 players and ties, plus senior qualifiers), the top 
12 players will be in the championship flight will bid 
for the Shelton trophy. Remaining golfers in the field 
will then compete in three additional flights. Prizes 
will go to each of the members of the championship 
flight, plus the top two in each of the lower flights. 
There are Senior and Super Senior divisions, as well 
as a competition between local clubs.

title: Greater Cleveland Amateur Championship
notes:
This 36-hole stroke play tournament will be contested 
at scratch, and is open 
for qualifying to amateur golfers of any age, gender, or 
residence. Pre-qualifying required for those not 
exempt.

title: Summit County Amateur Championship
notes:
Started in 1974, the Summit County Amateur Golf 
Championship is held annually at Good Park Golf 
Course in Akron, Ohio. It is a two-day 36-hole 
stroke 
individual stroke play event contested at scratch, in 
honor of David Barnes.
courseName: J. Edward Good Park Golf Course

title: Stark County Amateur Golf Championship
notes:
The Stark County Amateur Golf Championship is a 36-
hole individual stroke 
play tournament played in four 
divisions: Championship, Senior (50-59), Super Senior 
(60-69), and Legends (70+). 
Open to all amateur players regardless of residence.

title: Portage County Amateur Championship
notes:
Played since the 1930s, this is a 36-hole stroke play 
event with County, Open and Women divisions.

title: Baltimore Amateur Championship
notes:
Stroke Play, 36 holes, flighted by handicap, played at 
scratch within each flight. All participants wishing to 
compete for the overall Championship must compete 
in 
the Championship Flight. The final flight will compete 
for both gross and net awards. To compete in the 
Senior Division, players must have reached their 
55th 
birthday by the start of the tournament.

title: Senior Hornblower Memorial Invitational
notes:
Style of play: Two day - 36 hole stroke play – no 
cut.
Handicap required: GHIN index of 8.0 or lower. Must 
be 
at least 55 years of age or older as of the start of 
the 
tournament. Super Senior division for those aged 65 
and older. The Hornblower Committee will be 
responsible for
acceptance or rejection of all entries.

title: Alameda Commuters Senior Golf Tournament - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Senior division of long running event played over two weekends at the Chuck Corica Golf Complex in Alameda. Seniors play in between the two weekends in their own 36 hole competition. The field will be made up of 52 senior amateur golfers, including past Alameda Commuters champions and players 55 years or older with handicap indexes of 5.2 or lower.

title: Durham Senior Amateur - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The Durham Senior Amateur Championship was founded in 2010 by Dink Andrews of Durham, NC. Since 2010, it has grown into one of the largest senior amateur golf championships in the country. The DSA has grown steadily and due to the support of local businesses and sponsors, prizes are awarded to 40% of the field.

The goal of the DSA is to create the premier Senior Amateur Golf Championship in the Southeast region of The United States by (1) attracting and rewarding the best amateur golfers with a tournament held on a true championship golf course in immaculate condition, and (2) providing a truly memorable experience for all golfers, volunteers and sponsors. The championship has 3 Divisions; a Senior Division (age 55+), a Super Senior Division (age 65+) and a Legends Division (age 70+).

title: Coastland Invitational
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play event with championship 
and 
senior divisions. Championship A, Championship B, 
Regular, Regular Handicap (handicaps of 15+), Senior 
and Super Senior flights.

title: Two-Man Fall Classic
notes:
36-hole partner event for male amateurs only. 
Format is a Texas Scramble on day one, and a best-
ball on day two. Teams will be 
pre-flighted according to USGA handicap index. 
Partners may have no
more than 8 strokes difference between 
handicaps. The tournament rules committee 
reserves the right to adjust a team’s 
handicap/flight based on previous tournament 
performance.

title: La Crosse County Amateur Championship
notes:
36 holes of stroke play, with flights determined by 
handicap.
courseName: The Golf Club At Cedar Creek

title: Rensselaer County Men's Amateur Championship
notes:
36 holes of stroke play with Open and Senior 
divisions. Player must be at least 21 years of age 
and 
reside in Rensselaer County.
The committee will limit the field to the first 180 
paid 
entries.

title: Northern California Spring Mixed Team Championship
notes:
The championship will be 36 holes of stroke play (18 
holes per day) in a Mixed Chapman format. Play will 
be 60% of the lower course handicap and 40% of 
the 
higher course handicap. Open to any male/female 
team ages 18 and up. Both 
team members must be members of the NCGA. 
Format: Mixed Chapman. Play will be 60% of 
the 
higher course handicap and 40% of the lower 
course handicap. The field is divided into three 
flights 
by handicap index: Chardonnay 0-9, Merlot 10-18 
and Zinfandel 19 and above.

title: Jerry Pate National Intercollegiate
notes:
54-hole men's college tournament 
hosted 
by the University of Alabama. Team (best four scores 
out of five players each round) and individual 
competitions.

title: Mason Rudolph Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
54-hole men's college tournament hosted by 
Vanderbilt 
University. Team (best four scores out of five 
players 
each round) and individual competitions.

title: Daniel Boone Invitational
notes:
Started in the 1940's, this is the oldest 54-hole 
invitational golf tournament in the Commonwealth of 
Kentucky.  54 hole individual stroke play 
event hosted at Frankfurt Country Club. Pre-flighted by 
handicap.
Invitation only by club or club member.

title: Lebanon County Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play event played in Lebanon County, 
Pennsylvania. Open to 
county residents and past county residents (for a year 
or more).

title: Upstate Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play event. Field flighted after first round.

Amateur golfers from ANY county/state are welcome to play in this event. Players under the age of 16 must have a letter of recommendation written from a head golf professional.

title: Greenville County Amateur Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play event. Cut after 36 holes.

Tournament players must be an amateur in good standing that is a member of a Greenville County golf facility, maintain a residence in Greenville County, or be a past champion of this event.

Players under the age of 17 must have a letter of recommendation for a PGA professional.

title: W.B. Sullivan Invitational Four-Ball
notes:
The W.B. Sullivan Invitational Four-Ball is one of the most prestigious and competitive golf events in Central Pennsylvania.

The Sullivan attracts teams from all over the state and the neighboring states of New Jersey, Maryland and Delaware. Players from as far away as Florida and Texas have entered over the years.

Up to 130 teams will qualify Thursday or Friday. The low 15 qualifying teams, plus the defending champions, will make up the championship flight. There will be four medal play flights playing 18 holes Saturday and Sunday. 96 Teams and ties make the tournament.

title: British Columbia Senior/Super-Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play event with Senior (55 and older) 
and Super Senior (65 and older) divisions. Maximum 
handicap 16.0.

title: Saginaw District Golf Association Tournament
notes:
Beginning in 1955, the Saginaw District Golf 
Association's annual District Invitational Tournament 
has been held each year for over half a century. The 
format is 54-holes to identify the best 
amateur golfer in the county. Players may be male 
or 
female and must be residents of Saginaw County 
and 
have USGA amateur status. The Tournament will 
consist of two Divisions, the Open Division and the 
Legends Division (ages 50 and over).

title: Arnold B. Walker Milwaukee County Championship
notes:
36-hole flighted stroke play event open to 
Milwaukee 
County Public Links Association members (though 
non-
members can enter by paying a small additional 
fee). 
Number of flights determined by the number of 
entries 
received. Gross and net competitions.

title: Hawaii Mayor's Cup - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36-hole stroke play event for HSGA members, with Championship, A, B, C, Senior, Women's, and Senior Women's flights.

title: The Bo Williams Ocala City Amateur Championship
notes:
Format: 36-Hole Stroke Play
Regular, Senior (50+) and Super-Senior (65+) Divisions.
Players Flighted after First Round

title: Marion Masters
notes:
54-hole stroke play. Must be a resident or own 
property in Marion County, Florida.

title: Memphis Golf Association Four-Ball Championship
notes:
The Memphis Golf Association Four-Ball & Senior 
Four-Ball 
Championships are open to teams who possess an 
active 
USGA/GHIN Handicap Index from a Memphis Golf 
Association 
member club or course. Senior Amateur players 
must be at least 50 
years of age. The format for the MGA Amateur & 
Senior Amateur is 
36-holes of stroke play.
courseName: Memphis National Golf Club - Champions Course

title: City of Orlando Men's Amateur Golf Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play championship, which will be flighted 
after 36 holes (top 20 scores qualify for the 
Championship flight). Seniors shall be 
competing 
and receiving awards in both the Regular and Senior 
Divisions. Participants must carry a 12 handicap or 
better. No residency requirement to participate.

title: Marion Masters Seniors Championship
notes:
36 hole stroke play championship. Must be a full 
time 
Marion County resident or own property in Marion 
County.

title: Henry Camp Invitational - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

One of the state’s most prestigious and longest running amateur golf tournaments. The Camp family started the event in 1952. Camp, who was an Ocala resident, was instrumental in the amateur golf scene in the state of Florida and Marion County. 54-hole stroke play event.

title: St. Pat's Invitational
notes:
54-hole stroke play event. Open, Senior (ages 60+), 
and Super Senior (70+) 
divisions, with flights within each determined by 
handicap indexes.

title: Firecracker Four-Ball Championship
notes:
36 Hole stroke play “best ball team” with 
handicap. Teams divided into flights according to 
“team handicap.” Gross and net divisions for 
both men and women.

title: Capitol City Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament that draws upwards 
of 
200 players. Entry fee includes food, tee prize, 
range 
balls and generous prize fund.

title: Wilmington City Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play event. All players must have a 
handicap of 11 or less. The field will be limited to 132 
players. The first 120 entrants
will be in the field. The last 12 entries accepted will be 
based on the players’
ability/handicap. The field will be pre-flighted by 
handicap. There will be approximately 6
flights. A junior champion will also be awarded.

title: Southwick Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play tournament flighted 
after the first round, with Open and Senior (ages 55+) 
divisions.

title: Norfolk City Amateur Championship (Decker Cup)
notes:
36-hole stroke play event with Championship, Senior 
(ages 50+), Super Senior (ages 65+) and Junior (18 
and under) Divisions.

title: Sleepy Hole Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play event with flights based on 
handicap. Championship, senior (ages 50+) and super 
senior (65+) divisions.

title: Richmond Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play event conducted by the 
Richmond 
Golf Association.
courseName: Country Club Of Virginia - Westhampton Course

title: Women’s District of Columbia Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The annual WDCGA Championship is a true test of golfing skill. Open to all members, the Championship spans four days, beginning with an 18-hole qualifying round, followed by three days of match play in flights. The competition ends with an awards luncheon honoring the winners. Each year the Championship is held at a different member Club. No matter the venue, the Championship is a truly competitive event in the best sense of the word, enabling all District members to test their individual skills in a traditional match play format.

title: Keefer Cup - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36-hole stroke play event. One of the WDCGA's longest running events, hosted at Chevy Chase Country Club since 1932.

Caddies are required, however players may use Chevy Chase caddies, may bring their own caddie or may carry their own bag.

title: Golden Horseshoe Four-Ball Invitational
notes:
The Golden Horseshoe Invitational is a 36-hole, 
four-ball stroke play event. There will be Open, Senior, 
and Super Senior Flights. Round One (Saturday) will be 
played on the Green Course and Round Two (Sunday) 
will be played on the Gold Course.
courseName: Golden Horseshoe Golf Club - Gold Course

title: Hidden Valley Four-Ball Invitational
notes:
Open to all male amateur golfers. Format is 36 holes of 
four-ball stroke play played at gross. Regular, senior 
(ages 50 and over) and super senior (ages 65+) 
divisions.

title: The Signature Invitational at The Federal Club - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Open to all male amateur golfers. Format is 36 holes of stroke play played at gross. Regular, senior (ages 50- 64), super senior (65+) and legends (70+) flights. The size of the field will be limited to 72 players: 24 in the regular flight, 24 in the senior flight and 24 in the super senior/legends flight.

title: Danville Invitational
notes:
36-hole stroke play event for amateurs, seniors and 
super seniors. VSGA Points event. Formerly known as 
the W. Townes Lea Invitational.

title: Greene Hills Invitational - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due tot he coronavirus outbreak.

Open to all male amateur golfers. Format is 36 holes of stroke play played at gross. Regular, senior (ages 50-64) and super senior (65+) divisions. Flighted after the first round. A Virginia State Golf Association (VSGA) Player-of-the-Year points event.

title: Nelson Broach Memorial Tournament
notes:
27 holes with Four Ball, Modified Alternate Shot and 
Scramble formats, each over nine holes. Open and 
Senior divisions.

title: Greater Lansing All-City Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play event conducted by Greater 
Lansing Amateur Golf Association. Flighted after two 
rounds. 4 divisions - Open, Senior, Super Senior, and 
Women. Discounted entry 
fees available for those that choose to donate 
annually 
to the GLAGA for promotion of junior golf.

title: Roanoke Valley Match Play Championship
notes:
Match play tournament with Amateur, Senior, Super 
Senior and Grand Master divisions.
Registration for all age divisions will be open to 
all residents of Virginia who hold amateur 
status 
and have an established USGA Handicap.   
Former residents of the Roanoke Valley will also 
be eligible who live outside of Virginia.

title: Southwestern New York - Northwest Pennsylvania Men's Amateur Championship
notes:
Format is 18-holes of stroke play to determine a round of 32 championship match play bracket. Those who fall outside the top 32 will qualify for other flights, with a consolation flight for Seniors 60 and over.

Men's amateur golfers who are residents of Southwest New York or Northwest Pennsylvania (official boundaries listed on contact's website) have priority over those living outside the area.

title: Buffalo Men's District Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play event with open, senior and 
women's 
divisions. Open to all golfers in the seven Western 
New 
York counties and to BDGA members in the Niagara 
Peninsula of Canada.

title: Hamilton County Men's Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play event, open to men who on the championship date are a resident of Hamilton County, Indiana OR a non-resident who is a playing member at a Hamilton County golf club. Each entrant shall also have an official USGA handicap index established at a Hamilton County, IN golf club on the championship date.

Players in the Amateur division must have a current IGA/USGA handicap index of 12.0 or less. The Senior (ages 55+) and Super Senior (65+) divisions require a current IGA/USGA handicap index of 15.0 or below.

title: Evansville Men's City Golf Tournament
notes:
The Evansville Courier & Press Men’s City Golf Tournament is played on the first two full weekends of August, with the qualification round the Saturday two weeks prior to Round One. Past Champions and the top 100 scorers plus ties from the previous championship are exempt from qualification for the Evansville Courier & Press Men’s City Tournament.

The championship shall be contested over 72 holes unless shortened by weather or unforeseen conditions. The low 40 scorers and ties, or any player within 10 shots of the leader after 36 holes, will qualify for the final 36 holes.

title: Springfield City Amateur Championship
notes:
72-hole stroke play tournament with championship 
and open flights, played over two consecutive 
weekends. The first weekend will declare 
champions for the Ladies, Seniors and Super 
Seniors.  The second weekend will determine the 
overall champion as well as flight winners. Junior and 
Senior champions and runners-up may participate in 
championship or flights on the second weekend.
courseName: Reid Park Golf Course - North Course

title: City of Ann Arbor Men's Amateur Championship
notes:
This championship series event attracts some of the 
area’s best golfers. This 54-hole flighted stroke play 
event is fun and competitive for all. Registration forms 
and sign up links are available on the City of Ann Arbor 
website.

title: Great Lakes Spring Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play event with Scratch and Handiap 
divisions. Open to all 
members of the Toledo Metro and the Toledo District, 
plus all amateur golfers residing in the following 
counties: OHIO - Lucas, Fulton, Williams,Defiance, 
Henry, Paulding, Van Wert, Allen, Putnam, Hancock, 
Wood, Seneca, Erie, Ottawa, and Sandusky; MICHIGAN 
- Monroe, Lenawee and Hillsdale.

title: Toledo Amateur Championship
notes:
Annual 72-hole stroke play tournament (with a cut after 36 holes) held at the Arthur Hills designed Detwiler Park Golf Course. Detwiler is a resort style facility on the shores of the Maumee Bay on the southern edge of Point Place.

ELIGIBILITY:
Tournament is open all amateur golfers residing in the following counties: OHIO - Lucas, Fulton, Williams, Defiance, Henry, Paulding, Van Wert, Allen, Putnam, Hancock, Wood, Seneca, Erie, Ottawa and Sandusky. MICHIGAN - Monroe, Lenawee and Hillsdale. (Note: Senior Division starts at age 50.)

title: Tom Wolf Memorial Classic
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament named after 
longtime Toledo Metro Golf Association officer and 
golf enthusiast Tom Wolf. Scratch and Handicap 
divisions. Open to all members of the Toledo Metro 
and the Toledo District, plus all amateur golfers 
residing in the following counties: OHIO - Lucas, 
Fulton, Williams,Defiance, Henry, Paulding, Van Wert, 
Allen, Putnam, Hancock, Wood, Seneca, Erie, 
Ottawa, and Sandusky; MICHIGAN - Monroe, 
Lenawee and Hillsdale.

title: Jim Benson Memorial
notes:
2-Man Team Entrants must be male 
amateur members of a Member Club of the St. 
Louis District Golf Association. FORMAT: 1st Round – 
Four-Ball Stroke Play (Best 
Ball), 2nd Round – Foursomes Stroke Play (Alternate 
Shot). Open and Net divisions.

title: Cassett St. Louis Senior Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament for seniors (ages 50-
64) and super seniors (ages 65+). Entrant must be a 
male amateur 
member of a Member Club of the St. Louis 
District Golf Association. The entrant must have 
an up-to-date and current USGA GHIN Handicap 
Index. Entrants must be 50 years 
of age on before the first day of the event.

title: Jim Jackson Invitational
notes:
36-hole stroke play event open to members of the 
St. 
Louis District Golf Association. This Invitational 
Championship extends 
invitations to each of the Club Champions from their 
respective District Clubs.  
In addition, players may qualify thru their high 
finishes in District events 
throughout the season.  Past champions of the event 
are also invited to 
participate, even if they no longer belong to a 
District Club.

title: Toledo District Stroke Play Championship
notes:
18-hole stroke play tournament with Championship 
and 
Senior (ages 50+) divisions. Open to members of 
the 
24 clubs in the 
Toledo District Golf Association who are at least 19 
years of age and have a handicap index of 14.0 or less.

title: Erie District Amateur Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play event open to 
all 
male golfers who hold a regular golf membership in 
good standing in one of the member clubs of the 
EDGA 
or is a resident of the greater Erie area, or a 
graduate 
or a regional high school.

title: Erie District Men's Match Play Championship
notes:
The tournament is open to the first 120 paid male 
golfers holding a regular golf membership in good 
standing in one of the member clubs of the EDGA or 
residents of the Greater Northwestern PA area.

title: Turnberry Men's Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play scratch event. 25% of the field will 
earn pro shop credit.

title: Country Club of Ocala Invitational
notes:
36-hole stroke play event with Championship, Legends 
(ages 50+) and Hall of Fame (ages 65+) flights. Gross 
and Net competitions.

title: Citrus County Senior Championship
notes:
36 holes stroke play with handicap. Gross and net 
divisions
in all flights. Any male amateur (age 50+), regardless 
of residency is
eligible to compete.

title: Mt. Dora Invitational
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play tournament. Participants 
must be male amateurs at least 18 years old and must 
have a USGA handicap. Championship, A, and B flights.

title: North Shore Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play championship open to 
amateurs with a USGA handicap
index of 8.0 or less from North Shore Golf Clubs. Field 
will be cut after the first round to the low 40 and ties 
plus 2 low Seniors (age 50 and over). Field is capped at 
72 players.

title: Herman Sani Tournament
notes:
This tournament has a history of great golf from a
field of excellent professionals and amateurs. 
Equally
important to the tournament is that college bound
students have been recipients of Sani Scholarships 
each year. 54-hole stroke play event with Open and 
Senior divisions. Amateur entries must be active 
Iowa 
Golf Association members.

title: Briarwood Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament with Open and 
Senior 
divisions. The tournament is flighted by first-round 
score. This is an Iowa Golf Association points event.

title: Northwest Amateur Tournament
notes:
72-hole flighted stroke play event first contested in 
1921. In addition to the Championship and open 
flights, 
there is a Senior division. This is an Iowa Golf 
Association points event.

title: Iowa Masters
notes:
The Iowa Masters is an invitational 54-hole stroke 
play 
golf tournament sponsored by Veenker Memorial 
Golf 
Course and Facilities Planning and Management of 
Iowa 
State University. The Iowa Masters is one of the 
Iowa 
Golf Association’s “major” tournaments that 
determine 
the IGA Amateur, Senior Amateur and Super Senior 
Amateur of the Year awards. The tournament is 
scheduled to be contested over 54 holes with all 
competitors playing both Friday and Saturday. 
Following the second round, a cut is made to 
determine the field for the final round.

title: Fort Dodge Amateur Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play tournament with Open and 
Senior 
divisions. In each division there is a Championship 
and 
First flight. This is an Iowa Golf Association points 
event.

title: Carroll Amateur Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play tournament flighted by 
handicap with open and senior (ages 50 and over). 
This is an Iowa Golf Association points event.

title: Iowa Senior Match Play Championship
notes:
Must be an active
IGA Member and must have
reached their 50th birthday.

18 hole qualifying round, from which the low
32 proceed the the Championship Bracket. Places 
33-64 proceed
to the President’s Bracket.

The defending champion is exempt
from the 18-hole qualifying round. The defending 
champion
may choose to compete in the qualifying round to 
earn
medalist honors but is assured of no lower than the 
#2 seed in
Match Play.

title: Iowa Open Championship
notes:
The Iowa Open is a men's only championship that 
features both a Open Division and Senior Division.  It is 
a 54-hole stroke play tournament with a 36-hole cut. 
Trophies are awarded to Overall Champion, Low 
Amateur, Senior Champion, and Low Senior Amateur.

title: Waterloo Open Championship
notes:
Established in 1933, the Cedar Valley Jaycees’ Greater Waterloo Open Golf Classic is Iowa’s largest and oldest professional golf tournament. Every year, the Waterloo Open hosts nearly 400 amateur and professional golfers from all across the world.

The Amateur Tournament has a capacity of 288 competitors. There is an Open Division and a Senior Division. A Senior competitor may compete in both divisions if they desire. The format consists of 18 holes of medal play on both Friday and Saturday. Golfers making the cut advance to the Championship Round on Sunday.

The low 36 rounds plus ties from the Open Amateur Division and the low four rounds plus ties from the Senior Amateur Division qualify for the championship round, which is played with the Professionals on Sunday at Irv Warren Memorial Golf Course. Those who make the cut automatically receive a gift certificate prize, and additional prizes are awarded based on final results after Sunday’s championship round.

title: Doug Oswald Senior Invitational
notes:
36-hole stroke play event with Senior and Super Senior 
divisions, flighted within each division.

title: Tuscarora Invitational
notes:
Two-man team tournament with a different format each 
day: Alternate shot on day one, best-ball on day two.

title: Ontario Men's Match Play Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

18 hole stroke play qualifying round for all players except those exempt at selected clubs throughout the province. Match play bracket of 64 from exempt players and qualifiers. Open to male amateur golfers who are Golf Ontario members and have a handicap index of 8.4 or less. Senior division for players ages 50 and over.

title: Ontario Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play event. Open to Golf Ontario 
members ages 55 and older. Open, 65 and older, and 
70 and older divisions. Non-exempt players must pre-
qualify.

title: Ontario Men's Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play championship with a cut to the 
low 60 players and ties after the second round. Mid-
Amateur (ages 25+) and Mid-Master (40+) divisions. 
Must be a Golf Ontario member and have a handicap 
of 8.4 or less.

title: Birmingham Metro Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The Metro Amateur Championship is the City Championship of Birmingham. There is a Mid-Amateur division (ages 25-49), a Senior division (50-59) and a Super Senior division (60+). If you are 50 and over, but want to play in the Mid-Amateur division you may do so, but must specify this when registering. It is open to residents of Jefferson, Bibb, Blount, Cullman, Shelby, St. Clair, Tuscaloosa and Walker counties. It is a team format (two-man, best ball) over two days. For the Mid-Amateur division the maximum handicap per player is nine, for the Senior division the maximum handicap per player is 14 and for the Super Senior division the maximum handicap per player is 17.

title: Southern California Open Championship
notes:
The Championship will be a 54 hole stroke play 
tournament contested over three days. Following the 
conclusion of 36 holes, the field will be cut to the 
Low 
54 players for the final round. Championship is open 
to 
both Professionals and Amateurs. To enter the 
Championship field, participants must either qualify 
or 
meet one of exemptions.

title: Iowa Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
Open to female amateur golfers who maintain
a residence in the state of Iowa and are members of 
the Iowa Golf Association. 54-hole stroke play event 
with two divisions: a Championship Division which 
will 
not be
flighted and an Open Division which will be flighted 
after the second round. There are
60 guaranteed spots in each division.

title: Tri-State Masters
notes:
54-hole stroke play tournament with Open and Senior 
divisions. Played on three courses in three states 
(South Dakota, Nebraska, Iowa). This is an Iowa Golf 
Association points event.

title: Kircher Cup Invitational
notes:
Two-person amateur teams from around the 
Midwest compete in this 54-hole better ball 
competition held on the Heather, Donald Ross, 
and Arthur Hills courses at Boyne Highlands 
Resort. The Kircher Cup is named after the 
founding family of Boyne Resorts and the names 
engraved on the cup are a venerable "who's 
who" of Michigan amateur golf. Played every year 
over Labor Day weekend. 

Divisions include Championship and Senior.

title: Lexington Men's Senior City Championship
notes:
The Men’s Senior City Championship will feature 54 
holes of stroke play competition.
Three champions will be crowned: Senior (50-59), 
Super Senior (60-69) and
Legends (70 & over) for both men and women; all 
divisions will be at scratch. Open to those who reside 
in 
Fayette County or hold a membership at a Fayette 
County golf club.

title: Long Island Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
36 hole stroke play championship for senior players 
with an established handicap index at a Long Island 
club or course.

title: Long Island Junior Boys & Girls Championship
notes: Must have a handicap at a Long Island club or course.

title: Wisconsin Women's Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
Competition will be 36 holes stroke play (two 18-hole 
rounds). Championship Flight will be those players with 
WSGA Handicap Indexes of 6.5 or less.

title: Toledo Metro Club Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament open to all 
members of the Toledo Metro and the Toledo District, 
plus all amateur golfers residing in the following 
counties: OHIO - Lucas, Fulton, Williams,Defiance, 
Henry, Paulding, Van Wert, Allen, Putnam, Hancock, 
Wood, Seneca, Erie, Ottawa, and Sandusky; 
MICHIGAN 
- Monroe, Lenawee and Hillsdale.
