notes:
Open to amateur males only. 36 Hole medal play in 
gross and net divisions. All players are automatically 
entered into both divisions. Must be member of 
FWGA.

title: Fort Wayne Little City Championship
notes:
Open to amateur males only. 36 hole medal play 
event. 
Field will be flighted based upon 18 hole score. Must 
be 
member of FWGA.

title: Fort Wayne City Championship
notes:
54 holes of stroke play. The field will be cut to the low 100 and ties for the final round. Non-exempt players must prequalify.

There are three ways to be eligible to participate:

1) A player's primary residence is in Allen County, IN

2) A player's primary place of employment (full time) is located in Allen County, IN and a player is a full paying member of an Allen County, IN golf course.

3) A player plays in 2 FWGA Major events and a total of 3 FWGA events. The player must complete each event w/ a signed score card.

title: Fort Wayne Women's City Tournament
notes:
54-hole flighted stroke play championship, with gross 
and net competitons. Must be an amateur female 
member of the FWWGA.

title: Kansas Women's Senior & Super Senior Championship
notes:
36 holes of individual stroke play with gross and net 
scoring. Senior (ages 50 & older) and Super Senior 
(ages 70 & older) divisions. All competitors must be 
female amateurs and KGA/KCGA members.

title: Michigan Women's Senior Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The Michigan Women's Senior Amateur provides the best Senior Women in the state with the opportunity to work their way through flighted match play brackets, as well as consolation matches so all participants are guaranteed to play on both days. Open to Senior Women (ages 50+) with handicaps under 25.4.

title: Concession Cup Matches - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Created by supporters of amateur golf, The Concession Cup is an event designed to celebrate the game through international competition while giving back to worthy causes. The event is a biennial team competition played between teams comprised of leading male Mid-Amateurs, Senior Amateurs and Super Senior Amateurs from the United States and Great Britain and Ireland.

The Concession Cup Committee will select the participating players through the following categories:
Six (6) Mid-Amateurs, age 25 to 54.
Six (6) Senior Amateurs, age 55 and older.
Two (2) Senior Amateurs, age 65 and older.

The competition is conducted over three days through the traditional team match-play formats of foursome, four-ball and singles. In honor of two of the greatest amateur competitors in the history of the game, a trophy has been commissioned in the names of United States amateur, Bill Campbell and British Amateur, Sir Michael Bonallack – the Campbell/Bonallack trophy will be presented to the winning team at the conclusion of the matches.

title: Coral Canyon Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke-play event for men and senior men, 
with Gross and Net competitions. Utah Golf Association 
points event.

title: Southgate One-Man Scramble
notes:
The one-man scramble format allows the player to take 
a second shot ("mulligan"), but if he does so he must 
play the second ball.

title: Florida Southwest Amateur Series (December)
notes:
Four-Ball Flights:
Gross flight: Players may choose to play in the gross flight. Both players must play gross and play from approx. 6,800 yards
Senior Gross flight: 50 and over. Players may choose to play but both players must be 50 and over and both players will play gross from approx. 6,500 yards
Net flight: Anyone can play in the net flight, and will play from the tees their index indicates.

Membership & Eligibility:
Male, amateur golfers with an active FSGA/GHIN handicap (14.0 or less)

title: Florida Southwest Amateur Series (November)
notes:
Flights:
Championship flight - players with handicaps of +3.0 to 3.8
Senior Championship flight - Ages 50 and over with Indexes of +3.0 to 3.8
First flight - players with handicaps of 3.9 to 8.9
Second Flight - players with handicaps of 9.0 to 14.0

Each flight must have a minimum of six players or the flights may be combined. Gross Flights excluded.

Format:
Individual stroke play within flights
The Championship flight will play gross stroke play, the other two flights will play a net The First flight and the Second flight may be combined and play will be handicapped (a net game) for those players.

Membership & Eligibility:
Male, amateur golfers with an active FSGA/GHIN handicap (14.0 or less)

title: Florida Southwest Amateur Series (October)
notes:
Flights:
Championship flight - players with handicaps of +3.0 to 3.8
Senior Championship flight - Ages 50 and over with Indexes of +3.0 to 3.8
First flight - players with handicaps of 3.9 to 8.9
Second Flight - players with handicaps of 9.0 to 14.0

Each flight must have a minimum of six players or the flights may be combined. Gross Flights excluded.

Format:
Individual stroke play within flights
The Championship flight will play gross stroke play, the other two flights will play a net The First flight and the Second flight may be combined and play will be handicapped (a net game) for those players.

Membership & Eligibility:
Male, amateur golfers with an active FSGA/GHIN handicap (14.0 or less)
courseName: Verandah Golf Club - Old Orange Course

title: Sioux City Men's Amateur Championship
notes:
36 hole individual stroke play championship with flights 
determined by handicap. Open and Senior divisions.

title: Boulder City Amateur Championship
notes:

Senior (age 50+) flights. The Championship flight is

title: Colorado West Amateur Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play event with open and senior 
divisions. Gross and net scoring. One of the largest

title: Wichita Medal Play Championship
notes:
36-hole flighted stroke play tournament, with the

title: Wichita Match Play Championship - POSTPONED
notes:

18 hole stroke play qualifier determines flights and player seeding. Following the qualifying round, single elimination 18 hole matches are played until winners of each flight are crowned.

54-hole four-ball stroke play tournament held at

notes:

title: Tulsa Two-Man Challenge - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Must be a TGA member to enter. Two-man shamble best ball with flighted divisions based on first-round score. Separate tee markers for ages 54 and under, 55- 64, and 65+.

title: Peoria Men's City Match Play Championship
notes:
City match play tournament with qualifying held in the

title: Central Illinois Amateur Championship
notes:
The Central Illinois Amateur is open to all male and 
female amateur golfers. The tournament will have  
Men's, Women's, Senior, and High School divisions. In 
the Men's division, there will be a two flights.

title: Springfield City Amateur Championship
notes:
72-hole stroke play event played on consecutive 
weekends at multiple courses in the Springfield, IL 
area.

title: The Lathrop Cup
notes:
The senior version of the SCGA's popular Trescott Championship, the Lathrop Cup is a team event comprised of members of the same golf club who are the age of 55 years and older. The three senior amateurs combine their aggregate score from each hole to compete for the Lathrop Cup.

During the course of play, a Pro-Am is also conducted with the three amateurs and their Club Professional (Club professional can be of any age) using the best two gross balls per hole. The Lathrop Cup is a great opportunity for members and their Professional to spend a day together and compete against other SCGA Member clubs throughout the State.

title: Arizona Players Cup Championship
notes:
The Player's Cup Championship is modeled after the 
PGA 
Tour's FedEx Cup and the Schwab Cup, where 
extra Performance Points are added to the 
year-
long Standings to create a unique payoff 
system 
rewarding play for the entire year. The event 
is 
open first to Performance Points leaders until 
November 1st, when it will open for all AGA 
members. Divisions: Open, 
Masters, 
Senior and Legends.

title: Ben Graham Memorial - POSTPONED
notes:
**Postponed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The Ben Graham Memorial is an annual tournament held in memory of Ben Graham. This 36-hole stroke play event features professional, men's, and women's divisions along with a special competition for former "Logger Legends".

title: Barnett Memorial Tournament
notes:
54-hole stroke play event held over Memorial 
Day weekend. Championship division and flights 
determined by handicap, plus senior (age 55+), 
women's and senior women's (age 50+) divisions. 
Minimum age 14.

title: Earl Hunt Memorial Fourth of July Tournament
notes:
54-hole stroke play event with men's, senior (ages 
55+), and women's flights. Maximum handicap for men 
24, for women 34, for junior boys (under 18) 10, and 
for junior girls (under 18) 20. This tournament has 
been played since the 1930s.
courseName: Whitefish Lake Golf Club - North Course

title: Buffalo Hill Labor Day Tournament
notes:
54-hole stroke play event. Mens and ladies divisions 
flighted by handicap index.

title: The Williamson Cup - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The Williamson Cup was established in 1964 by A. Fred Williamson, in memory of his father, one of the original founders of the famed Winged Foot Golf Club and a long-time member of the USGA Executive Committee. Format is a team championship involving 10-15 regional golf associations. 4-man teams compete over 36 holes of medal play for the coveted trophy. The best three of four scores count in each round. Teams from golf associations within PA, NY, D.C., DE, and Canada regularly participate.

title: Lafayette City Amateur Championship
notes:
36 holes of stroke play held on the first weekend, 
then match play the next two weekends. Low 31 
scores and the previous year's champion qualify for 
the Championship Flight. Additional brackets flighted 
in groups of 16 players. The 36-Hole qualifier will 
also determine a Medal Play Champion

Must be 
resident of 
Tippecanoe County, Indiana.

handicap.

McLennan County and at least 16 years of age.

title: Topeka City Match Play Championship
notes:

within Shawnee County and are members of the 
Topeka Golf Association. Qualifying will be the first 
weekend 
followed by match play over the 2nd weekend. 
Open, 
senior, and super senior divisions. Everyone 
advances 
to match play.

notes:
54-hole stroke play event with a cut after round two.

36-hole four-ball stroke play event. The field will be broken into flight determined by the lowest Handicap Index of the two partners. Each player must be a current member of the UGA.

title: Utah Women's Spring Open Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36-hole team modified stableford event. The lowest handicap on the two person team will determine the flight.

title: Northern California Women's Four-Ball Net Championship
notes:
First played in 2006, the NCGA Northern California

Sur (combined team index 30.2-lower), Golden Gate 
(30.3-44.0) and Yosemite (44.1 and higher), divided by

division, flighted after day one.

notes:
The Old Waverly Invitational is scheduled as 36 
holes 
of 
stroke play. Divisions: Men's, Senior (50+), Super 
Senior (60+). Flights will be determined following 18 
holes of play. Players will be re-paired following the 
first 
round based on score. The number of flights is 
based 
on field size with awards following completion of the 
second round.

title: Trustmark Invitational
notes:

The Championship flight will be composed of the low 16 amateurs and all PGA Professionals.

Amateur Super Senior Division (60 Years Old and Older) will compete from its own set of tees for all three rounds of the Championship

title: Morris Mens Invitational
notes:
36 hole stroke play tournament with open and senior 
divisions, hosted by Morris Country Club.

Only the first 200 paid entires will be accepted.

18 hole stroke play qualifier to determine a 32- player match play bracket for mid-amateurs and a 16- player bracket for seniors. Open to any male with amateur status, 25 years or older for Mid-Am, and 50 or older for Senior, as of the first day of the tournament residing in Bexar, Comal, Kendall, Kerr, Wilson, Atascosa, Medina, Guadalupe, or Bandera counties for a minimum of three months prior to the Championship date. 36-hole stroke play event limited to the first 100 entries. Hosted annually by Hickory Hills Country Club in Springfield, Missouri, the home course of two- time U.S. Open Champion Payne Stewart.

title: Jimmy Anderson Boys' Invitational
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament open to boys ages 13- 18 who have a USGA Handicap Index of 15.0 or lower. Boys compete in one age division.

This annual junior tournament was started by the alumni of the Jacksonville Country Club junior golf program in 2009 to honor their longtime teacher and friend Mr. Jimmy Anderson. Jimmy Anderson was the head golf professional at Jacksonville Country Club for over 25 years. Each Saturday morning, he conducted a junior golf clinic to help spread the game of golf to the next generation. During his tenure at Jacksonville CC, he taught many juniors including Mallory Miller, the 1987 N.C. Junior Champion and numerous future collegiate and golf professionals. Not only did he teach the game of golf, but was always there with a helpful word of encouragement to any young golfer.

title: Jimmy Anderson Girls' Invitational
notes:
36-hole stroke play event. All players compete in one division. Open to girls ages 13-18 (CGA membership not required).

This annual junior tournament was started by the alumni of the Jacksonville Country Club junior golf program in 2009 to honor their longtime teacher and friend Mr. Jimmy Anderson. Jimmy Anderson was the head golf professional at Jacksonville Country Club for over 25 years. Each Saturday morning, he conducted a junior golf clinic to help spread the game of golf to the next generation. During his tenure at Jacksonville CC, he taught many juniors including Mallory Miller, the 1987 N.C. Junior Champion and numerous future collegiate and golf professionals. Not only did he teach the game of golf, but was always there with a helpful word of encouragement to any young golfer.

notes:

notes:
**Postponed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Open to any male amateur golfer. The tournament is a 72-hole stroke play championship with gross scores determining overall flight winners. Held over two consecutive weekends. Only the first 200 paid entires will be accepted.

15,

notes:
The longest running individual match play event in the Midwest, having contested its 90th annual tournament in 2015. Northland Country Club, a Donald Ross design, plays host to this prestigious event.

18 holes of qualifying, followed by three days of match play. Regular, Senior (ages 50-69) and Super Senior (ages 70+) divisions.

notes:

Open to senior and super-senior teams who are

notes:
Junior championship of Nova Scotia Golf 
Association. 72-hole stroke play event, must be 
18 or younger.

title: Rocky Mountain Open Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play event. One of the oldest

title: The Rudy's I-35 Cup - CANCELLED

**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Team matches between best amateur players from cities of Austin and San Antonio, Texas. The matches take place over two days, Saturday through Sunday, a total of 28 matches. On Saturday, there are seven, four ball matches in the morning (or afternoon) and seven foursomes matches in the morning (or afternoon). On Sunday, there are 14 singles matches, when all team members play. The winning team is determined by cumulative total points.

Discounted entry fees available for those that choose to donate annually to the GLAGA for promotion of junior golf.

title: Cleveland Heights 4-Ball Invitational
notes:
Started in 1966, the Cleveland Heights 4-Ball

Tournament is held every spring at the Clevelend 
Heights Golf Club in Lakeland, Florida. The 4-
Ball is the largest amateur team golf event held 
in Central Florida, and one of the finest 
tournaments to be found anywhere. This is due, 
in part, to the historic 27-hole golf course 
developed in 1925, gracious sponsors and 
wonderful volunteers — and over 288 of the 
best golfers around.

notes:

title: Montgomery Country Club Invitational
notes:
This Alabama Golf Association points event celebrated its 100th playing in 2018. 54-hole stroke play championship. Upon completion of play on Saturday, the division will be divided into a Championship flight (~20 competitors) and additional flights as determined by the Tournament Committee, for the final round.

Competitors 25 years of age and older may elect to compete in a four-ball stroke play division. This division will be divided into two flights based on score and one flight for competitors 65 age and older as determined by the Tournament Committee.

There are be four divisions: Championship, Open, Senior (55-64), and the Super Senior (65 and above). After two rounds the tournament will be flighted based on score. Entry forms will be available beginning late spring in the Green Meadow Country Club pro shop.

title: West of Ireland Open Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

From 1923 through 2018, the West of Ireland was a match play tournament but the format was switched to 72 holes of stroke play in 2019. Originally held in July, it was moved to coincide with Easter but now it is played in early April to open the Irish competitive calendar each year.

title: Chanticleer National Four-Ball Invitational
notes:
The goal of the Chanticleer National Four-Ball is 
to serve as one of the game's most prestigious and 
competitive Four-Ball events. The event is held 
annually at the Robert Trent Jones-designed 
Chanticleer Course at Greenville Country Club and

challenging

This 36 hole tournament will be played at scratch.

title: U.S. Amateur Four-Ball Qualifying
notes:
Conducted over 18 holes, sectional qualifying

courseName: Various sites across the United States

title: Latin America Amateur Championship
notes:
Founded by the Masters Tournament, The R&A and the USGA, the LAAC was established to further develop amateur golf in South America, Central America, Mexico and the Caribbean. The LAAC is a 72-hole stroke play event open to a field of 108 amateur players in Latin America, chosen by their respective national federations according to their World Amateur Golf Ranking. Past winners of the championship, as well as last year’s top-five finishers, are automatically entered into this year’s championship.

The LAAC champion annually receives an invitation to compete in the Masters at Augusta National Golf Club, and the the British Open Championship. In addition, the winner and the runner(s)-up are exempt into the final stages of qualifying for the US Open Championship. The champion is also awarded full exemptions into The Amateur Championship, the US Amateur Championship and any other USGA amateur championship for which he is eligible.

title: Southern California Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
The SCGA Women's Amateur Championship is open 
to 
female amateur golfers with a USGA Handicap Index

Competitors

reach

the

title: Helen Holm Scottish Women's Open Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

One of the most hotly anticipated events each year in GB&I, the Helen Holm is the most prestigious women’s competition on the Scottish Golf calendar.

The Championship is named after Helen Holm from Troon, where the event takes place. Helen was a five-time Scottish Ladies Champion and her family still attend the event. The trophy is one of her chipping irons with her championship medals attached to it.

54 hole stroke play championship, with an international team event (teams of two players) played in conjunction with the championship.

The winner will return the lowest gross score over 72 holes.

title: Texas Super Senior Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
Eligibility: Entries are open to male amateur golfers with a GHIN Handicap Index from a TGA Member Club. New in 2019, the Super Senior Division and the Legends Division will recognize gross and net winners. In order to participate in the Texas Super Senior, you must have a GHIN Handicap Index of 12.4 or less for the Super Senior Division and 16.4 or less for the Legends Division.

Format/Field Size: Play will be contested over 54 holes of stroke play with no cut. There will be two age divisions competing: Super Senior (age 65+) and Legends (age 75+). Each Division will play from different tees/yardage with a separate gross and net champion being crowned in each division. Legends age players wishing to participate in the Super Senior Division must declare on the application their intention to compete in this Division. The field is limited to 84 players; 60 players in the Super Senior Division and 24 players in the Legends Division.

title: Genesis Open Collegiate Showcase
notes:
The Genesis Open Collegiate Showcase was founded in 2015 and it is a chance for collegiate players to play with PGA Tour alumni from their respective schools. Two simultaneous competitions take place:

In the individual competition, the collegiate players will play their own ball to record an 18-hole score. The low collegian is awarded a playing spot in the Genesis Open.

In the team competition, the professional and the two amateurs (playing at specified percentage of their most current and verified handicap) will team up to play a best ball format (one-ball). The low Professional and Amateurs team will take home the Champions Trophy for their school and a check for $50,000.00, going to their universities golf program.

notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36-hole flighted stroke play event open to all amateurs with established USGA handicap. Gross and net competitions. Three handicap flights (6-11, 12-18 and 19 and up) as well as a senior division for ages 60 and up.

title: AIM Syracuse Post Standard Championship
notes:
72-hole stroke play event played on four different 
courses in the Syracuse, NY area. A cut is made after 
each of the first two rounds. Non-exempt players must 
prequalify.

title: AIM Syracuse Women's Championship
notes:
36-hole tournament open to all women amateurs in 
the 
Central New York Section. Flights for Open, 
Senior (ages 50 and older), and Junior (14 & under, 
15-
18).

title: Apogee Investment Management Senior Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament played at two 
Syracuse, NY area golf courses. Open to all all 
amateurs in the Central New York Section, ages 55 and 
above as of the first day of the tournament.

title: The Pricey Par-3 Golf Tournament
notes:
**Postponed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

One-day, Par-3 tournament played in a Four-Ball Stroke Play format. Open to amateurs and professionals, and several PGA Tour professionals compete each year. Sponsored by World Golf Hall of Fame Member, Nick Price. There is a restriction on the number of clubs a team can use: 1 or 2 Putters + 5 Additional Clubs

title: Downeast Metro Amateur
notes:
Two day individual amateur championship with four 
divisions: (1) Standard, the open division divided 
into 
four flights based on handicap with Gross and Net 
prizes, (2) Juniors, for entrants between 14 and 17 
years of age, (3) Seniors, for players 55 and older 
with 
Gross and Net prizes, and (4) Ladies, with Gross and 
Net prizes.

title: World Stars of Golf Junior Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play event held at multiple 
courses in the Las Vegas area. Age groups 
ranging from 5-18 years old. The event has 
attracted 
over 1,500 players from 50 countries participated. 
Formerly the World Masters of Junior Golf.
courseName: Las Vegas Paiute Resort - Wolf Course

title: Argentine Stroke Play Championship
notes:
72-hole stroke play event in Argentina. Second 
largest national event besides the Argentine 
Amateur, which is a match play event in the 
winter/spring.

title: Italian International Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
72-hole stroke play championship that draws an 
international field. Cut made after 54 holes.

title: Arizona Wildcat Invitational
notes:
54-hole women's collegiate event hosted by the 
University of Arizona. Team (best four scores of five 
players each day) and individual competitions.

title: Briar's Creek Collegiate Invitational - CANCELLED
notes:
54-hole college tournament hosted by the College 
of Charleston women's golf program. Team (best 
four 
scores out of five players each round) and individual 
competitions.
courseName: The Golf Club At Briar's Creek

title: American Athletic Conference Men's Golf Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
54-hole stroke play event for American Athletic 
Conference Championship tournament. Team (best 
four 
scores out of five players each round) and individual 
competitions.

title: Bryan National Collegiate - CANCELLED
notes:
54-hole collegiate stroke play event hosted by 
the UNCG and Wake Forest women's golf teams. 
Team 
(best four 
scores out of five players each round) and individual 
competitions.

title: PING/ASU Women's Invitational - CANCELLED
notes:
54-hole college tournament hosted by the
Arizona State University women's team. Team (best 
four scores out of five players) and individual 
competitions.

title: North Shore Amateur Tournament
notes:
The North Shore Amateur golf tournament has been hosted since 1956 and is a tournament filled with history with some of the best amateur players from the Chicagoland area. Several have gone on to play PGA Tour events.

The tournament field is limited to 200 players and is divided into three separate divisions:
• Championship Division (recommended handicap index of 8 or less)
• Open/Senior Division (ages 55+)
• Women Division

title: Golf Trek Challenge - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

54-hole event played on multiple Myrtle Beach area courses. Two-man teams will play a different format each day, with Four-Ball on day one, Texas Scramble on day two, and Modified Alternate Shot on day three.

Participants will be flighted into 2 flights based on team handicap. There will be two flights. Age/gender will not be factored in flighting, but will determine your tee box.

title: NCAA Women's South Regional Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
54 hole women's NCAA Regional from which the low 
teams advance to the NCAA Championship.

title: Timuquana Cup Senior Invitational
notes:
Invitational tournament with a field consisting of 40 of the top Mid Amateur players in the country, together with 20 of the top Senior Amateurs and 18 more Super Senior amateurs.

The theme of the event will be a "Gathering of Friends" with a small, select field dedicated to those individuals whose passion is amateur golf. The Timuquana Cup will be a celebration of amateur golf.

The tournament chairman is Steve Melnyk, and USGA Rules Official Tom Dudley will be in charge of course set up and the rules of competition. One of the highlights of this year's event will be a cocktail cruise on the St. Johns River departing from the Timuquana Country Club dock and housing will be available for many competitors in members' homes.

title: Illinois Women’s Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

This event is open to all female residents of Illinois with a handicap index of 22.0 or less. 18 hole stroke play qualifying round to determine match play seeding. Championship Flight comprised of low 32 players. Remainder of field seeded in flights of 8.

Founded in 1933, the IWGA is an all-volunteer organization devoted to advancing golf opportunities for the women and girls of Illinois by conducting state championship tournaments and through fundraising to support charitable contributions to individuals and organizations that embody the spirit of amateur golf.

title: Illinois Senior Women’s Amateur Championship
notes:
The event is open to women who are residents of 
Illinois, have a handicap index of 30.0 or less, and 
have 
reached their 50th birthday by the tournament date. 
The tournament format is 54 holes of stroke play. 
Players are paired by scores with flights also 
established by age groups. This tournament is the 
most popular of the three IWGA events and typically 
has a full field.

title: Bayonet Black Horse Amateur Championship
notes:
54-hole tournament with a 36-hole cut hosted at the 
always-tough Bayonet course at Bayonet Black 
Horse 
in 
Seaside, California. In a relatively short amount of 
time since the tournament was founded in 2015, it 
has turned into one of the top amateur events on 
the 
west coast, drawing top collegiate and mid-am 
talent 
to the Monterey Peninsula. Open to amateur golfers 
with an official and verified handicap index not 
exceeding 7.4.

title: Illinois Open Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play event comprised of 
professionals as well as amateurs. Non-exempt 
players 
must pre-qualify. Open to any legal resident of the 
State of Illinois. Amateurs must carry a verified 
handicap index of 10.0 or less.

title: Minnesota State Open Championship
notes:
Beginning in 1917, the Minnesota State Open is a 
premiere golf tournament bringing together top 
professional and amateur players all vying to have 
their name included with the likes of Les Bolstad, 
George Shortridge, and Tom Lehman as past 
champions. An 18-hole qualifier is required for those 
who do not meet the exemption criteria. Format will 
be 54-holes of stroke play with a cut to the 
low 60 and ties after 36 holes.

title: Pennsylvania Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
State championship for women, mid-amateurs (ages 
25+), seniors (ages 50+) 
and super seniors (ages 65+). Entries are open to 
amateur 
golfers who (1) were female only at birth (2) are 
members of a club that belongs to the Pennsylvania 
Golf Association and (3) have a USGA 
Handicap Index of no more than 22.5. 18-hole 
stroke 
play 
qualifying to determine match play brackets. Players 
will compete in match play flights of 8 or 16, 
dependent on 
entries.

title: Kwazulu Natal Amateur Match Play Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Match play championship with regional qualifiers.

title: Oregon Senior Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
Entries are open to female amateur golfers who are 50 years of age or older with USGA Handicap Indexes™ of 36.4 or less. All entrants must be members in good standing of an OGA Member Club.

The Senior defending Women’s Champion Anita Wicks and 15 finishers from the open division 18-hole stroke play qualifier will advance to the Championship flight match play portion of the competition, with the remaining entrants placed in match play flights according to score. The Women’s Division WILL have drop flights. There will be NO age bracket flights. *The number of flights may change depending on the number of entrants, and may not guarantee a contestant a match play flight.

title: Golfweek Senior National Match Play
notes:
Top-32 Senior amateurs invited based on 
Golfweek Senior Rankings, as well as another 
top-32 Super Senior amateurs.

title: Moore County Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship with Open, Senior 
(ages 55+), 
and Super Senior (65+, 70+, 75+) flights. Open to 
men, 16 years of age 
and older. No residency requirement.

title: World Stars of Golf Invitational Tournament
notes:
The World Stars of Golf Amateur Championship 
invites 
male and female juniors golfers to bring their 
skills to 
participate in this World Golf Championship.  Players 
from 
the all 
over the World will participate. 54 hole stroke play 
championship.

title: English Men's Senior Open Amateur
notes:
54-hole stroke play championship for senior 
internationals.

title: Senior Golf Association of Northern California Championship - POSTPONED
notes:
**Postponed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36 hole Stableford championship for members of the SGANC. Gross and Net flights.

title: Massachusetts Super Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
Making its debut in 2014, the Massachusetts Super Senior Amateur Championship was launched in order to crown the top senior amateur competitor who is 65 years or older.

Entries are open to amateur golfers who hold membership in an MGA member club, who have reached their 65th birthday by start of tournament and have an up-to-date MGA/USGA GHIN Handicap Index not exceeding 12.0 or have completed their handicap certification as defined on the Entry Form.

title: Lehigh Valley Amateur Tournament
notes:
The Lehigh Valley Amateur Tournament is held in 
September and attracts hundreds of golfers from all 
over the area. 18 holes of stroke play to determine 
seeding for a 64-player match play bracket. There is 
also a second flight, as well as Junior, Senior (x 2), and 
Super Senior flights.

title: Orlando International Amateur Championship
notes:
The Orlando International Amateur Championship is an annual golf tournament gathering high-level amateur golfers from the United States of America and abroad. 54-hole stroke play championship, playing 18 holes per day.

Open to low-handicap amateurs, players who play college golf, players who have qualified for any of the current year's USGA or R&A championships, and those who have the recommendation of their country’s Federation or Association.
courseName: Orange County National Golf Center - Panther Lake Course

title: East Lake Cup Collegiate Match Play Championship
notes:
Started in 2015 and hosted by the historic 
East 
Lake Golf Club Atlanta, this collegiate, three-day 
match
play competition features the top-performing 
teams 
from the previous year's NCAA Men’s
Golf Championships. There is an individual award for 
the low 18-hole scorer 
in the seeding round.

title: Southern Illinois Golf Association Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play event that has been held for 
over 
90 years. Includes gross, net, senior, and super 
senior 
divisions.

title: Short Par 4 Fall Classic
notes:
This 72-hole event uses four types of team 
competition 
while playing spectacular golf courses in the 
Myrtle 
Beach area. Day one is Best-Ball, day two is Texas 
Scramble, day three is Best-Ball, and 
day 
four is Modified Alternate Shot.

title: South Carolina Super Senior Four Ball Championship - POSTPONED
notes:
**Postponed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The Championship will be split into two Divisions - a Championship Division for players 65-69 and a Legends Division for players over the age of 70.

title: Texas Girls' Junior Championship
notes:
The Texas Girls Junior Championship is a 54-hole 
stroke 
play championship. The 60 -player field is cut to the 
low 27 and ties after the first round. All players must 
be a resident of Texas and have not yet enrolled in 
college.
courseName: Horseshoe Bay Resort - Summit Rock Course

title: Texas Women's Stroke Play Championship
notes:
Open to female amateur golfers who are residents of 
Texas and member of TGA. Format is 54-holes of 
stroke play with championship and flighted divisions. 
Top 30 players and ties after 36 holes will be placed 
in 
the Championship Flight and all remaining players 
will 
compete in two additional flights.

title: Northern California Mid-Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The NCGA Mid-Amateur Championship began in 1982 as the Master Division Championship, a competitive opportunity for players aged 40-54 who were not yet eligible for senior tournaments. In 2016, the event was re-named the Mid-Amateur Championship, opening up to all players aged 25 and over, with no upper age restriction. The champagne bucket trophy was donated by two-time California State Amateur champion Ernie Pieper.

36 hole stroke play championship with pre-qualifying required for non-exempt players. Max handicap 5.4.

title: Philippine Amateur Open Stroke Play
notes:
72-hole stroke play tournament open to men and 
women. Players should have a certified handicap 
index 
of 8.0 below for men and 10.0 below for women.
The championship field is comprised of the 90 
men and 
42 women with the lowest handicap indices.

title: Saguaro Amateur
notes:
54-hole event with field comprised of 108 
men’s amateur golfers from all over the United 
States. Most players are college golfers on winter 
break. All players must have completed high school 
by January 1 and must have a handicap of 3.0 or 
lower. The host club, Ak-Chin Southern Dunes, has 
hosted the Arizona Amateur three times as well as 
U.S. 
Open and PGA Tour qualifying.

title: Oregon Four-Ball Championship
notes:
18-hole stroke-play qualifying round followed by low 
32 
match play for Men and low 16 match play for 
Women 
and Senior Men (ages 50 and over). There is a 
consolation flight after the first round of matches. All 
contestants must be members in good standing of 
an 
OGA Member Club.

title: West Coast Women's Amateur
notes:
Started in 2017, this is a 54-hole stroke play event 
that draws a field of top collegiate and state 
amateurs. The Championship Flight is open to 
amateur 
golfers with an official and verified handicap index 
not 
exceeding 7.4. The Senior Flight is open to amateur 
golfers age 50+ with an official and verified 
handicap 
index not exceeding 9.4.

title: U.S. Senior Women's Open Championship
notes:
The U.S. Senior Women's Open is one of 14 national 
championships conducted by the USGA. The 
event is open to any female age 50 and over who 
has a 
USGA 
Handicap Index not exceeding 7.4.

title: African Amateur Stroke Play Championship
notes:
72-hole South African Golf Association event started 
in 
2016 that brings together a highly competitive 
international field. Cut is made to the low 65 players 
after the third round.

title: Forsyth Championship
notes:
The deadline to enter tournament is one week before tournament date and it is for Forsyth County residents ONLY. Applications will be available one month before the deadline. Applications will be distributed to all area golf courses, on the City of Winston-Salem website and mailed to participants from last year’s tournament.

There is also a team competition with the top four golfers from each golf course playing for first, second, and third place in the team standings.

title: Forsyth Seniors Tournament
notes:
The deadline to enter tournament is one week before 
tournament date and it is for Forsyth County residents 
only.  Applications will be available one month before 
the deadline. Applications will be distributed to all area 
golf courses, on the City of Winston-Salem website and 
mailed to 
participants from last year’s tournament.
courseName: Maple Chase Golf and Country Club

title: Forsyth Juniors Tournament
notes:
The deadline to enter tournament is one week before 
tournament date and it is for Forsyth County residents 
ONLY.  Applications will be available one month before 
the deadline. Applications will be distributed to all area 
golf courses, on the City of Winston-Salem website and 
mailed to 
participants from last year’s tournament.

title: The Egg Invitational
notes:
The Egg Invitational is a two-day 54 hole scratch Four-Ball event. 36 Holes are slated for the first day of competition with a shotgun start and 18 holes of play on the final day. The Egg aims to bring together players from the nation’s finest facilities for two days of great golf and camaraderie.

The host course is a Tom Fazio design ranked as high as #52 on Golf Digest’s America’s 100 Greatest Courses. Situated in the foothills of the Appalachian Mountains, the course has hosted the MAC Championship and NCAA Division I Men’s Central Regional, and features gently rolling countryside, dramatic elevation changes, unique wetlands, and a plentiful mix of mature woods.

On-site lodging is available upon request.

title: McHenry County Men’s Amateur
notes:
This is a two-day, 36-hole stroke play event. Players will be paired according to handicap for the 1st round and then placed into flights according to 1st round scores. The number of flights will be determined based upon the number of entries received for the event. There will be approximately 20-25 players per flight.

Open to any male that is either a resident of McHenry County, Illinois or is a member at a golf course in McHenry County that is at least 18 years old by the start of the tournament.

title: Georgia Senior Open
notes:
Open to all Professionals and Amateurs who live in 
the 
state of Georgia and are age 50 or older. Senior and 
Super Senior (age 65+) divisions.

title: Society of Seniors Founders Cup
notes:
Created in 2016, this tournament is a 54-hole stroke 
play championship with Senior, Super Senior and 
Grand Master Divisions.

title: The Carolinian Amateur Championship
notes:
The tournament format is 54-holes of stroke play for 
male amateur golfers ages 16 and older who have a 
USGA handicap index of 7.4 or lower at a CGA 
member 
club. The field will be reduced to the low 70 and ties 
after 36-holes.  The champion will receive an 
exemption 
into the Carolinas Amateur.

title: Grand Rapids City Championship
notes:
54-hole event played in two days. The field is cut to 
low 
60 players and ties after the first round.

title: Michigan Senior/Mid-Amateur Team Championship
notes:
This unique Championship features one 
day of 
competition that will include 18 holes of 
four-ball 
and 18 holes of foursomes. Three qualifying sites in 
May determine the final teams (one from each of the 
three locations) who play in 
September for the championship. Teams for this 
event 
will be made up of at least one player who 
has 
reached their 55th birthday prior to the 
Championship along with a second player 
who has 
reached their 25th birthday. Must be a 
GAM 
member.

title: Minnesota Public Golf Association Four-Ball Championship
notes:
36-hole four-ball stroke play championship with 
Championship, Senior (ages 50+) and Net divisions. 
This Championship is open to amateur players who 
are 
a member of a club that is a member of the 
Minnesota 
Public Golf Association (MPGA) and has a current 
active 
GHIN handicap at that club.

title: East Tennessee Amateur Championship
notes:
The Championship Division and age appropriate Senior 
Divisions are 36 hole stroke play competitions. Flight 
Play is a 3 round match play event.

title: Snohomish County Amateur Championship
notes:
54-hole Individual Stroke Play Competition - Gross 
and Net. Championship, Senior and Junior divisions. 
The Snohomish County Amateur is limited to 
Amateur 
Golfers who are in good standing of a Snohomish 
County Men’s Golf Club with an active GHIN Number 
and Handicap Index. There are no age restrictions. 
No 
requirement of player's residence being in 
Snohomish 
County.

title: S.P. Jermain Memorial Match Play Championship
notes:
Annual match play tournament run by the Toledo Metro Golf Association over the course of two weekends and hosted at Ottawa Park Golf Course, known as the second oldest golf course in the U.S.

ELIGIBILITY:
Tournament is open all amateur golfers residing in the following counties: OHIO - Lucas, Fulton, Williams, Defiance, Henry, Paulding, Van Wert, Allen, Putnam, Hancock, Wood, Seneca, Erie, Ottawa and Sandusky. MICHIGAN - Monroe, Lenawee and Hillsdale. (Note: Senior Division starts at age 50.)

title: Hartford Women's Open Championship
notes:
Played for the first time in 2016, the event is open 
to 
amateur and professional golfers. The event is a 36-
hole 
event played at Hartford, CT's two public golf 
course, 
Goodwin Park and Keney Park.

title: Westwood Invitational
notes:
Oklahoma's largest stroke play event played around 
the 4th of July holiday. 54-hole flighted stroke play 
championship.

title: Augusta City Amateur
notes:
For 2020 this will be a two-round event.

The Augusta City Amateur Golf Tournament at Forest Hills is a long-standing tradition for Augusta golfers. Handicaps are not needed, the Augusta City Amateur is a flighted event. Players will play two rounds and be designated to a flight based on scores. Prizes will be awarded to the top 33% in each flight based on the low three-day scores. There will be a cut after two rounds, keeping the top 60 players and ties in the Open division (ages 16 and older), and 36 and ties in the Senior division (ages 50 and older).

title: Women's Olympic Golf Tournament
notes:
72-hole stroke-play event. Qualification is based 
primarily upon the Women's World Golf Rankings, with 
the top fifteen automatically qualifying (with a limit of 
four per country), and then the highest ranked players 
from countries that had not yet already qualified two 
players.

title: Men's Olympic Golf Tournament
notes:
72-hole stroke-play event. Qualification is based 
primarily upon the Official World Golf Ranking, with the 
top fifteen automatically qualifying (with a limit of four 
per country), and then the highest ranked players from 
countries that had not yet already qualified two players.

title: Big Island Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Until 2020, this tournament had never skipped a year since being founded in 1924. 36-hole stroke play championship with championship, senior and net flights.

title: Westmoreland County Amateur
notes:
This two day, 36-hole event is open to current or 
past 
residents of Westmoreland County, as well as 
members 
of golf clubs located in the county. Players that can 
demonstrate a record of playing three times per 
week 
at a public course that does not have memberships 
may be eligible as well -- check with the committee.

title: Staten Island Senior Amateur Champonship
notes:
Match play seeding determined by qualifying held prior 
to the championship. Matches are played over 
consecutive weekends at two different courses.

title: Neches River Four-Ball
notes:
Annual tournament run by the Men's Association of 
Beaumont Country Club. Two-man best ball gross 
competition event. Flights determined by the lower 
of the team's handicaps. The last flight is played at net.

title: Connecticut Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play. Prizes will be awarded for 
overall 
champion and each age category (junior, senior, 
super-
senior). Must have a USGA handicap at a CSGA 
member club of 16.0 or less.

title: Leo Spooner Memorial Invitational
notes:
36-hole two-man best-ball tournament with Regular 
and Senior (both players ages 55+) divisions. Like its 
companion individual event held at the same 
club, this event has been run for decades and 
attracts a talented group of scratch Midwest golfers 
each year. The Northland Country Club, a Donald Ross 
design, plays host.

title: Florida Winter Series - Juliette Falls
notes:
The Florida Winter Series is for players 25 years and 
older. *Gross scoring only**. A Regular or 
Foundation 
Florida State Golf Association membership level is 
required. The field is broken down into three 
divisions 
by age. Mid-Amateur (25-54); Senior (55-64); and 
Super Senior (65 & over) Mid-Senior plays 
approximately 6,700 yards. Senior plays 
approximately 
6,400 yards. Super-Senior approximately 6,100 
yards.

title: Florida Winter Series - Conservatory at Hammock Beach
notes:
The Florida Winter Series is for players 25 years and 
older. *Gross scoring only**. A Regular or 
Foundation 
Florida State Golf Association membership level is 
required. The field is broken down into three 
divisions 
by age. Mid-Amateur (25-54); Senior (55-64); and 
Super Senior (65 & over) Mid-Senior plays 
approximately 6,700 yards. Senior plays 
approximately 
6,400 yards. Super-Senior approximately 6,100 
yards.

title: Veteran Golfers Association Championship
notes:
The Veteran Golfers Association is committed to 
promoting the game of golf to veterans and their 
family members. The VGA Championship is the 
organization's national 36-hole stroke play 
competition for VGA 
members who have made it through one of four 
regional qualifiers. Players divided are into four 
men's 
flights (A,B, C and D) and one women's flight (F) 
based 
on skill-level.
courseName: Trump National Doral - Blue Monster Course

title: Women's California State Open
notes:
First played in 2016, the Women's California State 
Open is a 36-hole stroke play competition put on by 
the 
Southern California PGA. Open to amateurs and 
professionals.

title: East Lake Cup Collegiate Women's Match Play Championship
notes:
Started in 2015 and hosted by the historic 
East 
Lake Golf Club Atlanta, this collegiate, two-day 
match
play competition features the top-performing 
teams 
from the previous year's NCAA Women's
Golf Championships.

title: Texas Medalist Series - North #3 - CANCELLED
notes:
36-hole stroke play competition as part of the TGA 
Medalist Series, conducted for low- handicap 
amateurs.

To play in a TGA Medalist Series tournament, each 
player will be required to pay an annual registration 
fee.

title: Bradenton City Amateur
notes:
Open to all male amateurs golfers with 
championship, senior 
and super senior divisions. Format consists of 36 
holes 
stroke play with flights to be determined after the 
first 
round.

title: Texas Medalist Series - North #2
notes:
36-hole stroke play competition as part of the TGA 
Medalist Series, conducted for low- handicap 
amateurs. 
To play in a TGA Medalist Series tournament, each 
player will be required to pay an annual registration 
fee.

title: McClure Cup
notes:
Founded in 2017, the McClure Cup is 54-hole stroke 
play event held on both the Bayonet and Black 
Horse 
Golf Courses, with a cut to the top third of the field 
after 36 holes. The Championship flight is open to 
amateurs with an index not exceeding 7.4.

title: Southeast Iowa Amateur
notes:
The SE Iowa Amateur is an Iowa Golf Association 
Player-of-the-Year point event for both open division 
players, seniors (50+) and super seniors (65+).
Open Division participants will play 36 holes of 
stroke 
play with the top 20 and ties playing an additional 9 
holes Sunday afternoon to
determine a champion. Senior & Super Senior 
Division participants will play a separate set of tees 
and be based on 36-hole scores. Open to all 
amateur 
golfers.

title: The Gobbler Amateur
notes:
Founded in 2016, the Gobbler Invitational is a 54-hole 
stroke play event with no cut. It is open to male 
amateur golfers with an index of 3.0 or less. A variety 
of exemption categories are offered, based mostly on 
rankings and USGA appearances. The top 10 finishers 
will be exempt into 
the Saguaro Amateur in January.

title: Minnesota Women's Senior Amateur Four-Ball Championship
notes:
Format is 36-holes, Four-Ball stroke play without 
handicap to be conducted over two days, with no cut. 
The field will be flighted after the close of entries, and 
teams will be assigned to a flight based on the lowest 
individual handicap index of the two team members.

title: Dogwood State Junior Boys' Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play tournament. Field will be 
reduced 
to the low half of the field and ties after 36-holes. 
Boys 
compete in one division; there are no age divisions. 
Open to boys from NC ages 12-18 and under who 
have 
a USGA Handicap Index of 18.3 or lower.

title: Tennessee Senior & Super Senior Match Play

Open to male senior amateurs who are members of 
the 
TGA with a handicap less than 10. Format consists

36 holes of stroke play followed by a cut to the low 
16 
for match play.

notes:
Open to professionals and amateurs who reside in 
the 
state of New York. An 18-hole qualifier is required 
for 
those who do not meet the exemption criteria. 
Format

low 
60 and ties after the 2nd round.

title: Long Island Father & Son Championship
notes:
Team competition with gross and net prizes. Must have 
a handicap at a Long Island club or course.

title: First Coast Amateur
notes:
The First Coast Amateur some of the nation’s top amateur, collegiate and junior talent, a handful of international players, and many of the best golfers from North Florida and other Florida cities. Contestants must be 16 years of age.

The championship is 54 holes of stroke play and ends on the Martin Luther King holiday. All competitors will vie for the First Coast Amateur title. A separate tournament within the tournament for mid-amateurs, those age 25 and older, will also be contested.

All player entries will be subject to approval by the tournament committee. The first criteria for entry will be verification of a USGA handicap index of 4.0 or better and submission of competitive accomplishments.

title: First Coast Women's Amateur
notes:
First played in 2017; 36-holes of stroke play 
hosted by the Jacksonville Golf Association. Open to 
women amateur golfers from around the country.

title: Kentucky Women's Open Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship open to professionals and amateurs. KY Resident or College Amateur shall be required to have an active Handicap Index at a Kentucky Golf Association Member Club at the time of registration. 25 years of age or older are eligible to compete in the Mid-Amateur division of the championship.

Entrants in all KGA tournaments shall be required to have an active Handicap Index at a Kentucky Golf Association Member Club at the time of entry and meet the championship’s residency requirements

title: Washington Senior Men's Four-Ball Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36-hole Four-Ball Stroke Play (Gross and Net). The field will be divided into flights based on team handicap.

title: Illinois State Junior Girls' Amateur Championship
notes:
The tournament format is 36 holes of stroke play with flights being determined by the first round scores. The event focuses on providing a friendly and competitive atmosphere.

The event is open to girls who are residents of Illinois, have a handicap of 28 or less or a scoring average or 100 or less, and have not yet reached their 19th birthday or begun college.

title: Chicago District Amateur Four-Ball Championship
notes:
Open to amateur pairs who are members of the 
CDGA. 
Format is 18-holes of four-ball stroke play to 
determine a round of 16 match play bracket.

title: American Seniors Cape Cod Clambake
notes:
54-hole stroke-play event held on Cape Cod just 
after 
the height of tourism season

title: North Carolina Super Senior Four-Ball - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The North Carolina Super Senior Four-Ball Championship was created in in 2017 and is for men age 65 and over. This championship is conducted at 36 holes of four-ball stroke play. Entry is open to any male amateur golfer who is a legal resident of North Carolina, is a member in good standing of a club which is a member of the Carolinas Golf Association and has an active GHIN® USGA Handicap Index®. Teams may sign up for the 65+ or 70+ age division.

title: Connecticut Father & Son Championship
notes:
18-hole foursomes (selected drive alternate shot) 
stroke play championship. Combined Team Handicap 
may not exceed 18.0.

**Cancelled due to the coronavirus utbreak.

NCGA Point Event. 36 Hole stroke Play Event with a championship division open to players 54 years of age or younger with a handicap index 8.7 or less. The senior division is open to players 55 years of age or older with a handicap index of 8.9 or less.

title: Contra Costa Senior Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36-hole individual stroke play event with senior and super senior divisions. All players play at scratch.

Started in 2017, this 36-hole four-ball stroke 
play 
event is named in the 
honor 
of one of the West's most prolific golf course 
architects, 
William Bell, who designed DRCC's original 
eighteen 
holes, Oak and Bluff in 1947. There will be three

(18 
years and older), Senior-Amateur (55 years 
and 
older) and Super Senior (65 years and older). Open 
to mid-
amateurs within an index 
7.4 or 
lower and seniors with an index 9.4 or lower. 
Maximum 
of 60 teams, 20 per flight.

Handicap

be 
awarded.

notes:
The Gloria Armstrong championship is a 36-hole 
stroke play event for women and senior women. The 
championship used to be played the weekend of the 
Oakland City, but changed to its own event in 2016.

title: Vermont Fall Four-Ball Tournament
notes:
Residents of Vermont must be a member of a club of 
the VGA. Non-residents can be members of a VGA 
member club for 3 years. Format: 36 holes stroke 
play; 18 holes on Saturday and 18 holes Sunday. 
The 
Tournament will be flighted based on combined 
handicaps as follows: 
1. Championship Flight: Combined handicaps of 12 
or 
less. 
2. Net Flight: Combined handicaps of 13 or more. 
Flights of 16 teams. 
3. Senior Championship: Each member of the team 
must be 55 or older

title: World Junior Girls Championship - CANCELLED

**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

First played in 2014, the World Junior Girls Championship features 16 three person teams (two from host Canada). Each team plays a 72-holes of stroke-play and at the end of the final round there are team and individual champions.

a

Must

54-hole stroke play competition open to all Michigan residents. This event is eligible for Golf Association of Michigan (GAM) Honor Roll points. The field will be limited to 120 players with a cut to the top 30 and ties coming after 36-holes.

The Kent County Amateur is a 54-hole stroke play competition that is open to all Michigan residents. The top 90 and ties after the first round will advance and then the top 30 and ties will advance after the second round.

The Kent County Amateur also includes a Senior Division (55+) and it will be a 36-hole event.

The Sizzler is a partner tournament to the Southwestern Amateur. Players are encouraged to play in both events.

**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Applicants for the Mid-Am Match Play must be at least 25 years of age. Applicants for the Senior Match Play must be at least 55 years of age. Entries are subject to approval or rejection at any time by the NHGA. Entrants must have an up-to-date NHGA/USGA GHIN Handicap Index.

Tournament is 18 holes stroke play after which the competition will transition to match play. The top 16 players will make the Championship Flight, with additional flights of eight players each.

notes:
LPGA Tour players Lizette Salas and Lee Lopez host this unique event, which was started in 2016 with the purpose of helping grow girls' golf, introducing younger players to partnership play, and bringing junior and college players together for two days of networking and competition.

The format is 36 holes of best-ball stroke play, with separate divisions for juniors (ages 12-18) and college players (ages 19-25). The entry fee is a very affordable $85 per player or $170 per team.

In addition to trophies and prizes, top finishers in each division earn exemptions into various junior and amateur tournaments, respectively.

The Marion R. Morrison National Senior Championship, or the Morrison Cup, is a 54-hole stroke play tournament with three divisions: Seniors (ages 55+), Super Seniors (65+) and Legends (70+).

Entries are open to male amateur golfers who have reached their 55th birthday on or before the tournament date. Applicants must have a USGA handicap index of 5.0 or less (10.0 or less in the Super Senior and Legends Divisions).

Entries will be considered first in the order they are received, second by player index, and third by past performance in similar competitions.

title: Seacoast Amateur Golf Championship
notes:
The purpose of the Championship is to determine the best golfer in the Seacoast area. This golfer does not have to be a member of any of the host courses, but must play the majority of their golf at one of these courses.

There is also a team competition, The Kay Stulb Memorial Championship. The three (3) low scores from each Club’s representatives in the field are counted each day of competition. The low total after three (3) rounds will determine the Team Champion.

Along with the individual and team competition, there is a senior competition, The Tony Loch Senior Championship, for those 55 years of age or older.

State Senior: Three flights based on age 50-59, 60- 69, and 70 and over. Low gross and low net in each flight. State senior overall low gross champion and overall low net champion.

State Mid-Amateur: overall low gross champion and overall net champion.

notes:

notes:

Championship.

notes:

of

notes:

title: Griesedieck St. Louis Men's Championship
notes:
36 holes of stroke play qualifying to determine 16 players for match play. Entrant must be a male amateur member of a Member Club of the St. Louis District Golf Association or a special invitee. The entrant must have an up-to-date and current USGA GHIN Handicap Index of not more than 9.9. This entry and Handicap must be certified by an Association or Club authorized to issue a USGA GHIN Handicap.

The “Alvin Greisedieck Sr. Memorial Trophy”, a beautiful silver trophy emblematic of the St. Louis District Golf Association, donated by Joseph Griesedieck, will be in competition this year. The winner will have custody for one year and will return the trophy in time for the championship the following year.

title: LANCO Brent L. Miller Match Play Championship
notes:
Field is limited to 16 players including last year's champion. There is no registration; the top-ranked players are invited to play.

Players are ranked based on results from the current year's LANCO Amateur and LANCO Open.
#1 Seed - Last Year's Match Play Champion
#2 Seed - Amateur Champion
#3 Seed - Low Amateur in the Open

The other 13 players are seeded based on their performance in both the Amateur and Open (with more weight given to the Amateur).

Conducted as a 54-stroke play event, the GVA is limited to the first 120 amateur golfers with a USGA Handicap index, at the time of entry, not exceeding 8.0 strokes. The GVA includes a Senior Division for entrants age 50 or above.

title: James H. Fyke Municipal Amateur Golf Championship
notes:
The Municipal Amateur Championship was founded in 1981 by Jim Fyke. Modeled after the City Open, it was his vision to create an amateur golf championship that was truly open to all competitors in Nashville and the surrounding areas. 54 hole stroke play championship.

Applications are open to male residents of the Nashville Metropolitan Statistical Area who meet the USGA definition of an amateur golfer. Persons applying for reinstatement to amateur status are not eligible. All competitors must be at least 18 years of age.

The Metropolitan Statistical Area includes:Nashville- Davidson-Murfreesboro-Franklin (Cannon, Cheatham, Davidson, Dickson, Hickman, Macon, Maury, Robertson, Rutherford, Smith, Sumner, Trousdale, Williamson, Wilson)

title: Women’s District of Columbia Senior Championship
notes:
The WDCGA Senior Tournament is a 2-day stroke play competition. The winner and runner up are the low gross scores of the entire field. There is a Super Senior and/or a Co- Super Senior award for competitors 65 years of age and older. Special prizes are sponsored by Past President Nancy Graves for the overall low gross winners of the following age brackets: 60-69, 70-79, 80 and over.

The field is divided into flights. Net and gross prizes are awarded in all flights. The Senior Tournament Chair makes the pairings for the first day of play. Pairings on the second day are according to gross scores from the first day of competition.

The

title: Wisconsin State Open Championship
notes:
72-Hole Stroke Play Competition with an open qualifier preceding the championship. Forst contested in 1919. A 36 hole cut will be made after Round 2 is completed. The low 60 and ties will make the cut.

Open to any legal resident of the State of Wisconsin. Any non-exempt player attempting to qualify must reside in the State of Wisconsin for a minimum of three months during the calendar year.

title: Wisconsin Senior Open Championship
notes:
36-Hole Stroke Play Competition with a Super Senior (60+) Division. Low gross and low net prizes will be awarded for amateurs.

Open to any legal resident of the state of Wisconsin or a non-resident that resides in the state of Wisconsin for a minimum of three months.

title: Wisconsin State Women's Open Championship
notes:
36-Hole Stroke Play Competition. Open to legal 
residents of the state of Wisconsin or a member of a 
club in the Wisconsin Section PGA.

title: Oahu Country Club Invitational
notes:
FLIGHTS:
(1) Open Flight (54 holes stroke play) all male amateur invitees and members with a maximum handicap index of 7.0. Cut to the low 30 players and ties after 36 holes.
(2) Mid Amateur Flight (36 holes stroke play, gross scoring) All male amateurs invitees and members, 25 and older, with a maximum handicap index of 7.0.
(3) Senior Championship (36 holes gross and net stroke play) all male amateur invitees and members, age 55 and older, with a maximum handicap index of 12.0. The Senior Division players may play on Saturday as part of the low 30 gross and ties if desired.
(4) Team Flight (36 holes stroke play) (5 man team of invitees and/or members).

FORMAT:
The player with the low 54 hole gross score wins overall event and the trophy. The Mid Amateur with the low 36 hole gross score wins the Mid Amateur Flight and the Mid Amateur Trophy. Senior with low 36 hole gross score wins the Senior event and the Senior Trophy. Low 36 hole Senior net score wins Senior Net Trophy. Mid Amateurs and Seniors may play for the Open Flight Championship if they make the gross score cut.

title: Oahu Country Club Women's Invitational
notes:
Format: 36-Hole modified Stableford scoring. Net scoring in all flights, Championship Flight gross and net scoring.

Entries are limited to amateur women 15 years and older; with GHIN handicaps.

title: Berks County Amateur Championship
notes:
This is a three-day, 54-hole stroke play event with the first round to be scheduled on Friday and the final two rounds on consecutive Saturday/Sunday. Entry requires each player to have an attested USGA handicap index of 8.5 or better to participate.

After the first round, the field will be cut to 40 players and ties for the second round and third rounds.

**Optional Change to format: After the first round, the field will be cut by 30% or to 60 players and ties, whichever is lower. All 2nd Rd. players will play 18 holes on Saturday with a cut to the low 30 players and ties for continuation of play for Sunday’s Final round. If there is a tie at the conclusion of Sunday’s round, a three-hole play-off, followed by ‘Sudden Death’ will be used to determine a Champion.

title: Berks County Match Play Championship
notes:
Entry requires each player to have an attested USGA handicap index of 8.5 or better to participate. The Qualifying round will be held on Monday through Friday limiting the field to 16 players in Match Play competition. The 18-hole Matches will commence on Saturday with two rounds, followed by Sunday’s semifinals and final rounds to determine the champion.

**Optional Change to format (Must have BOD approval): The qualifying field will be reduced to 32 players for the Matches. The qualifying round must be held at least one day removed from the first days’ matches, which would begin on a Friday.

title: Berks County Public Links Championship
notes:
Two-day, 36 hole stroke play tournament for public 
players.

title: Berks County Partners Championship
notes:
This is a two-day, 36-hole stroke play event and may be scheduled Monday through Sunday as appropriate.

Current format:

First Round: Four-ball;
Second Round: Foursome (modified alternate shot). The players shall both play from the teeing ground. They shall cross over and play their partners ball. They shall choose which player’s ball to play and alternate until the ball is holed out.

Note 1: The field will be broken into additional flight(s), depending on the number of entries.

title: Berks County Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
This is a two-day, 36-hole stroke play event. Competition will be by two divisions (Overall and Super Senior) and also in age groups (Overall, 50- 54, 55-59, 60-64, 65-69, 70 & over).

Note 1: The addition of a Super Senior division will be added beginning in 2010. Players, who are 65 years of age and older, will play from adjusted Senior tees.

Note 2: Individuals 65 yrs or older wishing to compete for the ‘Overall’ Championship must check the 60-64 age group and will compete in that age group and from the men’s tees.
