made after 36 holes. A green jacket is awarded to 
the 
tournament champion.

title: Genesee Allstar Classic
notes:
54 hole stroke play championship with Regular, Senior 
and Super Senior divisions. Regular and Senior 
divisions play 36 holes the first day.

title: Pikes Peak Amateur
notes:
Stroke play qualifying determines match play flights for 
both regular and senior divisions. Played at the third-
oldest public golf course west of the Mississippi.

title: The Tillinghast Invitational
notes:
36 holes of stroke play. Open to all amateur golfers 
who have a current official USGA Handicap Index. 
Players may declare for the Championship flight or will 
be pre-flighted
based on current handicap. The number of flights will 
be determined by the size of the field.

title: St. Rule Trophy - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The St Rule Trophy attracts players from all over the world who relish the opportunity to play on the New and Old Courses at St Andrews Links. 54 holes open amateur stroke play tournament – for lady golfers with a handicap not exceeding 2.4.

title: Utah Women's Open Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship for professionals and 
amateurs that was created in 2017. Amateurs 
are not eligible for Professional Purse Money but will 
have a separate amateur merchandise purse.

title: Henry County Country Club Men's Invitational
notes:
36 hole stroke play with flights determined by 
contestants' handicaps. Championship and First Flights 
play the back tees. Higher flights go off early on day 
two, with the Championship Flight going off last. All 
amateurs must have a current GHIN Handicap Index.

title: Northwest Open Invitational
notes:
54 hole championship for professionals and 
amateurs. 
No cut. Amateurs must have a current USGA 
handicap 
index of 8.0 or less.

title: Tacoma City Amateur Championship
notes:
This tournament has been held every year since 
1931 
making it one of the longest consecutively-running 
amateur tournaments in the country. The event 
consists of a 54 holes stroke play. Final qualifiers will 
consist of the low 30 scores plus ties after the first 
two 
rounds. Entrants must be a minimum of 16 years old 
and have a maximum handicap of 10.

title: Western Maryland Amateur
notes:
The Annual Western Maryland Amateur is a stroke play event open to all male amateurs and is played over 54 holes. There is a “cut” after Saturday’s round combining the 2 day gross scores, with the low 30 players and ties competing in the Championship flight on Sunday, while all others not making the “cut’ will be flighted for play on Sunday. The 3 day total score is used to determine the winners in all of the flights. All players making the championship flight are guaranteed to receive a prize.

We also have a senior division with 3 age flights for those 55 & older as of the tournament date. Other events include “Closest to the Pins” on Friday & Saturday sponsored by the Women’s Golf Association. A practice round is included on Thursday with an option 2 man Best Ball Tournament with prizes being determined by the number of participants.

title: Portage County Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
First played in the 1970s, this is a 36-hole stroke play 
event with Senior (50-59), Senior 
Gold (60-69), Senior Platinum (70+) and Senior 
Women Divisions.

title: City of Aiken Amateur Championship
notes:
36 hole stroke play championship with Regular, 
Senior, 
Super Senior and Ladies divisions, with players 
flighted 
after the first round based on their score. There is 
also 
a two-player team competition featuring players in 
different divisions representing the same golf club.

title: Dr. Donnis Thompson Invitational
notes:
54-hole women's college 
tournament hosted by the 
University of Hawaii. Team (best four scores out of five 
players each round) and individual competitions.

title: Clover Cup
notes:
54 hole team and individual women's college 
tournament hosted by the University of Notre Dame. 
Team (best four scores out of five players each round) 
and individual competitions.

title: The Schooner Fall Classic
notes:
54-hole women's college 
tournament hosted 
by the University of Oklahoma. Team (best four 
scores 
out of five players each round) and individual 
competitions.

title: Betsy Rawls Longhorn Invitational
notes:
54 hole women's college 
tournament hosted by the University of Texas. Team 
(best four scores out of five players each round) and 
individual competitions.

title: Mountain View Collegiate - CANCELLED
notes:
54-hole women's college 
tournament hosted by University of 
Missouri and Kansas State University. Team (best 
four 
scores out of five players each round) and individual 
competitions.

title: Lady Buckeye Invitational - CANCELLED
notes:
54 hole women's college 
tournament hosted by the Ohio State University. 
Team 
(best four scores out of six players each round) and 
individual competitions.
courseName: Ohio State University Golf Course - Scarlet Course

title: Augusta Women's Invitational
notes:
54 hole team and individual women's college 
tournament hosted by 
Augusta State University. Team (best four scores out 
of 
five players each round) and individual competitions.

title: Juli Inkster Meadow Club Intercollegiate
notes:
54-hole team and individual women's college 
tournament hosted by University of San 
Francisco and San Jose State.

title: Westbrook Invitational
notes:
54-hole team and individual women's college event 
hosted by the University of 
Wisconsin. The low four scores of the five players 
determine the team score each round.

title: German Women's International Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

72 hole stroke play international championship with a cut after 36 holes.

title: English Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
The championship will have a maximum of 144 players and be played in two stages.

Stage One: The full field will play 18 holes on both of the first two days.

Stage Two: The leading 32 players will contest the match play stages. If necessary a preliminary round will be played to determine the 32 qualifiers.

title: Japan Women's Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

72 hole stroke play championship for Japanese women amateurs, with a cut after 36 holes.

title: Spanish Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
72 hole stroke play championship with a cut after 36 
holes.

title: Gaston County Amateur
notes:
54 stroke play tournament with championship, 
senior 
and super senior divisions. Proceeds from the 
tournament benefit Cancer Services of Gaston 
County, 
an organization that serves the community by 
providing 
support and services to people living with cancer.

title: Manchester City Golf Championship
notes:
Started in 1958, this is a 54 hole stroke play 
championship played on three area golf courses, 
with 
the following divisions: Open, Senior (ages 55+), 
Super 
Senior (ages 65+), and Junior (ages 18 and under). 
Open to residents of Manchester, NH and members 
of 
the three host clubs. Max handicap 12.0 (15.0 for 
super 
seniors).

title: Women's Asia-Pacific Amateur Championship
notes:
The inaugural Women's Asia-Pacific Amateur Championship was played in 2018.

It is played over 72-holes stroke play with the field to comprise 86 players. Players are eligible based on their R&A World Amateur Golf Ranking.

It is conducted by the Asia-Pacific Golf Confederation.

The winner receives an invitation to play in the Ricoh Women’s British Open and the ANA Inspiration.

title: Porter Amateur
notes:
A local Porter County tournament golf tradition since 
1955. The Porter Amateur is played over four rounds 
and aims to identify the best Lady and Gentleman 
Golfer of the year. 72 holes of stroke play held over 
four different courses. Divisions: Master (avg score 80 
or under), Open (avg score 80 or over), Senior (ages 
55-64), Super Senior (ages 65+), and Women. 
FLighted after 36 holes.

title: New Mexico Senior Open Championship
notes:
36 hole stroke play tournament with no cut, open to 
professionals and amateurs ages 50 and older.

title: Taos Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36 hole stroke play tournament with the following divisions: championship, men’s senior championship, first net, second net and women's.

title: Edmonton Men's Amateur Championship
notes:
Gross and net stroke play championship. Overall Low 
gross 
champion, Low gross senior champion, 3 flights 
including prizing for gross and net in each flight, Long 
Drive Contest, Hole in One Prize/Closest to the pin 
contest.

title: Rogue Valley Stroke Play Championship
notes:
36 hole stroke play championship with the following 
divisions: Championship Division (gross only), 
Men’s Division, 
Men’s Senior Division (55 to 64), 
Men’s Super Senior Division (65 and up), 
Ladies Division. Limited to the first 160 signups.

title: Southern Oregon Golf Championships
notes:
The Southern Oregon Golf Championships is the largest Amateur Match-Play tournament held on a single course in the United States. Each player receives at least four rounds of golf flighted by score and handicap.

Divisions:
Men's Regular - 16 years and up
Men's Junior/Senior - 40 years and up
Men's Senior - 55 years and up
Men's Super Senior - 65 years and up
Men's Legendary - 75 years and up
Women's Regular - 16 years and up
Women's Senior - 55 years and up

title: Schuylkill County Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play tournament for 
amateurs 
and 
seniors. Flighted after 1st round.
Open to current county residents, former county 
residents, former tournament champions with 
amateur status and any paid members of the 
Schuylkill Country Club or any public course in 
Schuylkill County.

title: Frederick City Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Two day, 36 hole stroke play tournament flighted by handicap. Open to all amateur golfers holding a current USGA handicap from a PGA recognized facility.

title: Toledo Open
notes:
36 hole stroke play championship open to 
professionals 
and amateurs with a maximum handicap index of 
5.0. 
Field size 132.

title: Zoar Memorial
notes:
A 36-hole county amateur championship contested 
at scratch in three flights, with prizes provided at the 
player’s choice. The Zoar Memorial is open to any low 
handicap amateur, with a Senior Division for players 
age 50+.

title: Ohio Senior Open Championship
notes:
36 hole stroke play championship for professionals 
and amateurs. Open to players aged 50 and over with a 
max handicap index of 8.0. Super Senior division for 
players aged 60 and over. Member address in Ohio.

title: Summit County Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
Senior Summit County Amateur Golf Championship, a 36-hole individual stroke play event contested at scratch for players ages 50+.

SENIOR DIVISION Ages 50-59
SUPER SENIORS Ages 60-69
SUPER-SUPER SENIORS Ages 70+
courseName: J. Edward Good Park Golf Course

title: Chippewa Championship
notes:
The 36-hole Chippewa Championship, the long-
running 
individual stroke play event with a giant skins game, 
parimutuels, team games, great food and much 
more.

title: Berkeley Invitational
notes:
54 hole stroke play tournament hosted by Berkeley 
Country Club with Championship and Men's 
Divisions. 
Has been played annually for over 50 years.

title: Asheville Amateur Tournament
notes:
18 Holes of individual stroke play per day. 36 holes 
total – Flighted by Gross Score after the first day. 
Regular and Senior flights.

title: Future Champions Golf Girls National Championship
notes:
The FCG National Championship is the West Coast's 
Premier Winter Break Junior Golf Championship hosting 
over 500 players from around the world annually. The 
girls Championship is a 36-Hole competition for Girls 
15-18, Girls 13-14 & Girls 11-12.

title: Women's Orlando International Amateur Championship
notes:
The Women's Orlando International Amateur Championship is an annual golf tournament gathering high-level amateur golfers from the United States of America and abroad. 54-hole stroke play championship, playing 18 holes per day.

Open to low-handicap amateurs, players who play college golf, players who have qualified for any of the current year's USGA or R&A championships, and those who have the recommendation of their country’s Federation or Association.
courseName: Orange County National Golf Center - Panther Lake Course

title: Orlando International Amateur for Juniors
notes:
The Orlando International Amateur for Juniors is an annual tournament gathering high-level junior golfers from around the world. The field will comprise of the best ranked golfers amongst the applications received. There will be 4 divisions: BOYS 18 & under, BOYS 15 & under, GIRLS 18 & under, GIRLS 15 & under.

Through the game of golf and the charities it will support, the Orlando International Amateur for Juniors will strive to inspire and enable juniors towards health, wellness and personal development.
courseName: Orange County National Golf Center - Crooked Cat Course

title: Girls Junior PGA Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The Girls Junior PGA Championship features a full field of 144 players comprising of, among others, PGA Section Champions and runner-ups, as well as exemptions from other top-tier national events. Current LPGA stars who have won the Championship include: Cristie Kerr (1995), Inbee Park (2001, ’02), Lexi Thompson (2007, ’09), and Ariya Jutanugarn (2011, ’12).
courseName: PGA Golf Club at PGA Village

title: Florida Winter Series - Indian Springs
notes:
The Florida Winter Series is for players 25 years and 
older. *Gross scoring only**. A Regular or 
Foundation 
Florida State Golf Association membership level is 
required. The field is broken down into three 
divisions 
by age. Mid-Amateur (25-54); Senior (55-64); and 
Super Senior (65 & over) Mid-Senior plays 
approximately 6,700 yards. Senior plays 
approximately 
6,400 yards. Super-Senior approximately 6,100 
yards.

title: Florida Winter Series - Buckhorn Springs
notes:
The Florida Winter Series is for players 25 years and 
older. *Gross scoring only**. A Regular or 
Foundation 
Florida State Golf Association membership level is 
required. The field is broken down into three 
divisions 
by age. Mid-Amateur (25-54); Senior (55-64); and 
Super Senior (65 & over) Mid-Senior plays 
approximately 6,700 yards. Senior plays 
approximately 
6,400 yards. Super-Senior approximately 6,100 
yards.

title: Kauai Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36-hole stroke play championship, with Championship, A, Net, Senior, and Senior Net flights.

title: Texas Women's Pinehurst Tournament
notes:
Eligibility: Entries are open to female amateur golfers with a certified GHIN Handicap Index.

Player Field: The starting field will consist of 50 teams (100 players). Entries will be accepted by entry date then blind draw.

Format: The championship will be 36 holes of Chapman Stroke Play (also known as Pinehurst Format). Two players play as partners, each playing from the teeing ground and each playing her partner’s ball for the second shot. After second shot, partners select ball with which they wish to score and play the ball alternately to complete the hole. The field will be preflighted by combined handicap index.

title: Texas Women's Eclectic
notes:
Eligibility: Entries are open to female amateur golfers with a certified GHIN Handicap index.

Field Limit: 112 Players. Entries accepted in order of entry except if the event is oversubscribed in the first 24 hours. In this case, the field will be filled by blind draw from the entries returned during the first 24 hours. Any player not drawn will be placed on the waiting list in blind draw order. All subsequent entries will be placed on the waiting list in order of entry.

Format: A two-day individual Eclectic. Each player takes her better hole score over the two rounds. Flights predetermined by handicap index.

title: The Cape Cod Cup
notes:
Team matches between an amateur team and the 
Cape 
Cod Section of the New England PGA. Each team 
features 14 players (2 seniors) and play a Nassau 
four-
Ball match play format - with three points up for 
grabs 
per match.

title: Trescott Championship - POSTPONED
notes:
The Trescott Championship, named after the former long time SCGA Secretary George C. Trescott, is a unique Club Championship where three amateur members from a club combine their aggregate score from each hole to compete for the Trescott Cup.

During the course of play, a Pro-Am is also conducted with the three amateurs and their Club Professional using the best two gross balls per hole. The Trescott Championship is a great opportunity for members and their Professional to spend a day together and compete against other SCGA Member clubs throughout the State.

title: Bud Kivett Memorial Championship
notes:
The Bud Kivett Memorial is a partnership between 
the golf staff of the 
City of High Point, the High Point Parks and 
Recreation Department 
and various community charitable organizations. The 
championship is 
a 36-hole stroke play event open to the first 216 
amateur golfers who 
enter, 16 years of age and older. The tournament 
will 
be flighted based on the first round score. Play will 
take place 
over the beautiful 
Oak Hollow and Blair Park Golf Courses, which have 
been rated in the 
top 75 public courses in the US.

title: Golfweek U.S. Super Senior & Legends National Championship
notes:
Started in 2017, this tournament features the world's 
elite super-senior amateurs (age 65+) and will include 
a separate legends division for those age 70+. Max 
handicap 8.0.
courseName: The Falls Club of The Palm Beaches

title: Porto Cima Four-Ball Championship
notes:
36-hole four-ball stroke play tournament with teams 
broken into four flights. Flights will be determined by 
combined team index. Seniors (ages 50+) and super 
seniors (ages 60+) play from shorter tees.

title: Kansas City Women's Match Play Championship
notes:
Stroke play qualifying to determine a match play 
bracket, with the size of the bracket determined by 
the 
size of the field. Concurrent invitational-only 
competition held for girls.

title: Kansas City Four-Ball Championship
notes:
36-hole four-ball championship that also serves as a 
qualifier for the Heart of America Four-Ball.

title: Kansas City Junior and Senior Match Play Championship
notes:
Concurrent match play competitions for junior boys 
(by 
invitation only) and seniors.

title: Florida Mixed Shootout
notes:
The Mixed Shoot-Out doesn't only "mix-up" the teams with one man and one woman, but it includes three different forms of play in its 36 holes of golf. Gift certificates will be awarded to the best gross and net scores for each format of play, as well as the overall total for the championship.

Championship Format
• Maximum of 48 teams; 96 players
• Saturday: 9 holes of scramble format and 9 holes of modified alternate shot (Chapman format)
• Sunday: 18 holes of four-ball stroke play
• All teams will compete for gross and net prizes in each flight.
• The overall champion will be the team (regardless of flight) with the lowest gross total for the competition.

Eligibility
• One entrant must be at least 16 years of age as of the first day of the Championship
• A valid Florida GHIN Handicap Index
• At least one entrant is required to be a member of the FSGA
• Teams must consist of one male and one female
courseName: Verandah Golf Club - Old Orange Course

title: Florida Women's Net Championship
notes:
Championship Format
• 36 holes of individual net stroke play (100% of handicap will be used)
• 96 total competitors - Playing in foursomes
• Two Divisions - Middle and Forward
• Each Division Champion will be the individual with the lowest 36-hole total net score (regardless of pre-flighting)

Eligibility
• Female amateur golfer
• At least 18 years of age as of the first day of the Championship
• A valid Florida GHIN Handicap Index not exceeding 34.0
• Entrants are not required to be a member of the FSGA

title: Carolinas Junior Girls' Championship
notes:
- 54-hole stroke play event
- All players compete in one division
- Open to girls from NC and SC with a valid USGA Handicap Index

title: Carolinas Net Amateur Championship
notes:
The championship is 36 holes of net stroke play using 100% Course Handicap. Net Score is calculated by subtracting Course Handicap from Gross Score. Players select the division in which to compete if eligible:

Men (age 18+); Senior Men (age 55+); Super Senior Men (age 65+); Women (age 18+); Senior Women (age 50+); Super Senior Women (age 65+).

Men age 55+ have the option to compete in the Men’s division. Women age 50+ have the option to compete in the Women’s division.

Players are assigned into flights within divisions by net score following the first round.

Must be at least 18 years of age.

title: Carolinas Super Senior Four-Ball Championship
notes:
The championship is contested at 36 holes of 
four-
ball stroke play. Gross
scores only. Teams select the division in which to 
compete if eligible:
Championship Division (Men Age 65+); 
Approximate 
yardage = 6000
yards.
70+ Division (Both team members age 70+); 
Approximate yardage = 5500
yards.

title: Washington Parent-Child Championship
notes:
Format: 18-hole Chapman Stroke Play (Gross and Net).

Eligibility: Open to parent-child teams. Relationship with child must be natural, adopted or stepchild. Partners may have more than one generation between them (i.e. grandfather/granddaughter).

title: Norwich Invitational
notes:
Started in the 1920s, this is the longest running 
tournament in the state of Connecticut. 18 hole 
qualifying round to determine match play 
brackets for all flights. Two matches on Saturday and 
two matches on Sunday, with a "Beaten 8's" medal 
play 
competition for those losing their matches on Saturday.

title: Connecticut Senior Open Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship open to 
professionals 
and amateurs. In addition to the overall 
championship, 
there are age divisions as follows: 50-59, 60-69, 
70+. 
Conducted by the Connecticut Section of the PGA.

title: Connecticut Women's Open Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The Connecticut Women's Open Championship is open to any amateur or professional female golfer and is the CSGA's only championship that is open to non- residents of Connecticut. 36 holes stroke play. Amateurs must have a USGA Handicap Index not exceeding 15.0.

title: Gosling's Invitational
notes:
54 hole stroke play championship for professionals 
and 
amateurs. Exemptions are 
given to amateurs including for the U.S. Mid-Amateur 
champion.

title: South Carolina Lefthanders and Lefty-Righty Championship
notes:
Two events in one, the Lefty-Righty Championship and the Lefthanders Championship is a weekend full of fun and comradery. With a team made up of one left handed golfer and one right handed golfer, the Lefty Righty is played in a Four Ball format. The Left Handers' Championship, which is played concurrently, is an individual gross Championship.

Both events are flighted after the first 18 holes with awards in each flight.

title: Utah Women's Senior Stroke Play Championship
notes:
Eligibility: All female members of the UGA age 50+ who have a Handicap with the UGA as of the registration deadline

Format: 36 hole individual stroke play. Gross and Net winners will be awarded.

title: Arizona Women's Open
notes:
54 hole stroke play championship for professionals and 
amateurs with no cut.

title: Louisiana Net Amateur Championship
notes:
Play will consist of 36 holes net stroke play. Field will be divided into flights based on USGA Handicap Indexes. Number of flights determined by size of field. The Overall Champion may come from any flight and will be the competitor that returns the low 36 hole net score. Scores will be calculated by subtracting COURSE HANDICAP from GROSS SCORE.

Participants may also elect to play in the concurrent Net Club Team Championship. Teams shall consist of four members of the same LGA Member Club or Association. Club's Team score shall be calculated by counting the best three of four scores for each day's play. Winning Club will be determined by low total after 36 holes and will receive Club Team Championship trophy (Club may be represented by only three members but three scores must be counted per day). Scores will be calculated by subtracting COURSE HANDICAP from GROSS SCORE.

title: Tupelo Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36 Hole Stroke Play championship. Players will be put into flights after the first round based on score. Flights will be determined by participation for all divisions (Championship, Senior and Super Senior Divisions).

title: Mississippi Women's Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
Tournament is scheduled for 36 holes of stroke play. 
Field size is limited to the first 96 players. The 
Championship is open to female amateurs who have 
reached their 50th birthday and are residents of the 
state of Mississippi.

title: Carolinas Women's Club Team Championship
notes:
Each club will enter two, two-woman sides each day. Each side of two will play an 18-hole qualifying round in a four-ball stroke play format on the first day of competition. The four clubs with the four lowest aggregate scores will be placed in the Championship Flight. All other clubs will be flighted into flights of four club teams by team Handicap Index and seeded by aggregate qualifying score. Club team winners for each flight will be determined by two days of fourball match play (one point per hole). Teams losing their first round match will be placed in a consolation match.

Players must be at least 13 years old, legal residents of North Carolina or South Carolina, and members in good standing of a club which is a member of the Carolinas Golf Association

title: Tennessee Girls Junior Amateur Championship
notes:
Applications are open to female junior amateurs who (1) have a parent/legal guardian who is a resident of the state of Tennessee or (2) possess an active USGA/GHIN Handicap Index from a TGA member club of course. Amateurs must meet the definition of an amateur golfer, and the junior must reach her 10th birthday and have not reached her 19th birthday. An eligible junior is an 18-year-old or under who has not yet started college.

There are two divisions, each at stroke play--Girls 15-18 and Girls 10-14.

title: Virginia Mixed Four-Ball Tournament
notes:
18-hole four-ball stroke play competition with gross 
and net prizes. Each side must have one male and 
one 
female player. Open to male and female golfers of 
all 
ages. Participants must hold an active GHIN number 
issued by a licensed VSGA Member Club in good 
standing.

title: Virginia Junior Four-Ball Championship
notes:
Open to VSGA juniors ages 19 and under, except 
any 
junior who has graduated from high school may only 
participate until August 31st of their graduation 
year. 
Format consists of 36 holes of four-ball stroke play.

title: Virginia-Maryland Junior Girls Team Matches
notes:
This event is compromised of eight players from 
Virginia and eight players from Maryland.  The sides 
compete in a two-day competition in four-ball 
(Saturday) and singles (Sunday) match play. All 
matches will be worth 1 point each. If the match is 
all 
square after the 18th hole, each side will earn a ½ 
point.

title: California Seniors Golf Association Four-Ball Championship
notes:
36-hole four-ball stroke play competition for seniors 
who are 
members of the California Seniors' Golf Association. 
The maximum field of 120 players will be divided into
four equal flights according to the combined 
handicaps
of each team. There will be four flights: 
Championship,
Presidents, Cypress and Mission flight. All flights will 
use
Gross/Net Stroke Play Scoring.

title: Minnesota Mixed Amateur Team Championship
notes:
Round one is a four-ball stroke play format; round two 
is a modified Chapman alternate shot format. In 
addition to the overall championship, there is a senior 
division, as well as gross and net Husband/Wife and 
Mixed divisions.

title: Minnesota Net Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole net stroke play event for Minnesota amateur 
golfers with Men's and Women's divisions.
courseName: The Pines At Grand View Lodge

title: Joe August Four-Ball Match Play Championship
notes:
Starting in 1948, for over 40 years this tournament was 
played at the Marshalltown G.&C.C. In 1993, it was
reborn at its current site, the Ames G&CC. The field will 
be capped at 80 combined Open and Senior (50+) 
division teams, with flights of 16 in the Open division 
and flights of 8 in the Senior division. Two-man four-
ball match play format. Qualifying takes place the week 
prior.

title: North Dakota Two-Man Scramble Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36-hole two-man scramble format, with gross and net prizes. One-day scramble for mid-amateurs and senior held the day prior to the tournament.

title: Texas Shamble
notes:
2 Person Shamble (Flighted).  Mixed, Male and Female 
Flights.  Net and Gross prizes.  80% of each players 
handicap will be used.

title: Iowa Women's Club Team Championship
notes:
Open to Member Clubs of the Iowa Golf
Association. Each club fields a team of 4 amateur 
golfers, with
one golfer designated as a Team Captain. A club 
participates
in both the net and gross divisions. Each golfer plays 
her own
golf ball throughout the competition. A club records 
the best 3 of
4 18-hole total scores for the gross competition. A 
club records
the best 3 of 4 NET 18-hole total scores for the NET 
competition.

title: Iowa Wife-Husband Championship
notes:
Participants must legally be husband and wife,
and maintain a residence in the state of Iowa. 36-
hole 
modified alternate shot tournament with 
Championship 
and Super Senior (130 combined years) divisions.

title: Florida Super Senior Amateur Match Play Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The Super Senior Championship is for those individuals over the age of 65. One round of stroke play qualifying followed by single elimination match play round to determine the winner.

title: Florida Summer Mixed Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Championship Format
• 36 holes of four-ball stroke play
• 96 players; 48 teams maximum
• Both gross and net competitions are played concurrently in each division
• Prizes and gift certificates are awarded in both divisions with gross scores receiving priority

Eligibility
• One entrant must be at least 16 years of age as of the first day of the Championship
• A valid Florida GHIN Handicap Index not exceeding 34.0
• At least one entrant is required to be a member of the FSGA
• Teams must consist of one male and one female

title: Florida Men's Net Championship
notes:
Championship Format
• 36 Holes of Net Individual Stroke Play
• Maximum 96 player field size
• All players will play to 100% of their lowest index (LI) for the previous 12 months
• Players must play in their respective age division

Eligibility
• Must be a male amateur member of the FSGA
• Must have a valid Florida GHIN handicap of under 24.0.
• Must be 18 years of age or older by the first day of the Championship.
• Must have played in at least 3 One-Day events in the current calendar year as of the close of entries.
• Entries will be processed after your 3rd event is complete and a score is registered, first come first serve.
courseName: Mission Inn Resort - El Campeon Course

title: Women's Southeastern Challenge Matches - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled for 2020.

The Southeastern Challenge Matches are a biennial Ryder Cup style match play competition pitting twelve player amateur teams, consisting of four Seniors and eight other players (of which no more than two are juniors), from Alabama, Florida and Georgia. The Matches consist of four-ball, foursome and individual matches over two days, with one point awarded to the winning team for each match. One-half point is awarded to each side for halved matches. The host site rotates among the three states.

title: Friendship Cup
notes:
Started in 2019, and hosted by the Niagara Parks Commission which was established in 1885 to preserve and protect the vast Niagara River corridor. 54-hole scratch event for senior amateurs will have three age divisions: Senior 55-64, Super- Senior 65-69, and Legends 70 years plus. Following 3 days of competition, an individual champion and awards will be presented in each division.

In addition to individual stroke play, competitors from the United States and Canada will each have the opportunity to represent their country and contribute to the Friendship Cup team competition. At the conclusion of play each day, based on the size of the field, the top 6 scores in each division will represent the score for the U.S. and Canadian teams.

title: Carolinas Mixed Team Championship
notes:
The Carolinas Mixed Team Championship began in 2006. The championship is contested over 36 holes using a mixed format of four-ball stroke play and modified alternate shot. This competition includes gross scores only. Teams may choose to compete in any division in which they are eligible: Championship Division, Tournament Division (shorter course), Senior Division (ages 55+ for males, ages 50+ for females) and Super Senior Division (ages 65+ for males and females). The Tournament, Senior and Super Senior Divisions are pre- flighted by total team Handicap Index using the following formula: 2/3 of lower Handicap Index to 1/3 of higher Handicap Index.

The first round is a four-ball stroke play format in which each team member plays their own ball and the best score of the two balls counts. The second round is a modified alternate shot stroke play format in which both team members hit from their respective teeing ground and then select the ball to be played. Team members then alternate strokes until the ball is holed. Entry is open to any team comprised of a male amateur golfer and a female amateur golfer who have reached their 13th birthday, are legal residents of North Carolina or South Carolina, are a members in good standing of a club which is a member of the Carolinas Golf Association and have active GHIN® USGA Handicap Indexes®.

title: Connecticut Mixed Team Championship
notes:
This Championship celebrated its 80th playing in 
2017 
and is contested over 18-holes in a Chapman format. 
In the Chapman format, both players on a team tee 
off, 
they then play each others tee shot for the second 
shot, select one of the second shots and from that 
point that ball is played alternately until holed. Male 
partner's handicap cannot exceed 20.0 and female 
partner's handicap cannot exceed 30.0.

On the first day the matches are a team (foursomes) format and on the second day the players compete in singles matches.

title: Sacramento City Putting Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

During the Haggin Oaks Golf Expo, the Sacramento Golf Council will conduct the Sacramento City Putting Championships. On Friday and Saturday, qualifying rounds will be played. The top 16 (including last year’s Champion) will return on Sunday for Match Play to determine the Champions.

There will be three divisions – Men’s, Women’s, and Junior’s. Players can play as many qualifying rounds as they want for a $5 donation to junior golf for each qualifying round. Each round is 18 holes on the putting green. Prizes include a custom putter to the winners in each division, and Haggin Oaks gift cards to the top three (3) players in each division after the Sunday match play rounds. All net proceeds will go to support junior golf in Sacramento.

The championships are open to all amateur golfers of all ages so come out and join the fun!!

title: Michigan Publinx Match Play Championship
notes:
The State Match Play Championship is one of the oldest continuous amateur championships conducted in the state. A 18-hole qualifier places contestants into flights of 64, 32 or 16 based on score.

The Championship Division will be limited to 96 players and the Senior Division is 48 and Super Senior Division to 16 players. The championship is open to all male Public or Private Course golfers 18 years old or older by start of tournament to compete in the Championship Division, 50 years old or older by the start of the event to compete in the Senior Division, and 65 years old or older to complete in the Super Senior Division.

title: Kentucky Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
The tournament will have three divisions, Championship, Mid-Amateur and Senior. All divisions will be match play. The tournament is open to qualified legal resident women members of clubs belonging to the Women’s Kentucky State Golf Association.

The Championship Division is open to any participant regardless of age. The Championship Division will have a Title Flight of 32 players and additional flights of 8 players. The Title Flight will consist of the defending champion and the 31 lowest handicapped entrants, or the 32 lowest handicapped entrants if the defending champion is not entered. The Title Division will play first and second round matches on Monday, quarterfinal and semifinal matches on Tuesday and the finals on Wednesday. The other flights have one match per day.

The Mid-Amateur Division will be open to any participant 25 years of age or older. The participants will be placed in flights of 8 based on handicaps. If the defending champion is entered, she will receive the number one seed in the first flight.

The Senior Division will be open to any participant 55 years of age or older. The participants will be paired in flights of 8 based on handicaps. If the defending champion is entered, she will receive the number one seed in the first flight.

title: Northern California Senior Four-Ball Net Championship
notes:
First played in 1999, the NCGA Senior Four-Ball Net Championship is a two-person, better-ball handicap event for all senior NCGA members.

Format: Four-Ball Stroke Play (Two-Person Better Ball). Sectional Qualifying – 18 holes. Championship – 36 holes, 18 holes per day. All play will be 90% (men) and 95% (women) of the course handicap using a maximum handicap index of 18.4 for calculation. All players with handicap indexes of 18.5 and above are eligible but must play to a maximum handicap index of 18.4. If partners’ course handicaps differ by more than 8 strokes, an additional 10 percent reduction will be applied to their course handicaps.

title: Mountain Man Senior Team Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Three-round senior two-man tournament started in 2018. There are divisions for Seniors (ages 55-64), Super Seniors (ages 65-69) and Legends (ages 70+). Format is four-ball the first two rounds, then for the third round both players tee off and select the best drive, then each player plays his own ball from that point to the hole for two scores.

title: The Wichita Shootout
notes:
36-hole two-man shamble tournament. Both players 
tee off each 
hole. For the second stroke on each hole, one of the 
two balls is 
selected. The ball selected is played out as it lies by 
the player to 
whom the ball belongs. The other player drops or 
places within one 
club-length (if through the green or in a hazard, the 
ball is dropped) 
or on the exact spot (if on the putting green), not 
nearer the hole, of 
the position of the ball selected (for the second 
stroke) and plays out 
the hole with that ball. The player whose ball is 
selected IS NOT 
REQUIRED to hit first, but his ball MUST NOT be 
moved or marked 
(unless on the putting green), if he does not hit first. 
The position of 
the ball may not be improved from the rough to 
fairway, from fringe 
to putting green or to outside of a hazard (including 
bunkers). The 
team’s score for the hole is the lowest number of 
strokes taken 
between the two balls in play (as in Four-Ball). If one 
player fails to 
complete a hole, there is no penalty.

title: Triad Golf Today Tournament of Champions

Concurrent interclub challenge competition: Each club champion is invited to bring a team consisting of himself and three other amateur club members or association members. The team can be composed of any combination of regulars and seniors. Format is total of the best two front-nine scores and the best two back-nine scores each day.

title: Show Me State Games Golf Tournament - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak

Part of the Show-Me State Games, a multi-sport non-profit program of the Governor's Council on Physical Fitness and Health hosted by the University of Missouri. The mission of the Show-Me State Games is to provide all Missourians the opportunity to participate in activities of health, fitness, family and fun. 32,000 athletes come to Columbia throughout the year to be a part of the events - this includes athletes from 113 out of 114 counties in the state.

Day one is a parent/child competition, day two an individual stroke play with gross and net competitions.

Male and female stroke play divisions as follows: 12 & under (9 holes), 13-15, 16-18, 19-29, 30-39, 40- 49, 50-59, 60-69 (9 holes), 70 & over (9 holes).

Parent/child divisions (father/son, father/daughter, mother/son, mother/daughter) will be based on the age of the child (12 & under, 13-15, 16-18, 19 & over). In parent/child competition, both players tee off on each hole. They select the best tee shot and alternate shots until the ball is holed.

title: Golfweek Amateur Tour National Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play season-ending championship of the Golfweek Amateur Tour.

The top players in all of the Local Tours around the country, based on the points earned during the season, are awarded the opportunity to compete in the National Tour Championship. Players finishing the season in the top ten points standings (and ties) in the Champ & D Flights and the top 15 points standings in the A, B & C Flights of their Local Tour qualify for the National Tour Championship. To be eligible for the Tour National Championship, players must have competed and returned valid scores for at least least 4 tournament rounds.

The Tour Championship is held in Hilton Head, SC, and draws over 800 players from around the country.

title: Golfweek Senior Amateur Tour National Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play season-ending championship of the Golfweek Senior Amateur Tour.

The top fifteen players in each Local Tour around the country, based on the points earned during the season, are awarded the opportunity to compete in the National Tour Championship. To be eligible for the Tour National Championship, players must have competed and returned valid scores for at least 50% of their Local Tour events (can include make up tournaments).

The Tour Championship is held in Hilton Head, SC, and draws over 300 players from around the country.

title: Florida Southwest Amateur Series (March) - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Flights:
Championship flight - players with handicaps of +3.0 to 3.8
Senior Championship flight - Ages 50 and over with Indexes of +3.0 to 3.8
First flight - players with handicaps of 3.9 to 8.9
Second Flight - players with handicaps of 9.0 to 14.0

Each flight must have a minimum of six players or the flights may be combined. Gross Flights excluded.

Format:
Individual Stableford play within flights
The Championship flight will play gross stroke play, the other two flights will play a net The First flight and the Second flight may be combined and play will be handicapped (a net game) for those players.

Membership & Eligibility:
Male, amateur golfers with an active FSGA/GHIN handicap (14.0 or less)

notes:

Past participants in the Cobb have gone on to win over 80 PGA Tour events and 30 Champions Tour events (including 13 majors).

A course handicap of 7 or less required for new players as well as submission of a "Playing Resume". Special awards for low professional, low amateur, and low junior.

and Senior Divisions. The Open Division is 
subdivided 
for players ages 39 and under, and players ages 40 
and 
older. The overall champion can come from either 
subdivision.

title: Chattanooga TPC and Senior TPC Golf Tournament - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled for 2020.

Match play tournament for amateurs and seniors. 18 holes of stroke play qualifying will be held, with the qualifiers joining exempt players in the match play brackets.

title: Baltimore Two-Man Team Championship - POSTPONED
notes:
**Postponed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36 Hole Championship, Better Ball of Two, competed at scratch within two flights (Championship Flight and Senior Flight). To compete in the Senior Flight, both members of the team must have reached their 55th birthday by the start of the tournament.

title: Baltimore Match Play Championship - POSTPONED
notes:
**Postponed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Match play event held over two successive weekends. 18-hole qualifier on the first weekend, from which the low 31 players advance to match play along with the defending champion.

title: Southern Maryland Amateur
notes:
54 hole stroke play event. The format will feature the following divisions – Overall Championship Division, Senior Division (must have reached 55th birthday), Super Senior Division (must have reached 65th birthday) and (and a Junior Division (under 18). The Regular Division will compete from the Blue Tees, the Senior Division will compete from the White Tees and the Super Senior Division will compete from the Gold Tees. The Senior and Super Senior Divisions will not be permitted to compete for the overall Championship Title.

The Overall Championship Division, Senior Division and Junior Division will be flighted based upon their handicap index and will be played as gross score flights. The Super Senior Division will be a GROSS and NET Scoring Division. Handicaps must be verified by their club pro.

title: Heron Ridge Invitational
notes:
36-hole two-man team tournament, pre-flighted 
by handicap. Saturday will be Captain's Choice and 
Sunday will be Better Ball. All players must have USGA 
GHIN# with a 
maximum of 8 stroke handicap differential.

title: ODU Spivey Rentals Golf Classic
notes:
54-hole two-person tournament with a different 
format 
each round: Scramble, Chapman, and Best-Ball. 
Tournament will be pre-flighted based on handicap. 
Championship, Senior and Ladies divisions. Proceeds 
benefit the ODU men's and women's golf programs.

title: Oceana Two-Man Best-Ball Tournament
notes:
36-hole two-man best-ball tournament. Before the 
tournament begins, teams will be placed in flights 
(championship, 1, 2, 3 & senior flight age 60 and older) 
based on the sum of each partner’s handicap. 
Handicaps not to exceed a 10-shot differential between 
highest and lowest players. The field will be limited to 
the first 110 teams entered. Carts are mandatory and 
are included.
courseName: Aero Pines Golf Club - Hornet Course

courseName: Aero Pines Golf Club - Hornet Course

title: Heron Ridge Fall Classic
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament, pre-flighted 
by handicap. Gross and Net prizes awarded in each

notes:

handicap 18.

title: Ulster County Amateur Championship (The Herdegen) - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

54-hole individual stroke play championship held on three different courses. Prequalier held before the tournament for non-exempt players.

title: Woodstock Open
notes:
First played in 1932, this is an 18-hole stroke play 
tournament for professionals and amateurs whose past 
competitors include Gene Sarazen, Bob Toaski and 
Fran 
Hannigan. Open and senior divisions.

title: Dallas Amateur Championship
notes:
Started in 2018, the Dallas Amateur Championship

players. Players compete in one of five divisions: 
Men’s Gross; Men’s Net; Men’s Senior (ages 50+) 
Gross Only; Women’s Gross; and Women’s Net. 
Open to 
amateur golfers ages 22 years of age and older. 
Amateurs can NOT currently compete on a 
college or junior college team.

title: Pasadena Women's City Championship
notes:
The Pasadena Women's City Championship has been revived after years of dormancy. There was a Pasadena City Women's tournament in the past that had a grand history with players like Babe Zaharias winning multiple times but then it died for many decades. Organizers hope it will re-establish itself as a premier women's championship in Southern California.

36-hole championship flight, gross scoring only, with 1 round on each Brookside course. Entry fee includes golf, scrip prize fund, food and apparel tee prize. Minimum age 15. No handicap requirement but suggested for seasoned players only.

title: Dinsdale Amateur Golf Classic
notes:

championship flight. There is also a Senior flight (with 
gross and net competitions) for golers aged 60 and 
over. The field is limited to 216 players.

title: Cherokee County Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play tournament open to 
amateur residents of Cherokee County (South 
Carolina), or members of Cherokee National, Gaffney 
Country Club or Chesnee Country Club. Divisions: 39 
and under championship, 39 and under, 40-54, 55-69, 
70 and over. Field will be flighted based on first-round 
scores.

54-hole stroke play tournament for men and women college-aged golfers, with a junior division that plays from the same tees and yardages as the collegiate players.

36-hole stroke play tournament flighted by first

36-hole stroke play tournament flighted by first round

36-hole four-ball stroke play tournament flighted by first round score. Championship and Senior (ages 50 and over) flights.

The field will be cut to the low 70 players and ties

Gross and Net divisions.

title: Senior British Open Qualifying - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

18-hole stroke play qualifier held at four sites on the Monday before the Senior British Open Championship. The Senior British Open has been part of the European Seniors Tour since 1987 and from 2003 is included in the Champions Tour as one of the five major world events in senior golf. The event is jointly administered by the European Seniors Tour and The R&A.

the Year points event.

36-hole individual stroke play championship with gross and net competitions. Maximum USGA handicap of 14.0.

title: Bert Nash Memorial ​Tournament
notes:
36-hole two-man best-ball tournament. By invitation

36-hole stroke play tournament played over two 
courses, with individual and team competitions. Teams

title: British Girls Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The first stage of the Championship includes two rounds of stroke play qualifying. The 64 lowest scores over the 36 holes will compete in the match play stage of the Championship.

Each match will consist of one round of 18 holes, including the Final. The Challenge Cup is awarded to the winner, while The Leven Trophy is awarded to the runner-up.

The following awards are presented to players returning the lowest scores over the two stroke play qualifying rounds:

The Lady Heathcoat–Amory Memorial Medal for players over 16 years of age, The Todd Bowl for players under 16 years of age and The Fairhaven Pheasant for players under 14 years of age.

A Team Trophy is awarded to the team (nation) with the lowest aggregate score over the two stroke play qualifying rounds

title: Calhoun County Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play, flighted after the first 
round. Open, Senior and Super Senior divisions.

notes:
This 36-hole individual 
stroke play tournament has a championship flight 
and

players in each flight. Men and ladies flights, plus a 
Gold Tee slight for players aged 65 and over. Open 
to 
all Otsego County residnets and/or members of golf 
clubs in Otsego County.

title: Vancouver Open
notes:
A full field of 224 golfers, including 144 amateurs and 80 Golf Professionals, will compete in this 54-hole stroke play event.

The event is open to all Amateurs with current Golf Canada or USGA Handicap Factor of 18.0 or less and VGT, PGA of Canada, Mackenzie Tour Canada Professionals and "Mini-Tour" Professionals who will compete in the following divisions:

- Four Amateur Flights (including a Senior Open flight)
- Women's Open Division (Professionals & Amateurs with 8.0 hdcp or less)
- Male Professional Division

title: Austrian International Amateur Championship
notes:
72-hole individual stroke play championship that draws 
an international field, mostly from Continental Europe.

title: Mississippi Mixed Team Championship
notes:
The State Mixed Team Championship is scheduled for 36 holes of 2-person scramble. The format of this event is a 2 -person scramble, teams must have 1 male and 1 female player. Teams will be flighted after 18 holes of play.

This championship is open to teams comprised of 1 male and 1 female player. Amateurs must be bona fide residents of Mississippi for at least 60 days prior to the first round of the championship. Competitors are required to have an active GHIN Handicap through a USGA Licensed Mississippi Club. All must conform with the USGA Rules of Amateur Status.

title: Queensland Amateur Championship
notes:
This match play tournament is preceded by the 72-hole 
Queensland Stroke Play Championship, from which the 
low 16 players advance to the match play stage.

title: South Carolina Women's Match Play Championship
notes:
Match play tournament with brackets of a maximum 
of 8 players. Last year's 
Champion will have the first seed in the 
Championship flight. Any player with an 
index of 5.0 or below must play in the Championship 
flight regardless of age. Any 
player regardless of index may sign up to play in the 
Championship flight. There 
is also a State Division for those who wish to sign up 
for shorter tees. State 
Division players will be flighted by handicap index 
and all flights will consist of a 
maximum of 8 players. All players that get 
eliminated from match play 
championship will be able to play in a Par-3 Criers 
Tournament.

title: Palm Springs Golf Championships
notes:
The Palm Springs Golf Championships is the newest national amateur golf tournament on the West Coast, played in the heart of the prime Palm Springs golf season.

The tournament field will consist of a Gross Division and four Net Divisions: Young Gunz (men under age 50), Young Galz (women under age 50), Senior Men (50 and over), and Senior Women (50 and over). Divisions are based on the entrant’s age as of the first day of the tournament.

The Gross Division will play the Nicklaus and and Stadium courses at PGA West. Net Divisions will play the Dunes and Mountain courses at La Quinta Resort & Club, and another course to be determined.

There is only one flight in the Gross Division and they will play the Blue or Championship Tees. The Women’s Division flights will play from the red tees. The Young Gunz flights will play from either the Black or White Tees. The Senior Men’s flights will play from either the White or Gold Tees. A player’s flight assignment in the Young Gunz and Senior Men divisions will be a function of the tees a player elects to play and then by the player’s course handicap. The Competition Committee is flighting these divisions by tees selected, not by age.

title: Battle In The Desert
notes:
The Battle in the Desert is an annual, week-long, two-person, best ball tournament hosted at La Quinta Resort & Club and PGA WEST. All participants play six tournament rounds and unlimited afternoon replay six on the finest courses in Palm Springs. Each day there are also skills competitions and afternoon horse races.

Day 1: Four player mixer. High & Low Handicap Teams paired together for 1 best ball score and two net scores.

Days 2-5: Two-Man Best-Ball

Day 6: Two-Man Aggregate Score
courseName: Desert Willow Golf Resort - Firecliff Course

title: Shootout at PGA WEST
notes:
The Shootout at PGA WEST is an annual, three- day, two-person, best ball tournament held at La Quinta Resort & Club and PGA WEST.

Based on 55 teams, there will be five divisions. The first division plays from the championship tees and is a gross competition. The other four divisions play net competition.

There will be a couples division if there are enough teams. If there are not enough teams for a couples division, the ladies handicap is adjusted to a point where the two become a competitive team in one of the men’s divisions.

There will be unlimited replay of the tournament courses after each round.

title: Maridoe Collegiate Invitational
notes:
54-hole men's college tournament hosted by the 
University of North Texas. Team (best four scores out of 
five players) and individual competitions.

title: New Jersey Women's Four-Ball Championship
notes:
18-hole four-ball stroke play (Better Ball of Partners) 
championship that is open to female amateur 
golfers. Handicap Allocation: Each Team member 
receives 95% of her Course Handicap for Net 
scoring. Entrant must have an ACTIVE and 
VALID USGA Handicap Index
of 30.0 or less through a NJSGA Member Club, which 
is in good standing with the NJSGA, and must 
appear 
on that
club’s Official Handicap Roster.

title: Florida Women's Senior Match Play Championship
notes:
Championship Format
- Individual match play with consolation flights for all divisions
- Championship division will play gross match play
- Middle and Forward divisions will play net match play
- The Championship Division will be seeded by an 18 hole stroke play seeding round
0 - Middle and Forward Divisions will be pre-flighted and seeded by Handicap Index
- Maximum of 64 players
Eligibility
- Female amateur golfer
- At least 50 years of age as of the first day of the Championship
- A valid Florida GHIN Handicap Index not exceeding 34.0
- Entrant is required to be a member of the FSGA

title: Southern California Women's Four-Ball Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Formerly the WSCGA Desert Event, this is the SCGA's premier Championship for women looking to compete with a partner. Two-person teams will compete over 36 holes and two days at two of the desert's premier golf facilities. Open to female SCGA members of all skill levels.
courseName: Indian Wells Country Club - Classic Course

title: Carolinas Club Championship
notes:
The Carolinas Club Championship is conducted at 18 
holes of four-ball stroke play. Entry is open to any 
male or female amateur golfer, as well as Club 
Professional, who is a legal resident of North Carolina 
or South Carolina. Teams may be comprised of a) A 
male or female golf professional who is a member of 
the club’s golf professional staff employed by a 
Carolinas Golf Association (CGA) Member Club and a 
male or female amateur golfer who is a member in 
good standing of the same CGA Member Club. b) 
Two amateur golfers, male or female, who are 
members in good standing of the same CGA Member 
Club. Only two team entries are allowed per member 
club.

title: Coastal Alabama Couples Classic
notes:
54-hole two-person scramble (no handicap) 
tournament played over three courses on the Alabama 
coast. It is an all-inclusive tournament whose entry fee 
includes 3 days of golf, breakfast and lunch daily, a 
welcome reception, a sunset cruise, two drink tickets 
per day and prizes. The tournament will be limited to 
50 teams. Entries are on a first come basis until the 
event is full.

notes:

and NNGA Members. 36 holes of stroke play determine

54-hole flighted two-man best ball tournament open to

18-hole alternate shot, stroke play (except that both players will tee off and select one ball to play out the hole.) Fathers 65 & older and Juniors under 14 can play from a shorter set of tees. Teams competing for the Championship must have both players play from the Tournament Tees. Flights will be based on the team’s combined handicap index.

Open to 2018 male members of the SCGA who are residents of South Carolina. There are no restrictions on age other than the son must be at least 8 years old. Only one team per family.

title: Zanesville District Amateur Championship

Coshocton, Licking, Perry, Guernsey, Morgan, or Noble 
Counties. Must have a handicap index of 10.0 or lower.

title: Zanesville District Senior Amateur Championship

by age. Open to amateur 
golfers who reside 
or 
have graduated from a high school in Muskingum, 
Coshocton, Licking, Perry, Guernsey, Morgan, or 
Noble 
Counties.

36 hole individual stroke play event for women seniors,

title: Northern California Women's Two-Person Scramble II
notes:
36-hole two-person scramble event with A, B, and C 
flights. Entrant must be a member of WGANC and a 
member of the 18-hole women’s group at her club.
USGA handicap index: 34.4 maximum.

title: Alabama State Parent-Child Championship
notes:
Championship is conducted at 18 holes of modified alternate shot stroke play. Each side plays alternate shot except that both team members hit from their designated tee and then select the ball to be played.

Teams select the division in which to compete if eligible:

Amateur Division: Team comprised of two amateurs. Champion is the team posting the lowest 18-hole gross score. Flights are determined based on number of entries using 50% team Handicap Index. Yardage is dependent on gender and age.

Open Division: Team comprised of one golf professional and one amateur (or an amateur awaiting reinstatement “A/R”). Yardage is dependent on gender, age, and amateur/professional status.

Entries are open to any side comprised of a parent and child, regardless of age, in any gender combination. Step-parents, grandparents, and in-laws are eligible. At least one member of each side must be a legal resident of Alabama and a member in good standing of a club which is a member of the Alabama Golf Association (AGA) and have an active GHIN USGA Handicap Index ® at an AGA member club or is a golf professional employed at an AGA member club. A side is eligible if one partner is an amateur member of an AGA member club or if one partner is a golf professional employed by an AGA member club. Pro-Pro sides are not eligible.

title: Alabama State Mixed Team Championship
notes:
One of Alabama's newest state championships, 
having started in 2019. Each player must 
be a legal resident of Alabama and a member in
good standing of a club which is a member of the 
Alabama Golf 
Association (AGA) and have an active GHIN USGA 
Handicap Index ® at
an AGA member club or is a golf professional 
employed at an AGA 
member club. A side is eligible if one partner is an 
amateur member
of an AGA member club or if one partner is a golf 
professional employed 
by an AGA member club. Pro-Pro sides are not 
eligible.

title: New York Mixed Team Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

18 holes, modified chapman stroke play, gross and net. Two players play as partners, each partner plays from the teeing ground and plays the partner's ball for the second shot. After the second shot, partners select the ball with which they wish to score and play that ball alternately to complete the hole. Open to teams of one male and one female amateur golfer who are members of the NYSGA either by (1) belonging to an NYSGA member club or (2) by joining the NYSGA directly as an eClub member. Entrants must have an active USGA Handicap Index.

**Cancelled for 2020.

The Southern California Women's Cup Matches are an annual team event between the top players from the SCGA and SCPGA. The inaugural match was played in 2011. These matches see the top eight women amateurs from the Women's Southern California Golf Council and the Southern California PGA's top eight women from the Women's Player of the Year standings play over the two days. The 36- hole match includes 18-hole team and singles matches to determine the winners.

more than 8 strokes difference between

who

title: Maryland Junior Girls Championship
notes:
This tournament is open to female amateur golfers who 
are members of MSGA Member Clubs or residents of 
Maryland. Players must have reached 9 years of age by 
the first day of competition, but have either (1) not 
reached their 18th birthday or (2) have reached their 
18th birthday but have not reached their 19th birthday 
and have not yet attended college.

title: Maryland Women's Open Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament open to female 
amateur golfers who are members of member clubs of 
the MSGA (Maryland State Golf Association) or the 
VSGA (Virginia State Golf Association) with a USGA 
INDEX of 14.0 or less and to female professional 
golfers. Amateur golfers must have a handicap index 
with the MSGA or VSGA.

title: Maryland Senior Women's Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament open to female 
amateur golfers who are members of member clubs of 
the MSGA with an up-to-date USGA INDEX of 36.0 or 
less and who have reached their 50th birthday by 
midnight of the first day of play.

title: Jefferson City CC Four-Ball Championship
notes:
36-hole four-ball stroke play tournament with 
Championship and Senior (both players age 50+) 
divisions. Entries are open to male amateur golfers who 
are current members of the MGA and play at clubs who 
are members of the Missouri Golf Association.

title: Missouri Par 3 Team Championship
notes:
This is a two man team, best ball using the Modified 
Stableford scoring format. Championship and Senior 
(both players age 50 and over) divisions. Entries are 
open to male amateur 
golfers who play at clubs or courses who are members 
of the Missouri Golf Association.
courseName: Top of the Rock Golf Course

title: Iowa Forever 39 Match Play Championship
notes:
Open to female amateur golfers ages 50 and older 
who 
maintain a
residence in the state of Iowa. Must be a member of 
the IGA. Nine-hole qualifying round determines 
championship and flighted match play brackets, with 
nine-hole matches.

title: Northern California Four-Ball Net - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

First played in 1968, the NCGA Four-Ball Net Championship is a two-person better ball event for regular clubs.

FORMAT: Four-Ball (Two-Person Better Ball). QUALIFYING: 18 holes. CHAMPIONSHIP: 36 holes, 18 holes per day. Play will be 90% (men) and 95% (women) of the course handicap using a maximum handicap index of 18.4 for calculation. All players with handicap indexes of 18.5 and above are eligible but must play to a maximum handicap index of 18.4.

title: Northern California Net Amateur Championship
notes:
First played in 1994, the NCGA Net Amateur Championship is an individual handicap event for NCGA members of regular clubs. It is contested in three flights divided by handicap index. The championship rotates every year between Poppy Hills GC and Poppy Ridge GC.

Players must have a numeric handicap index listed on their club's Master Report, not exceeding 36.4 (men) or 40.4 (women) on the date of registration. No players under 18 years of age.

FORMAT: Qualifying – 18 holes. Championship proper – 36 holes, 18 holes per day. Players will use 100% of their course handicap at all levels of play.

title: Indiana Mixed Four-Ball Championship
notes:
18-hole four-ball stroke play championship. Each 2 
person team must consist of a Male and Female. 

Teams may have 2 Professionals, 2 Amateurs, or 1 of 
each. 

There are Gross and Net Divisions.....maximum 
handicap allowed 18. 
Entrants 
must currently be affiliated with an 
IGA-PGA member club and possess a current 
IGA-PGA 
GHIN approved handicap index.

title: Indiana Junior/Senior Championship
notes:
18-hole four-ball stroke play championship. Each 2 man 
team must consist of an Amateur under the age of 55 
and an Amateur the age of 55 or older. Entrants 
must currently be affiliated with an 
IGA-PGA member club and possess a current 
IGA-PGA 
GHIN approved handicap index.

title: Florida Junior Team Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled for 2020.

36 holes of stroke play; the total of the low two scores per round of three gross scores for each team will count per round as team score. Three players per team and all three members must fall into one division (playing up allowed if approved by FSGA). Divisions: Boys and Girls, 16-18 and 13-15.
courseName: Mission Inn Resort - El Campeon Course

title: Junior Florida Cup Matches - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled for 2020.

The Junior Florida Cup is a Ryder Cup-style event that pits the best junior golfers in Florida against each other. It is a fun-filled three days that starts off with team meetings and practice rounds, followed by an optional team dinner at a local restaurant. The first day of matches includes mixed-foursomes (boy/girl alternate shot) as well as four-ball matches (two person best ball) which are followed by the pairings dinner at the club. During dinner, players select who they would like to play against in the following day's singles matches - something that always provides for some entertaining moments! And just like the Ryder Cup, the final day concludes with singles matches followed by the trophy presentation. This event is invitation only. Boys and girls are invited by their standing on the Junior Florida Cup points list.

title: Harry Oppenheimer Trophy
notes:
72-hole stroke play championship open to amateurs 
who are members of a Golf Club affiliated to the South 
African Golf Association and
who have a handicap of 3 (THREE) or less assessed in 
terms of the SAGA Course Rating and Handicapping 
System.

title: Bobby Locke Invitational - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

54 hole stroke play championship with a cut after 36 holes. Open to Amateurs who are members of a Golf Club affiliated to a Union recognised by the South African Golf Association and GolfRSA and who have a handicap index of 4 (four) or less as assessed in terms of the SAGA Course Rating and Handicapping System or any other system acceptable to the SAGA.

title: Silver Salver Amateur Championship
notes:
54 hole stroke play championship with a cut 
after 36 holes. Open to any male Amateur who is a full 
member of a Golf Club
affiliated to a Union recognised by the S.A.G.A. and 
who at the time of submitting this entry
shall have a handicap index of 4 or less.

title: South Australia Amateur Championship
notes:
The South Australia (WA) Amateur is open to men and 
women of any age, and contested over 36-holes stroke 
play qualifying with the leading 32 men and 16 or 8 
women (subject to numbers) progressing to elimination 
match play.

title: Kansas Women's Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
36 holes of individual stroke play with gross and net 
scoring. All competitors must be 
female amateurs and KGA/KCGA members.

title: Kansas Women's Tee-Fore-Two Championship
notes:
Two-day event with a different format each day. Day 1: 
Four Ball with team members receiving 95% of course 
handicap. Day 2: Chapman Alternate Shot with teams 
receiving 60% of the A player's handicap and 40% of 
the B player's handicap. All competitors 
must 
be female amateurs and KGA/KCGA members.

title: Westchester Public Links Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The single day competition is open to male Amateur golfers who reside in the nine county area and do not have playing privileges at a course at which the general public is excluded. Exceptions: A public course player may hold incidental privileges at a course which the general public is excluded when such privileges are provided by (1) an educational institution at which he is a student, or (2) a Federal armed service of which he is a member or retired member, or (3) an industry by which he is employed.

title: Tulsa Two-Man Challenge II
notes:
Must be a TGA member to enter. Day one is a two-man 
scramble; day two is a modified alternate shot. 
Separate tee markers for ages 54 and under, 55- 64, 
and 65+.

title: Dayton Valley Senior Amateur
notes:
Scratch and Net Divisions. Must be 50 years 
or older by day of event; 60 and over for 
Silver Division. Player must appear on the 
current active list of members for NNGA 
(Northern Nevada Golf Association) prior to 
tournament deadline.

title: Oklahoma Women's Senior Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36-hole stroke play championship for women seniors 50 years of age or older.

title: Oklahoma Women's Four-Ball Partnership
notes:
18-holes per day best ball of partners (stroke play) 
with 95% handicap. Field will be 
divided into flights based on combined handicaps.  
Overall Low Net award plus Low Net awards in each 
flight. Players must be 18 years of age by the first 
day of the tournament. Participants must be a 
WOGA 
member and have a current USGA handicap index 
listed on the member's club/course complete 
handicap printout sheet unless waived for a specific 
event. The participant's home club/course must be a 
WOGA member club/course.

title: Oklahoma Women's Cup
notes:
Club Teams will consist of 4 women. A woman is eligible to play on 1) the Club Team of her Home Club or 2) the Club Team of a club of which she is a dues-paying member of that club's Women's Golf Association.

Four 9-hole Four-Ball (better ball) matches and four 9-hole Foursomes (alternate shot) matches. Each team pairing will play in two four-ball matches and two foursomes matches. All team members play in every competition, except tiebreaker. The teams who play the front nine in the first round of the day will play the back nine in the second round of the day and visa versa. Each hole in a match is worth one point (win=1 point, tie =1/2 point). Four-Ball total points=36; Foursomes total points = 36; Total points available = 72.

title: Copa Baleares
notes:
72-hole stroke play event with a cut 
after 54 holes. The 
field is largely Spanish but does draw players from 
around Europe

title: Southern California Women's Amateur Net Championship
notes:

contested over two days and 36 holes. This 
championship is open to female SCGA members of all 
skill levels who will play using Course Handicaps. This 
championship was formerly known the SCGA Senior 
Women's Net Championship.

title: Chicago District Mixed Championship
notes:
This is an 18-hole stroke play team event. Teams will 
play within flighted Gross and Net divisions. Scoring 
will be a combined stableford using current handicap 
indexes. Players are awarded points based upon their 
score in relation to par on each hole. The winner of 
either the Gross or Net division will be the team who 
scores the highest number of points. Any male and 
female who are active members of a CDGA member 
club and have a current CDGA handicap index may 
enter as a team.

title: British Womens Senior Amateur Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The R&A Womens Senior Amateur Championship was first played in 1981. The championship is open to players aged 50 years and over and is held annually. The competitor with the lowest 54-hole total over four rounds of stroke play will be declared the winner. After 36 holes, the players returning the 40 lowest scores and any tying for 40th place qualify for the final 18 holes.

title: Effie Derr Robey Cup - POSTPONED
notes:
**Postponed due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Format: Partners receive one-half of combined course handicaps. Alternate drives, alternate shots. Eligibility: Partners must be a Class A and B women golfer from the same club. Class A index - up to 15.9. Class B index - 16.0 to 22.9.

title: Mississippi State Four-Ball Championship
notes:

Handicap through a USGA Licensed Mississippi Club. 
Participants must be bona fide residents of the state

notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

title: New Hampshire Senior Four-Ball Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Tournament is 36 holes stroke play, 2-man best-ball. Entries are open to male amateurs who are members in good standing of member NHGA Clubs who are legal residents of New Hampshire. Max handicap 12.0.

54 hole, two-person tournament played over three

All

title: Girls Junior America's Cup - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Team matches for junior girls, with teams representing golf associations across the western Unites State, as well as Mexico and two western provinces in Canada. Tradionally held the week after the U.S. Girls Junior Championship.

Players are eligible to participate in the GJAC if they are 14 years of age and have not yet reached their 19th birthday by the final day of competition and have not attended an institution of higher education.

Format:
• The Team Competition format for the GJAC Championship shall be 54 holes of stroke play.
• Team members will compete in a separate threesome (or foursome)
• The three lowest scores from each Team will be added together each day, with the highest score being discarded.
• The lowest three day totaled score will determine the winner.
• There is no individual competition.

member.

competition, participants may sign-up to compete in 
the team 
competition, with teams comprised of four players 
who represent 
the same club and are playing in the tournament as 
individuals.

title: Desert Aire Spring Best-Ball
notes:
36-hole two-person best-ball tournament, with gross 
and net competitions within flights.

title: Desert Aire Best-Ball Tournament
notes:
36-hole two-person best-ball tournament, with gross 
and net competitions within flights.

notes:
36-hole stroke play event. 
Championship (ages 15 and older), Net, Senior (ages 
51+), Senior Net, Silver (ages 61+), and 
Silver 
Net 
divisions. 
Non-SNGA members are welcome.

title: Graham City Amateur Championship
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play tournament flighted after 
the first round. Championship and Senior (ages 55+) 
divisions.

title: Pine Meadows Better-Ball - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36-hole two-man best-ball tournament. Entrants must be male, amateur contestants, 18 years of age or older.

title: Harrisburg District Senior Championship
notes:
18 holes: Open to all senior amateur golfers residing or

handicap with HDGA member clubs or affiliate 
member clubs.
