notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

36-hole stroke play championship held at two courses at the Westin Mission Hills Golf Resort & Spa. There will be five flights determined by handicap – Championship, Sinatra, Davis Jr, Martin & Bishop. The top three places for each flight will receive a trophy. The championship is open to amateur golfers only with an established GHIN handicap index.
courseName: The Westin Mission Hills Resort - Pete Dye Course

title: Michigan Publinx Two-Man Best-Ball Championship
notes:
One-day four-ball stroke play tournament with 
Championship, Senior 
Championship and Net competitions. Seniors are 
ages 
50 and older. Entries are open to all male amateur 
golfers with an established USGA handicap. Must be 
eighteen years or 
older to participate.
courseName: Indianwood Golf & Country Club - New Course

title: The Donna Andrews Invitational
notes:
New to the schedule in 2019, this is a 54-hole stroke play event honoring Donna Andrews, the major champion and Virginia Sports Hall of Famer who grew up at the host Boonsboro Country Club.

Open to any female player with a Handicap Index of 14.4 or less, the field will be limited to 72 competitors, selected at the discretion of The Donna Andrews Invitational.

Open, Junior (non-college players ages 18 or lower), Mid-Am (ages 25+), and Senior (ages 50+) divisions.

title: Maine Mixed Championship
notes:
The Mixed Championship is open to all Maine 
amateur golfers.  Sides 
will consist of two players, one male and one female. 
The championship 
will consist of 18 holes of Scotch Ball Modified 
Pinehurst. In this format, 
both players hit drives from the appropriate tee and 
then play their 
partner’s ball for the second shot. One ball is then 
selected and players 
alternate shots until the ball is holed. Net scores will 
be determined by 
taking 60% of the lower handicap and 40% of the 
higher handicap.

title: Maine Club Team Championship
notes:
The Club Team Championship features four-man 
teams 
consisting of players all from the same golf club. As 
is 
such, all players must be in good standing of the 
same 
MSGA member club on or before the date they 
submit 
their application. The championship will consist of 18 
holes of stroke play. Players will play their own ball, 
with the two low gross and net scores counting for 
each 
hole.

title: Maine Senior Club Team Championship
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The Senior Club Team Championship features four- man teams consisting of players all from the same golf club. As is such, all players must be 55 years of age or older in good standing of the same MSGA member club on or before the date they submit their application. The championship will consist of 18 holes of stroke play. Players will play their own ball, with the two low gross and net scores counting for each hole.

title: Arkansas Women's Eclectic
notes:
Eclectic means selecting the best hole scores over two days of play over the same course. You may understand this as the “Ringer” format where individual players record their best hole scores made on a particular course over two days. This competition will be flighted by Rd. 1 score following the completion of the first round, based on team entries. There is no maximum handicap for this event.

Entries are open to female golfers who are residents of the state of Arkansas, and upon approval by the ASGA, non-residents whose home course is located in Arkansas.

title: Ontario Public Amateur Championship
notes:
36 Holes Stroke Play. Three Flights: A Flight - % of 
players with the lowest Handicap Factors - Gross 
Competition, B Flight - % of players with the next 
lowest Handicap Factors - Net Competition, C Flight - % 
of players with the highest Handicap Factors - Net 
Competition.

title: Puget Sound Amateur
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament played on Lake 
Spanaway and Chambers Bay, with gross and net 
scoring. The round at Chambers Bay is walking-only. 
Field limited to the first 132 paid entries.

title: Amateur Golf Alliance Women’s Amateur Championship
notes:
The tournament will be 54 holes of stroke play for 
eligible women who have completed their college 
eligibility and are 23 years of age on or before the 
first 
round of the competition. Field limited to 78 players. 
Applicants must have a USGA handicap index of 6.0 
or 
lower. Entries will be reviewed based on playing 
experience, competitive success, rankings and merit 
against those of other applicants.

title: Fox Den Championship
notes:
36-hole individual stroke play tournament with 
Championship, Senior and A (handicaps of 10 or 
higher) flights. Optional skins game.

title: Dinaland Senior Classic
notes:
36 hole stroke play tournament open to men and 
women seniors aged 50 and above. Utah Golf 
Association Senior points event.

title: Women's Australian Master of the Amateurs
notes:
The Master of the Amateurs, a 72-hole medal play Championship played in Melbourne, Australia, has rapidly become one of the elite championships in amateur golf. Like The Masters, the champion receives a Green Jacket. Contestants participate in the first round of the championship with professional golfers in a unique Am-Pro Invitational.

The Master of the Amateurs winner gets an invitation to the Players Amateur and Porter Cup in the U.S. Likewise the winners of those two tournaments receive invitations to the next Master of the Amateurs tournament.

A qualifying round (see tournament website for date and handicap requirement) allows three non-exempt players to earn invitations into the prestigious field.

A women's division featuring 21 elite female amateurs has been added starting with the 2018 tournament.

title: International King's Cup
notes:
The International King’s Cup is a Team Match Play competition currently played every year between an Irish National team and an American National team. Additional international teams will compete in the future.

Teams must advance from Local Qualifying and then a final National Qualifier.

Each National Team is made up of 2 person teams in two age Divisions with four Flights per Division. The Senior Division is for players 55 years of age and older. The Open Division is for players under 55. A player 55 or older may play in the Open Division.

Each Division is made up of four flights based on Team Index. Each flight is as follows. Championship flight = 4.9 and under, A-flight = 5.0 to 9.9, B-flight = 10.0 to 14.9, C-flight = 15.0 and above.

The format is a modified team match-play. Each flight of each team plays every hole in that day’s format. Day 1 is a best-ball format, Day 2 is modified alternate shot, Day 3 is singles matches. Each hole is worth 2 points. Winning a hole is worth 2-points, a half is worth 1-point and a loss of a hole is worth 0- points.

At the end of each match each flight totals their points. When all the flights have finished their matches the total points from each flight are added together to form an overall total for the team that day. The team with the most overall total points after the 3 days of competition wins the International King’s Cup. In the event of a tie, the team currently holding the Cup retains the Cup.

title: USGC King's Cup National Championship
notes:
This is the U.S. final qualifier for the International King's Cup which is held the following spring. Two-man teams will compete in three different formats, and the successful qualifiers will represent Team USA in the King's Cup. Round 1 is a best-ball, round 2 is alternate shot, and round 3 is aggregate stroke play.

There are two divisions – Open Division and Senior Division. Open Division is open to all ages. Senior Division is for Players 55 years of age and above. A Player that is 55+ is allowed to compete in the Open division, but a player that is under 55 is not allowed to compete in the Senior division. There are four flights in each Division determined by Team Index.

title: Pennsylvania Mixed Team Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The Mixed Team Championship is open to teams of one male amateur golfer and one female amateur golfer who are both members of a club belonging to the Pennsylvania Golf Association or an Individual Member of the Pennsylvania Golf Association. Players need not be members of the same club.

Chapman format: both players hit their drives on the tee, for the second shot player A hits player B’s ball and player B hits player A’s ball, for the third shot the players select which ball they would like to play and play alternately until the ball is holed.

The scoring will be Gross and Net Stableford scoring. Gross and net awards will be presented. Net competition will be based on a team combined handicap; 60% of lower handicap and 40% of higher handicap. The Course Handicap limit will be 36. There will be two divisions: Championship & Forward.

Nebraska Golf Association points event.

notes: Played for the 75th time in 2019, this is a 36-hole stroke play tournament for women with open and junior divisions. The tournament honors Marion Miley, a decorated amateur golfer from Lexington County Club who represented the U.S. in the Curtis Cup and was one of the nation's top female golfers when her life was tragically cut short at the age of 27. (See the excellent article about her life and death written by Rhonda Glenn for the USGA.)

title: Legends & Leaders Pro-Am
notes:
Pro-Am preceding the PURE Insurance Championship. Each group will be made up of three amateurs and one PGA TOUR Champions professional in a one net and one gross best ball competition. Proceeds benefit Monterey Peninsula Foundation and The First Tee of Monterey County.

Each pro-am participant is invited to bring a guest to the Legends & Leaders Evening which includes strolling coastal cuisine and boutique Napa Valley wine tasting culminating with a speaker program. The program will feature notables from the business and entertainment world highlighting The First Tee Core Values.

Past notable speakers include: Arnold Palmer, Tom Watson III, Bill Murray, Leon Panetta, Lindsey Vonn, Herm Edwards, Johnny Miller, Joe Louis Barrow Jr., Capt. Sully Sullenberger, Heidi Ueberroth, Peter Ueberroth, and Alfonso Ribeiro.

title: AmateurGolf.com 2020 Two Man Links at Bandon Dunes
notes:
NOTE If you are looking for the 2021 tournament, please visit the following page for information and registration - this listing is for the 2020 event which was played in June. 2021 Tournament Info>

It's time to check Bandon Dunes off your bucket list. Join us for the 19th annual playing of AmateurGolf.com's flagship best-ball event at the highly-acclaimed Bandon Dunes Resort. The tournament features Championship, Senior Championship, and Net Divisions and it always draws a diverse group of players from across the U.S. and Canada.

NEW FOR 2020: Father/Son Championship: AmateurGolf.com is pleased to announce that the tournament now includes a Father/Son division with gross and net prizes as well as eligibility for the overall championship in either division.
WHAT'S INCLUDED:

(4) nights lodging at Bandon Dunes Resort (see options below)
(4) tournament rounds (1) at each of the resort's courses
(1) gala tournament dinner (golf attire fine)
$10,000 in prizes (based on 80 players)
Tournament awards for division winners
Welcome gifts for all players

ITINERARY

Weds, June 24, 2020
Arrival day, golf at player's expense today for those that arrive early enough or complimentary use of awesome range
- Lodging: Bandon Dunes Resort

Thursday, June 25, 2020
Tournament Round 1 at Pacific Dunes
- Lodging: Bandon Dunes Resort

Friday, June 26, 2020
Tournament Round 2 at Bandon Dunes
- Lodging: Bandon Dunes Resort

Saturday, June 27, 2020
Tournament Round 3 at Sheep Ranch
- evening: 7:00pm - Dinner at Bandon Dunes- MacKenzie Hall
- Lodging: Bandon Dunes Resort

Sunday, June 28, 2020
Final Round at Bandon Trails
- morning tee times tbd based on number of players -- please check out of your room prior to play unless arrangements have been made to stay over
- Tournament Awards immediately following play at Bandon Trails.

Divisions
Championship
For teams with a suggested combined handicap index of 16.0 or lower. This division is played best-ball at scratch from the Green Tees. Prizes will be awarded to the top finishers, and optional skins games will be held daily.
Senior Championship
For teams with suggested combined handicap of 16.0 or lower, where both are aged 50+. Play from Green Tees, except those aged 65+ may elect to play from Gold Tees. Teams in this division are eligible to win the overall title. Prizes for top finishers; optional daily skins games.
Net
For teams with a suggested combined handicap of 36.0 or lower. Play will be at 80% of course handicap, with a maximum allowance of 18. Play from Green Tees, except that those aged 65+ may elect to play from the Gold Tees. Prizes for top finishers; optional daily skins games.

REGISTER NOW >>

title: San Francisco City 2020 Men's Championship PRE-QUALIFIER
notes:
As the field for the Men's Championship has reached 120 players, all additional entrants will enter the pre- qualifier as described below.

MEN'S CHAMPIONSHIP DIVISION PRE- QUALIFIER
Open to players with a handicap index of 6.4 or less.

Those entering pre-qualifying will pay an entry fee of $150 for the pre-qualifier to be held at Lincoln Park. Those advancing from the pre- qualifier will pay an additional $150 and will play in the 36-hole stroke play qualifying played at TPC Harding Park and Lincoln Park Golf Courses. The low 32 will then advance to the match play phase of the championship. There will be no refunds after entries close.

A schedule of all dates of play can be found on the tournament website sfgolfchampionship.com.

ABOUT THE SAN FRANCISCO CITY CHAMPIONSHIP
The oldest municipal tournament in the USA. Match play event with scratch men's, senior, women's, senior women's and open flight divisions. Past champions include Ken Venturi, Harvie Ward, Juli Inkster, Bob Rosburg, George Archer, and Dorothy Delasin. Some of the 'non winners' include Tom Watson and Johnny Miller. Click the 'history' tab for more about this wonderful event.

title: San Francisco City 2020 SUPER SENIOR CHAMPIONSHIP
notes:
MEN'S SUPER-SENIOR DIVISION
$225 ENTRY FEE INCLUDES ALL GREENS FEES

Open to the first 50 entries received. Participants must have an index of 9.4 or lower on December 1 and must have an age of 65 or older as of the first day of the tournament. Qualifying will consist of one 18-hole stroke play round after which the Men's Super Senior Championship Flight will consist of 16 contestants -- the defending champion if entered (who will be the #2 seed), and the remainder from the Men’s Super Senior Championship qualifier.

If the defending champion wishes to play in qualifying for Medalist honors, he loses the #2 seed and will be seeded accordingly if he qualifies successfully.

In case of ties, there will be a card off to determine the players who will advance to match play. Individual scores will determine seeding for match play. There will be no refunds after entries close. All rounds will be played at TPC Harding Park Golf Course.

A schedule of all dates of play can be found on the tournament website sfgolfchampionship.com.

Qualifying will consist of one 18-hole stroke play round after which the Men's Senior Championship Flight will consist of 16 contestants -- the defending champion if entered (who will be the #2 seed), and the remainder from the Women’s Championship qualifier.

If the defending champion wishes to play in qualifying for Medalist honors, she loses the #2 seed and will be seeded accordingly if she qualifies successfully.

The next 16 contestants will be seeded in the Juli Inkster Flight. Individual scores will determine seeding for match play. There will be no refunds after entries close. All rounds will be played at TPC Harding Park Golf Course.

title: The Dogwood Invitational 2020 - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Tournament week is June 8-13 at Druid Hills Golf Club in Atlanta, Georgia. The entry fee includes breakfast and lunch tournament days as well as special events.

The history of this prestigious event extends back to 1941, when legendary amateur Tommy Barnes captured his first of five Dogwood titles. Evolving with the times, the modern Dogwood has produced fine champions like Webb Simpson (’07), Brian Harman (’09), Dawson Armstrong (’15), and in 2019 Brandon Mancheno. This evolution can be seen also in our course renovations and set-up, our relaxed tournament atmosphere, and our spirit of social responsibility.

Players are required to walk during tournament play and may carry their golf bag themselves (push carts are allowed) or take a caddie. Caddies may be requested in advance during registration, or players may select one on their own.

Player housing is provided on an as available basis to players only, caddies and traveling companions are not provided housing.

title: Sacramento County 2020 Senior & Super Senior Championship
notes:
The 47th annual County Senior & Super Senior Men's Championship will be contested at Ancil Hoffman Golf Course on Tuesday and Wednesday, August 4 and 5, 2020. The tournament is open to all male amateur golfers age 55 and older as of August 4, 2020, who are members of an organized golf club with an established World Handicap System (WHS) Index of 9.4 or less. There will be two separate flights - Seniors (age 55-64) and Super Seniors (age 65 and older). The Super Senior flight will also include a Legends division (age 75 and older).

The entry fee is $165 per player and includes two days green fees, range balls both days and awards - power cart not included. The entry deadline is July 27 and there will be no refunds after this date. There will be a $10 cancellation fee for withdrawals prior to the entry deadline and a $25 service charge for returned checks.

The tournament format is 36 holes of stroke play – 18 holes each day. Ties for champion in both flights will be decided in a sudden death playoff. All other ties will be divided evenly by the sum of the combined places. The lowest 36- hole gross scores in the respective flights will be declared the 2020 County Sr. and Super Senior Men’s Champion. The names will be inscribed on the perpetual trophy.

title: Sacramento County 2020 Vintage Men's & Women's Net Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The 2020 County Vintage Men's and Women's Net Championship will be contested at Mather Golf Course on Tuesday and Wednesday, June 2 and 3, 2020.

The tournament is open to all male and female amateur golfers who are at least 50 years of age with a current World Handicap System (WHS) Index.

Flights will be established by age and will depend on the number of entries. Competition will be stroke play over 36 holes. Handicaps will be determined using the WHS Index as of June 1, 2020. All ties will be decided by the recommended USGA method of determination.

The entry fee is $155 and includes two days green fees, range balls and awards - power carts not included.

The entry deadline is May 25, 2020 and there will be no refunds after this date.

title: Sacramento County 2020 Vintage Super Senior Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The 2020 Vintage Super Senior Scratch Championship will be contested at Mather Golf Course on Tuesday and Wednesday, June 2 and 3, 2020.

The tournament is open to all male amateur golfers who are at least 65 years of age with a current World Handicap System (WHS) Index of 9.4 or lower.

Competition will be stroke play over 36 holes at scratch. In the event of ties for the championship, a sudden death playoff will be conducted after completion of play on Wednesday.

The entry fee is $155 and includes two days green fees, range balls, and awards - power carts not included.

The entry deadline is May 25, 2020 and there will be no refunds after this date.

title: Sacramento City 2020 Junior/Senior Championship
notes:
The 72nd annual Walter & Olga Strand Junior/Senior Chapman Scotch City Championship will be contested at Bartley Cavanaugh Golf Course on Saturday, September 26, 2020.

This tournament is open to all golfers with or without an established World Handicap System (WHS) Index. Juniors must be 18 years of age or younger, and the senior partner must be at least 15 years older than their junior partner. Each team must secure their own partner.

This is an 18-hole, 2-player team event. The competition will use a Chapman Scotch format (Hit, Switch and Choose). Complete rules will be explained on the day of play. There will be two divisions - a Handicap Division and a Callaway Division.

The Handicap Division will be for teams where both players have a current WHS Index. The difference between the team member’s Indexes may not be more than 20. For players with a WHS Index, the September 15, 2020 index will be used. The Callaway Division will be for teams with no WHS Index or where only one team partner has an index.

Ties for the Championship will be broken by matching scorecards.

The entry fee is $99 per 2-person team, and includes green fee, tee prizes, power cart, lunch and awards. The field is limited to the first 50 team paid entries.

The registration deadline is September 20, 2020. Please note that the senior (adult) partner must complete registration for the team.

title: Sacramento County 2020 Men's Scratch Championship
notes:
The 56th annual Sacramento County Men's Scratch Championship will be contested at Ancil Hoffman Golf Course on Saturday and Sunday, July 18 and 19, 2020. The tournament is open to all male amateur golfers with a current World Handicap System (WHS) Index of 5.0 or less.

The format is stroke play over 36 holes - 18 holes each day. In the event of a tie for the championship, a sudden-death playoff at completion of play on Sunday, July 19, will determine the champion. Prizes for other ties are awarded by combining tied places and distributing accordingly.

The entry fee is $200 and will include all green fees, range balls and awards - power cart not included.

Cancellations and requests for refunds prior to the closing date should call Dave Marks, tournament director at 916-952- 2234. Do not call the golf course. There will be a $10 cancellation fee for withdrawals prior to the entry deadline and a $25 service charge on all returned checks.

Players wishing to use this tournament as a qualifier for the State Fair Amateur must pay an additional $25 during entry.

The entry deadline is July 10, 2020 and there will be no refunds after this date.

title: Sacramento City 2020 Men's Regional Four-Ball - CANCELLED
notes:
**Because of concerns about the COVID-19 virus, and following the lead of the Northern California Golf Association, other major sports organizations and the advice of county, state and federal health officials, we have cancelled the City 4-Ball Championship. Refunds will be processed as quickly as possible.

The 66th annual Sacramento City Regional 4 Ball Championship will be contested over two weekends at Bing Maloney Golf Course on March 21, 22, 28 and 29. The tournament is open to all amateur golfers with a current World Handicap System (WHS) Index of 7.0 or lower. A handicap card or other verification must be presented prior to teeing off on the first day of the tournament.

The tournament format is as follows:

All play conducted under USGA rules. Play is at scratch. All rounds will be posted by the Tournament Director.

4-Ball stroke play qualifying round on Saturday, March 21 - 8:03 a.m. morning tee times*
1st Round matches 18 holes Sunday, March 22 - 8:03 a.m. morning tee times
2nd Round matches 18 holes Saturday, March 28 - 7:30 a.m. morning tee times
3rd Round matches 18 holes Saturday, March 28 - 1:00 p.m. afternoon tee times
4th Round matches 18 holes Sunday, March 29 - 7:30 a.m. morning tee times
Championship match Sunday, March 29 - 1:00 p.m. afternoon tee time - if needed.

* Low 31 or 15 teams plus defending champions or low 32 or 16 teams will advance to the match play round on Sunday, March 22. (Defending Champions playing as a team shall receive automatic qualification into match play unless they elect to compete in the qualifying round). Ties will be broken by sudden death playoff from first hole unless there would be an option to play from another hole if both teams agree.

The entry fee is $260 per team and includes ALL qualifying and match play green fees. Golf carts may be rented in the golf shop prior to play. The field is limited to paid entries from the first 72 teams.

The entry deadline is March 16, 2020 and there will be no refunds after that date.

title: Sacramento County 2020 Regional Four-Ball Championship
notes:
The 2020 Sacramento County Men’s Four-Ball Championship will be contested at Mather Golf Course on October 17-18 and October 24-25, 2020. The tournament is open to all amateur golfers with a current World Handicap System (WHS) Index of 7.0 or less as of October 15, 2020.

The tournament format is as follows:

All play conducted under USGA rules. Play is at scratch. All rounds will be posted by the Tournament Director.

- 4-Ball stroke play qualifying round on Saturday, October 17 – 7:58 a.m. morning tee times*
- 1st Round matches 18 holes Sunday, October 18 – 7:58 a.m. morning tee times
- 2nd Round matches 18 holes Saturday, October 24 – 7:34 a.m. morning tee times
- 3rd Round matches 18 holes Saturday, October 24 – 1:02 p.m. afternoon tee times
- 4th Round matches 18 holes Sunday, October 25 – 7:34 a.m. morning tee times
- Championship match Sunday, October 25 – 1:02 p.m. afternoon tee time – if needed.

* Low 31 or 15 teams plus defending champions or low 32 or 16 teams will advance to the match play round on Sunday, October 18. (Defending Champions playing as a team shall receive automatic qualification into match play unless they elect to compete in the qualifying round). Ties will be broken by sudden death playoff from first hole unless there would be an option to play from another hole if both teams agree.

The entry fee is $260 per team and includes ALL qualifying and match play green fees (power carts not included). Golf carts may be rented in the golf shop prior to play. The field is limited to paid entries from the first 72 teams.

The entry deadline is October 12, 2020 and there will be no refunds after this date. Late entries will be accepted if space is available with cash only - no exceptions.

The championship is conducted over 18 holes of stroke play.

title: Sacramento City 2020 Women's Championship
notes:
The 85th annual Sacramento City Women's Golf Championship will be contested at Bing Maloney Golf Course on Saturday and Sunday, June 27 and 28, 2020.

The tournament is open to all women amateur golfers with an established handicap index of 34.3 or less. Higher indexes are eligible but will be adjusted to 34.3. The June 15, 2020 World Handicap System (WHS) Index will used to determine eligibility and handicap.

The Championship flight will play at scratch. Confirmation of equivalent ability may be submitted in lieu of a GHIN to establish eligibility for the Championship Flight only. Please contact Sean Wong, Tournament Director, for any eligibility questions.

The entry fee is $125 per player (all past champions pay only $85) and includes green fees for both days and all awards (cart fees and range balls are not included).

The tournament format will be stroke play over 36 holes - 18 on Saturday and 18 on Sunday. The Championship Flight will play after the handicap flights each day. Handicap flights will be determined according to the entries received. Sunday’s pairings will be determined by scores within the respective flights with the Championship Flight teeing off in score order. Ties only for the Championship Flight Low Gross will be decided by a sudden death playoff starting on Hole #17. All other ties will be broken by the recommended USGA method of matching scorecards.

The entry deadline is June 22, 2020.

Players are required to contact Sean Wong at (916) 214-2697 or seanandnan@aol.com regarding cancellations or late entries– DO NOT CALL THE PRO SHOP TO CANCEL. REFUNDS will only be given if cancellation is made prior to the entry deadline. There will be a $10 administrative fee for all cancellations or returned checks.

title: Sacramento City 2020 Mixed Team Championship
notes:
The 2020 Sacramento City Mixed Team Championship will be contested at Bing Maloney Golf Course on Sunday, August 2, 2020.

The tournament is open to all amateurs age 18 and over with an established World Handicap System (WHS) Index. The August 1, 2020 handicap indexes will be used for team handicap.

The entry fee is $125 per couple and includes green fees, range balls and awards (power cart not included).

Play will be 18-holes of golf. Each competitor must secure his/her playing partner. Two couples may be paired together if requested. The CHAPMAN FORMAT patterned after foursome play will be used. Both partners hit from their own tee. Each plays a second shot with the other’s ball. After the second shots, a choice is made regarding the ball to be used to continue and the hole is completed by using alternating shots until holed out.

The entry deadline is July 26, 2020.

title: California State Fair 2020 Senior & Super Senior Championship
notes:
The 24th annual California State Fair Senior Championship and 11th annual California State Fair Super Senior Championship will be contested on Saturday and Sunday, September 5 and 6, 2020 at Mather Golf Course.

The tournament is played at scratch and is open to male amateur golfers 55 and older with a current handicap index of 7.4 or less (Senior) and 65 and older with an index of 9.4 and less (Super Senior). The Super Senior flight will also include a Legends division (age 75 and older).

The entry fee is $175 and includes two days of green fees, range balls and awards (power carts not included).

The competition will be stroke play over 36 holes (18 holes each day). In an effort to improve pace of play, tee time intervals will be set at 10 minutes rather than the usual 8 minute intervals. In the event of a tie for the championship title (Senior and Super Senior), there will be a playoff.

The entry deadline is August 28, 2020.

title: Port Phillip Women's Open Amateur
notes:
72-hole stroke play tournament held on two courses, 
with a cut after 36 holes. The low 16 players qualify for 
the Victorian Women's Amateur match play tournament 
held immediately after.

title: Victorian Women's Amateur Championship
notes:
The low 16 women finishers in the Port Phillip Women's 
Amateur qualify for elimination match play in the 
Victorian Women's Amateur.

title: Sacramento County 2020 Women's Championship
notes:
The 2020 Sacramento County Women's Scratch Championship will be contested at Mather Golf Course on Saturday and Sunday, July 18 and 19, 2020. The tournament is open to all female golfers with a World Handicap System (WHS) Index of 5.0 or less.

The entry fee is $145 and includes green fees, range balls and all awards (cart fees are not included). The tournament format will be stroke play over 36 holes - 18 on Saturday and 18 on Sunday. In the event of a tie, a sudden-death playoff will be conducted after completion of play on Sunday, July 19. All other ties will be broken using the USGA method of matching score cards.

The player with the lowest total score will be declared the 2020 Sacramento County Women’s Champion. Her name will be engraved on a perpetual trophy and she will be awarded a merchandise gift card. Other prizes of merchandise gift cards will be awarded based on total payouts to about one third of the field.

The entry deadline is July 11, 2020 - no refunds after July 11th. There will be a $10 cancellation fee for withdrawals prior to the entry deadline and a $25 service charge on all returned checks.

title: The Devlin
notes:
The Devlin is a 54-hole best ball tournament 
that has 
had a loyal following for over 25 
years. 44 two-man teams -- best ball scoring 
on 
Friday and Saturday, combined score on 
Sunday. The tournament was moved from 
Texas to 
Secession Golf Club in South Carolina 
in 2011. The Cannon (Championship) Division 
is for 
mid-amateurs age 25+ with combined handicap 
of 
7.0 
or less, and the Saber (Senior) Division is for 
players 
in the 50+ age group with combined 
handicap of 9.0 or less.

title: Millennium Golf Classic
notes:
The Millennium Golf Classic began with the turn of the 
millennium and remains a popular annual tradition at 
the renowned Golden Horseshoe Golf Club. The 36-hole 
tournament features teams of two amateur golfers. 
Saturday’s format will be captain’s choice on the Green 
Course; Sunday’s will be four-ball on the Gold Course.
courseName: Golden Horseshoe Golf Club - Gold Course

title: Sacramento City 2020 Men's Championship - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The 99th annual Sacramento City Men's Golf Championship will be contested at the Alister MacKenzie GC at the Haggin Oaks Golf Complex on Saturday and Sunday, June 6 and 7, 2020.

The tournament is open to all male amateur golfers with a current World Handicap System (WHS) Index of 5.0 or less.

The tournament format is stroke play over 36 holes with 18 holes each day and a maximum of 108 players. Play will be in groups of three with 9 minute intervals from the 1st tee starting at 7:00 AM. Sunday pairings will be based on Saturday scores with the leaders competing at the end of the field.

The entry fee is $190 per player and includes green fees for both days and prize fund - power carts are not included. The player with the 36- hole low score will be declared the 2020 Sacramento City Men’s Amateur Champion. His name will be inscribed on the perpetual trophy and he will receive a crystal to take home. The awards presentation will immediately follow play at the large tournament scoreboard. Approximately 25% of the field will be awarded with merchandise certificates. All merchandise certificates are redeemable at either Haggin Oaks, Bing Maloney or Bartley Cavanaugh golf shops.

Players wishing to use this tournament as a qualifier for the State Fair Amateur must pay an additional $25 during entry.

The entry deadline is May 29, 2020.

title: Mississippi Women's State Amateur Championship
notes:
54-hole stroke play championship open to female 
amateurs who are bona fide residents of the state of 
Mississippi for at least 60 days prior to the first 
round of the tournament. Championship and Regular 
divisions. Participants must conform with the USGA 
Rules of Amateur Status. All participants in 
Mississippi Golf Association State Championships are 
required to have an active GHIN Handicap through a 
USGA Licensed Mississippi Club.

title: Mississippi Women's State Four-Ball Championship
notes:
The tournament is scheduled for 36 holes of four-ball 
stroke play. All 
participants are required to have an active GHIN 
Handicap through a USGA Licensed Mississippi Club. 
Participants must be bona fide residents of the state 
of Mississippi for at least 60 days prior to the first 
round of the tournament.

title: Southwest Team Challenge
notes:
These matches, hosted by the Arizona Golf Association, 
attract teams from golf associations all over the west 
coast. Teams are comprised of four players each, all of 
whom must be over 25 years of age, and at least two 
of whom must be over 50 years of age. The format is a 
four-ball stroke play at gross using a modified 
stableford scoring system.

title: California State Fair 2020 Women's Championship
notes:
The 25th State Fair Women's Championship will be contested at Bartley Cavanaugh Golf Course, Sacramento, CA on September 5 and 6, 2020.

The tournament is open to all women amateur golfers age 18 or older by September 5, 2020, with an established World Handicap System (WHS) Index of 36.4 or less, members of a college golf team, junior girls ages 14-18 who placed in the top three in the 2020 SGC City or County Women’s Tournaments scratch flight, or the top three junior girls in the 15- 18 Division of the 2019 State Fair Junior Championship or the top three junior girls in any of the 2020 SGC Junior Championships Age 14-18 Division, or special invitation.

August 26, 2020 is the deadline – no refunds after this date. Please call Barbara Conerly, Tournament Director (916-428-1377) regarding cancellations or refund requests prior to the deadline. There will be a $25 service charge on all returned checks or a $10 administrative fee for any withdrawals for online registration.

Handicaps will be based on August 15, 2020 indexes.

The Championship Flight contestants must have an index of 6.6 or less and will play at scratch from the back (Blue) tees. Senior Net Handicap Flight(s), age 60+, determined by handicap or age (entries permitting) and Net Handicap Flight(s) will play using handicaps from the forward (Black tees). Ties for overall low gross, overall low net and overall senior low net will be decided in a hole-by-hole sudden death playoff. All other ties will be decided based on the USGA recommended method of matching score cards.

Entry fees are $130 per person for non-City “Play Card” holders; $125 for City Adult “Play Card” holders; $120 for Seniors with a City Senior “Play Card”. The entry fee includes two (2) days green fees and awards (Power Cart Not Included).

title: Sacramento City 2020 Senior & Super Senior Championship
notes:
The 52nd Sacramento City Senior and 11th Sacramento City Super Senior Men's Championships will be contested at Bing Maloney Golf Course on Tuesday and Wednesday, July 21 and 22, 2020. The tournament is open to all male amateur golfers age 55 to 64 (Senior Division) with a World Handicap System (WHS) Index of 7.5 or less and age 65 and older (Super Senior Division) with a WHS Index of 9.4 or less. The Super Senior flight will also include a Legends division (age 75 and older).

The entry fee is $140 per player and includes two days green fees, range balls and awards - power carts are not included. Requests for twosome pairings are acceptable, but requests for a foursome are not allowed.

The tournament format is 36 holes of stroke play – 18 holes each day. The Senior flight will be for ages 55 to 64 and the Super Senior flight will be for ages 65 and over. Ties for champions in both flights will be decided in a sudden death playoff starting on the 17th hole. All other ties will be divided evenly by the sum of the combined places. The lowest 36-hole gross scores in the respective flights will be declared the 2020 City Senior and Super Senior Men’s Champions. The names will be inscribed on the perpetual trophy.

The entry deadline is July 13 and there will be NO refunds after this date. There will be a $10 administrative fee for any withdrawal prior to the entry deadline.

notes:

The 51st annual County Mixed Team Scotch Championship will be contested at Mather Golf Course on Sunday, July 12, 2020. The tournament is open to all amateur golfers age 18 and over with an established World Handicap System (WHS) Index. Two-person teams/couples must be made up with one female and one male player.

The July 6, 2020 handicap indexes will be used for team handicap.

The entry fee is $135 per team and includes green fees and awards (power cart not included). Please call Bob Roak, Tournament Director, at (916) 996-8259 regarding cancellations or refunds.

Play will be 18-holes of golf. Each competitor must secure his/her playing partner. Two teams may be paired together if requested. The CHAPMAN FORMAT patterned after foursome play will be used. Both partners hit from their own tee. Each plays a second shot with the other’s ball. After the second shots, a choice is made regarding the ball to be used to continue and the hole is completed by using alternating shots until holed out.

The entry deadline is July 5, 2020.

title: California State Fair 2020 Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
The California State Fair Men’s Mid-Amateur Championship (formerly State Fair Masters Championship) will be contested at Bing Maloney Golf Course on August 22-23, 2020.

The tournament is open to all male amateur golfers age 30 or older (no maximum age), who are members of an organized golf club with a World Handicap System (WHS) Index of 7.0 or less. The August 15th WHS will be used to determine eligibility unless confirmation of equivalent ability is received.

The entry fee of $129 ($99 for past State Fair Masters champions) per player includes greens fees and all awards - power carts not included.

The tournament format is 18 holes of stroke play on Saturday, August 22 and 18 holes on Sunday, August 23. The contestant with the lowest score for the 36-holes will be declared the 2020 California State Fair Mid-Amateur Champion. In the event of a tie for the championship, a sudden death playoff will start immediately following play beginning on the 17th tee.

The entry deadline is Sunday, August 16, 2020. There will be a $10 cancellation fee for all withdrawals prior to the entry deadline and a $25 administrative fee for all returned checks.

title: Talking Stick Resort Amateur Championship
notes:

title: Southeastern Amateur
notes:
The Southeastern Amateur is a top-level amateur golf tournament with a rich history dating back to 1922 - when the tournament was created by Fred Haskins. Each year, the Southeastern Amateur has the great honor of hosting many of the nation's top amateur golfers, from Division I NCAA National Champions to the nation's top Mid- Amateurs.

Field is limited to 90 players. The format is 72 holes of stroke play. The field will be cut to the low 60 and ties after 54 holes.

$295 entry fee includes practice round, at least three tournament rounds, and breakfast/lunch each day.

Open qualifier held the day before the tournament.

title: USGC King's Cup National Qualifier
notes:
This is one of a series of National Qualifiers for the USGA King's Cup National Championship, from which the top finishers will go on to represent the U.S. in the International King's Cup against Ireland.

Scoring at National Qualifiers is best-ball NET, so as to properly allocate strokes among teammates. The lowest net score will be that team’s score for the hole. Each teammate will receive 85% of their course handicap. The low 30% of the field and ties will qualify for the USGC National Championship.

There are two divisions – Open Division and Senior Division. Open Division is open to all ages. Senior Division is for Players 55 years of age and above. A Player that is 55+ is allowed to compete in the Open division, but a player that is under 55 is not allowed to compete in the Senior division.

title: Stocker Cup 2020 Invitational - CANCELLED
notes:
**Cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak.

The Stocker Cup was founded in 1991 to honor the memory of Peter Stocker. Peter and his partners Bill Harlan and John Montgomery founded San Francisco's Pacific Union Company, a highly successful real estate development company. The firm initiated the development of The Santa Lucia Preserve, a 20,000 acre residential and golf community located above Carmel. Meandering through the winding road to The Preserve's centerpiece -- the top-100 rated golf course -- has been described as "driving through a California postcard." The Stocker Cup was played from 1991 to 1999 at Pebble Beach and its surrounding golf courses, before moving to the Tom Fazio and Sandy Tatum designed Preserve G.C. In the words of former USGA President Tatum: "Peter Stocker was the quintessential amateur golfer. He loved golf with a passion. He would have loved this tournament."

FORMAT:
54-hole individual competition with a simultaneous best-ball event, similar to the AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am. Invited Mid- Amateur players are either paired with a single digit amateur or can propose their own partner to be introduced and invited by the Committee.

title: James H. Fyke Municipal Senior Amateur Championship
notes:
The Municipal Amateur Championship was founded in 1981 by Jim Fyke. Modeled after the City Open, it was his vision to create an amateur golf championship that was truly open to all competitors in Nashville and the surrounding areas. 36 hole stroke play championship.

Applications are open to male senior residents of the Nashville Metropolitan Statistical Area who meet the USGA definition of an amateur golfer. Persons applying for reinstatement to amateur status are not eligible.

The Metropolitan Statistical Area includes:Nashville- Davidson-Murfreesboro-Franklin (Cannon, Cheatham, Davidson, Dickson, Hickman, Macon, Maury, Robertson, Rutherford, Smith, Sumner, Trousdale, Williamson, Wilson)

title: East West Matches
notes:
New in 2020, the East West Matches feature Ryder Cup-style team matches for American mid-amateurs and seniors. The Mississippi River is the dividing line between East and West teams, each of which is comprised of 18 players: 6 seniors, at least 10 mid-amateurs, and up to 2 amateurs who haven't yet reached the age of 25.

A points system will be utilized to select 50% of each team, with the other 50% chosen by the tournament committee. Teams will be selected at the conclusion of the US Mid and US Senior Amateur Championships.

The schedule of play is 18 holes of four-ball on Friday, 36 holes of foursomes on Saturday, and 18 holes of singles on Sunday.

title: Dixie Senior & Mid-Master 2020 Invitational
notes: The senior version of the Dixie Amateur Championship has added a Mid-Master division starting in 2019. 54-hole stroke play event with no cut. Mid-Master (ages 40- 54), Senior (ages 55-64) and Super Senior (65+) Divisions. The final round will be a Shotgun start. The tournament has long drawn some of the country's top senior golfers to South Florida -- Doug Hanzel (2013-2014, 2017); Brady Exber (2012); and Rick Woulfe (an amazing 7 titles, his latest in 2015) are among the past champions. All three rounds are contested at the TPC Eagle Trace. You may request an invitation at www.dixieamateur.com.

Tournament takes on extra importance as the last major international amateur event to be played before the Augusta National Women's Amateur (ANWA) determines their ranking-based exemption list. 120 player limit. title: Pete & Alice Dye Junior Invitational
notes:
The mission of “The Dye” is to honor the legacy of champion golfers and world-renowned course designers Pete & Alice Dye. The Dyes gave birth to Crooked Stick Golf Club in 1964 and made their home alongside its 18th fairway for many decades. To honor Pete and Alice, the club’s membership has created an annual Junior Invitational featuring national elite junior players.

The event is a 54-hole competition for boys and girls, with 36 holes on day one and 18 on day two. There will be 33 players in both the boys and girls divisions and the event will be recognized by awarding points for WAGR, Junior Golf Scoreboard, and Golfweek rankings.

Why 33? That’s the number of cars that race in the nearby Indianapolis 500, held the day before.

title: The Dogwood Invitational 2020 Open Qualifier - CANCELLED

  • Entry Fee = $275.00. Once tee times are posted, there are no refunds for entry fees.

    • Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday May 12-13- 14

  • Tee Times: Tee times will be posted on the Dogwood web site no later than Saturday, May 30. Once tee times are posted, there are no refunds for entry fees.

  • Caddies are allowed for the qualifier but are not required. Securing a caddie will be the sole responsibility of the players in the qualifier. Druid Hills Golf Club will provide no caddies for the qualifier.
  • Withdrawal - You must submit a request to withdraw via e-mail to d ogwoodinvitational@yahoo.com . Any player who withdraws will be responsible for the event entry fee unless the player's spot can be filled. After tee times have been published, all entries will be considered final and no refunds issued. If you do withdraw, you will be subject to an administrative fee of $15.00, for a total refund of $260.00. Your refund will be paid within 2-3 weeks from the date of your request.

title: Callaway Golf Next-Gen Challenge - CANCELLED
notes:
**The Callaway Golf Next-Gen Challenge has been cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak. The tournament will likely move into the fall.

This is a unique college golf competition that pits the defending NCAA champion Stanford Cardinal against the Illinois Fighting Illini. Both teams field seven players. Five head-to-head matches are played, and the remaining two players on each team are available to come off the bench in certain situations to hit a shot for a teammate.

In addition, the match incorporates a Coach's Challenge, where each coach (Stanford's Conrad Ray and Illinois' Mike Small) can at any point during a match toss out a challenge flag, thereby challenging the opposing coach to step in and hit the shot his player is about to play.

AmateurGolf.com provides livestreaming of all five matches.

36-hole stroke play tournament with the following flights:

Masters Flight: All players must have a 5.4 index or better to participate. The field is limited to ages 40 to 54. N.C.G.A. points will be awarded.

Senior Championship: All players must have reached their 55th birthday and must have a 5.4 index or better to participate. N.C.G.A. points will be awarded.

Super Senior Flight: All players must have reached their 65th birthday and must have a 5.4 index or better to participate.

Ladies Championship: There will be gross and net winners, with prizes will awarded according to the size of the field. There is no handicap restriction, but all players in the handicap portion must have an established index verifiable through GHIN.

Handicap Flights: We will use July 1st handicap indexes to build competitive flights of 24 to 32 players (no senior handicap flight). There are no handicap restrictions, but all players must have an established index verifiable through GHIN.

title: Clarksdale Senior Four-Ball Match Play
notes:

title: USGC King's Cup National Qualifier
notes:
This is one of a series of National Qualifiers for the USGA King's Cup National Championship, from which the top finishers will go on to represent the U.S. in the International King's Cup against Ireland.

Scoring at National Qualifiers is best-ball NET, so as to properly allocate strokes among teammates. The lowest net score will be that team’s score for the hole. Each teammate will receive 85% of their course handicap. The low 30% of the field and ties will qualify for the USGC National Championship.

There are two divisions – Open Division and Senior Division. Open Division is open to all ages. Senior Division is for Players 55 years of age and above. A Player that is 55+ is allowed to compete in the Open division, but a player that is under 55 is not allowed to compete in the Senior division.

title: USGC King's Cup National Qualifier
notes:
This is one of a series of National Qualifiers for the USGA King's Cup National Championship, from which the top finishers will go on to represent the U.S. in the International King's Cup against Ireland.

Scoring at National Qualifiers is best-ball NET, so as to properly allocate strokes among teammates. The lowest net score will be that team’s score for the hole. Each teammate will receive 85% of their course handicap. The low 30% of the field and ties will qualify for the USGC National Championship.

There are two divisions – Open Division and Senior Division. Open Division is open to all ages. Senior Division is for Players 55 years of age and above. A Player that is 55+ is allowed to compete in the Open division, but a player that is under 55 is not allowed to compete in the Senior division.

notes:

Scoring at National Qualifiers is best-ball NET, so as to properly allocate strokes among teammates. The lowest net score will be that team’s score for the hole. Each teammate will receive 85% of their course handicap. The low 30% of the field and ties will qualify for the USGC National Championship.

There are two divisions – Open Division and Senior Division. Open Division is open to all ages. Senior Division is for Players 55 years of age and above. A Player that is 55+ is allowed to compete in the Open division, but a player that is under 55 is not allowed to compete in the Senior division.

title: Golfweek Myrtle Beach Collegiate
notes:

notes:

- Day One Front 9 = Scramble
- Day One Back 9 = Pinehurst Alternate Shot
- Day Two = Best Ball

Who Can Play: All college golf coaches. If there is enough interest we will have a retired coaches division. Head coaches may team up with their assistant coach or a coach from another school. The event will be divided into men’s, women’s and mixed divisions, and potentially further divided within divisions based on entries.

title: Bloomington Normal Match Play Championship
notes:
Individual Match Play competition. 18 hole qualifying

qualifiers plus last years Match Play Champion make up

flights contain 16 players. Ties for the Championship 
Flight are broken by a sudden death playoff. Ties for 
other flights are based on first-in. Finals: Championship 
flight: 36 holes. Other Flights: 18.
courseName: Weibring Golf Club at Illinois State University

title: Bloomington Normal Medal Play Championship
notes:
Individual stroke play format.  18 hole qualifying round of stroke play 
determines flights.  The top 32 qualifying individuals plus ties make 
up the Championship Flight.  Subsequent flights contain a minimum 
16 individuals including ties.   A second and final round is played the 
following day for all flights to determine the finish within all flights but 
the championship flight.  The Championship flight is cut to an exact 
18 players based on 36 holes scores and using hole 18 on back as the 
tie breaker.  These 18 players then play an additional 18 holes for a 
total of 54 to determine the City Medal Play Champion.

title: Arlington Best Ball Championship
notes:
Two player best ball format (Four-Ball Stroke Play). Teams will be divided 
into equal flights (determined by the number of participating teams) after 
the first round. No team may improve their score more than 5, 6, and 7 
shots (to be determined by draw after the start of play on Sunday) lower 
than that flight leader’s first round score. If they do, that team will be 
moved up to the applicable flight. There will be awards in each flight for low 
gross and low net. Each team member must have a verifiable handicap. If 
either or both team members do not have a verifiable handicap, they will 
only be able to compete for the gross award in their respective flight.

Competitors may not elect to play in a different age

required. There are four age divisions; Amateur (18-
24), Mid-
Amateur (25-54), Senior (55-64) and Super-Senior 
(65 & above). 
Competitors may not elect to play in a different age 
division or from

title: Maryland Mixed Two-Ball Championship
notes:
The tournament is open to amateurs who are 
members of member clubs of the MSGA. Each team 
consists of a male and a
female, not necessarily from the same club. No 
entries with a combined USGA INDEX above 46.0 will 
be accepted. No individual may have
a handicap index greater than 36.0. The tournament 
will be modified Foursome Stroke Play with 
SELECTIVE DRIVES and ALTERNATE SHOTS 
thereafter.

title: Maryland Two-Woman Team Championship
notes:
This tournament is open to female amateur golfers who 
are members of member clubs of the MSGA having a 
maximum
combined up-to-date handicap index of not more than

title: Philadelphia Public Links Mid-Amateur Championship
notes:
18-hole stroke play tournament open to all amateur 
golfers, aged 25 and older. Mid-Amateur, Senior (ages 
50+) and Super Senior (ages 60+) divisions.

title: St. Augustine Amateur 2020
notes:
The St. Augustine Amateur is a national event established in 2004 for top amateur and collegiate players. The 54-hole stroke play, walking only, competition is conducted over three days. The player caddies, walking referees, standard bearers and forecaddies really add to the experience. The field is limited to 78 players whose golf resumes and tournament experience have earned them a spot in the field. The winner receives the John C. Jennison III Trophy. The field is limited to 84 players, with no cut.

The tournament is open to Amateurs only whose entry has been accepted by the Tournament Committee however there is an open qualifier prior to the event.

title: Dunham Cup
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament for mid-amateurs and 
seniors played on one day. The tournament honors 
John Dunham, the longtime PGA professional at 
Highland G&CC who was inducted into the Indiana Golf 
Hall of Fame. The club celebrated its centennial in 2019 
and was the host of the 1926 Western Open which was 
won by Walter Hagen.

title: Columbia Golf Championship
notes:
The Columbia Golf Championship was established in 
1975 through the sponsorship of the Kiwanis club and 
the leadership of Rex Dillow.  In 1994 a senior division 
was added to the event.  This tournament promotes 
amateur golf in the Columbia area and provides an 
opportunity to establish lifelong friendships and 
goodwill.

title: Grant County Amateur Championship
notes:
72-hole stroke play tournament open to Grant County 
(Indiana) residents, members of county courses, and 
students at county schools and universities. Played over 
consecutive weekends.

title: Commonwealth Cup
notes:
Two-man team event with a different format every six 
holes. Holes 1-6 are played with a best ball format, 7-
12 is scramble play and 13-18 is alternate shot. A par-3 
contest is held the day before the tournament.

title: Albert A. Stone Jr. Cup
notes:
The city championship of Jackson, Tennessee. Match play event with open, senior and women's divisions. Entries are limited to eligible amateur players (children 12 years and older and adults) who are past champions or either reside, attend school, work or are members of a golf club in Madison County, Tennessee and are not currently golf professionals or have entered a golf tournament as a professional unless amateur status has been reinstated in accordance with the USGA Rules.

The cup is named after Albert A. Stone Jr., who was the first golfer in the state to win the Tennessee Open and the Tennessee Amateur and was the first Jacksonian to be inducted into the Tennessee Golf Hall of Fame.

title: Evangeline Four-Ball Invitational
notes:
Long-running two-man best-ball event held at 
Oakbourne CC. The field will be limited to 96 teams 
(192 players). The 96 teams accepted by invitation will 
be the field and will be divided into six flights of 16 
teams each.

title: Finkbine Amateur Invitational
notes:
36-hole stroke play championship for college and high 
school players from around the Midwest. Held at the 
host course of the University of Iowa golf teams.

title: AmateurGolf.com 2021 Two Man Links and Father & Son Championship
notes:
He who hesitates is lost. And this year's 20th celebration of the Two Man Links Championship is going to fill quickly - so don't wait! Join us for AmateurGolf.com's flagship best-ball event at the highly-acclaimed Bandon Dunes Resort - site of the 2020 U.S. Amateur! The tournament features Championship, Senior Championship, and Net and Father & Son Divisions (with gross and net prizes) and it always draws a diverse group of players from across the U.S. and Canada..

GEORGE AND MICHAEL STEVENS FATHER & SON CHAMPIONSHIP
AmateurGolf.com is pleased to announce that the tournament now includes a Father/Son division with gross and net prizes as well as eligibility for the overall championship in either division.
WHAT'S INCLUDED:

(4) nights lodging at Bandon Dunes Resort (see options below)
(4) tournament rounds (1) at each of the resort's courses
(1) gala tournament dinner (golf attire fine)
$10,000 in prizes (based on 80 players)
Tournament awards for division winners
Welcome gifts for all players

ITINERARY

Course Note: All divisions will play Bandon Dunes, Pacific Dunes, Bandon Trails, and Sheep Ranch. Since we will use two courses each day, we won't know the course assignments until the field is full and the divisions have been broken down. But don't worry, no matter where you fall, you'll stay with your partner, and play all four courses.

Thursday, April 22, 2021
Arrival day, golf at player's expense today for those that arrive early enough or complimentary use of awesome range
- Lodging: Bandon Dunes Resort

Friday, April 23, 2021
Tournament Round 1
- Lodging: Bandon Dunes Resort

Saturday, April 24, 2021
Tournament Round 2
- Lodging: Bandon Dunes Resort

Sunday, April 25, 2021
Tournament Round 3
- evening: 7:00pm - Dinner at Bandon Dunes- MacDonald Hall (above McKee's Pub)
- Lodging: Bandon Dunes Resort

Monday, April 26, 2021
Final Round
- morning tee times tbd based on number of players -- please check out of your room prior to play unless arrangements have been made to stay over
- Tournament Awards immediately following play at Bandon Trails.

Divisions
Championship
For teams with a suggested combined handicap index of 16.0 or lower. This division is played best-ball at scratch from the Green Tees. Prizes will be awarded to the top finishers, and optional skins games will be held daily.
Senior Championship
For teams with suggested combined handicap of 16.0 or lower, where both are aged 50+. Play from Green Tees, except those aged 65+ may elect to play from Gold Tees. Teams in this division are eligible to win the overall title. Prizes for top finishers; optional daily skins games.
Net
For teams with a suggested combined handicap of 36.0 or lower. Play will be at 80% of course handicap, with a maximum allowance of 18. Play from Green Tees, except that those aged 65+ may elect to play from the Gold Tees. Prizes for top finishers; optional daily skins games.
Father/Son
Father/Son division with gross and net prizes as well as eligibility for the overall championship in either the Championship or Net division.

title: Heart of Tennessee Amateur

title: Hawley Quier Memorial - CANCELLED

36-hole individual stroke play invitational held annually at Moselem Springs Golf Club.

title: Carmody Invitational
notes:

best-ball Stableford. 27 holes are played each day,

the final 9 holes each day the aggregate score of the

Handicap and age requirements are the same as for 
the
USGA 
Mid-Am and the USGA Senior Am. Field limit to 36 
teams and will be considered by playing 
resume. Merit Club hosted the 2000 U.S. 
Women's Open.

title: World Amateur Golfers Championship
notes:
The tournament begins as a national championship in countries around the world where the winners from five handicap flights in each country become National Champions of their flight and represents their national team as well as individually within their flights. The flights are: 0 – 5.4, 5.5 – 10.4, 10.5 – 15.4, 15.5 – 20.4 and 20.5 – 25.4

The world final is played over 72 holes (like professional PGA tournaments) on four different golf courses with handicap adjustments between each round.

title: Men's All-City Golf Tournament
notes:
54-hole stroke play tournament played over three 
courses. The event is an open amateur event and will 
be flighted based on the number of entries. Senior 
competition will be held in three age groups - 50 and 
under, 50-69 and 70-plus.

title: Laramie Open
notes:
54-hole stroke play championship open to professionals 
and low handicap amateurs (maximum handicap 2.4). 
There are also flights for higher handicap amateurs.

title: Pacific Northwest Four-Ball Championship
notes:
New in 2020, this is a 54-hole flighted two-man four-
ball tournament played on three championship courses. 
Championship with consist of 72 teams, 144 players 
total. Championship Flight and Secondary Flight will be 
based on the field when registration closes. Each player 
must have a USGA Handicap Index below 20.0. Each 
player must be at least 16 years of age by the day of 
Championship.

title: Mountain State Golf Classic
notes:
54-hole flighted stroke play tournament for amateurs 
and seniors played on three different golf courses. The 
tournament raises money for the state chapter of the 
Alzheimers Association.

title: Natchez City Championship
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament with a champonship 
flight and four additional flights. Open to current and 
previous Miss-Lou residents.
All ages, male & female.

title: The Natchez Open
notes:
New in 2020, this is a 54-hole stroke play tournament 
for pros and amateurs, with multiple amateur flights 
including senior (ages 50+) and super senior (ages 
60+) flights.

title: GCAA Amateur Series - Norman
notes:
Eligibility : Tournaments are open to any male or female golfers who were on a college or university varsity golf roster during the 2019-20 school year or will be on a college or university varsity golf roster during the upcoming 2020-21 school year.

Entry Fee: $265 per player – Tournament registration will open approximately six weeks prior to the date of the event and will be administered by the GCAA. Entry fee will include all competitive rounds, range access during the tournament days, as well as a boxed lunch between rounds on day one of the tournament.

Format: Events will be held over two day (Saturday- Sunday) 54 holes; using either a shotgun start format or double tee start format. Both male and female golfers will be competing in one tournament using two sets of tees. Tournaments will be recognized by WAGR; points will be awarded accordingly based on the individual participants finish against other players of their gender.

Practice Rounds: Will be optional and be at the expense of participants. The GCAA will work with host venues to set up day(s) and times for individuals who would like to play in a practice round. Participants will be responsible for setting up their own practice round.

Field Size: Events will have a minimum of 60 and a maximum of 84 players.

courseName: The Golf Club at Dove Mountain

title: The Roberts Cup
notes:
54-hole two-man four-ball stroke play event with two 
divisions: Mid-Amateur (ages 25+) and Senior (ages 
50+). Played at Golden Ocala, which has hosted 
various state, NCAA and LPGA Tour events and 
showcases tribute holes from some of the world's best 
courses.

title: Grand Slam Amateur Golf Tournament
notes:
54-hole two-person tournament with divisions for men, 
women and seniors. Teams play a different format each 
day: a best-ball, scramble, and alternate shot. 	
Teams are flighted by the lower handicap of the two 
partners.

title: Janesville Men's City Tournament
notes:
54-hole stroke play tournament played over three 
courses.

title: Iowa City Men's Amateur
notes:
54-hole stroke play tournament played on three different courses. Must 
be 18 years old and meet one of the following criteria at a Johnson 
County Golf Course: (i) Hold a membership/play package, (ii) Play in a 
golf league, or (iii) Reside in the City of West Branch or Johnson County.

title: GTGA Invitational
notes:
72-hole stroke play championship with a 54-hole cut 
that draws a strong field from continental Europe.

title: Austrian Women's International Amateur Championship
notes:
72-hole individual stroke play championship that draws 
an international field, mostly from Continental Europe.

title: GTGA Women's Invitational
notes:
72-hole stroke play championship with a 54-hole cut 
that draws a strong field from continental Europe.

title: Racine County Open Men's Golf Tournament
notes:
54-hole stroke play tournament for pros and amateurs, 
with amateur flights determined by handicap. 
Championship flight handicap limit is 6.0. The low 60 
and ties in the championship flight, and the top 15 and 
ties in flights 1-3 play the third round at one course, 
with consolation flights played at another.

title: McCall Men's Amateur Invitational
notes:
Part of McCall Amateur week (which dates back to 
1934) and is preceded by junior and women's 
tournaments; in all the week draws over 500 golfers to 
McCall Golf Club. The men's field of 352 is divided into 
a championship match play flight of 32 and additional 
flights of 16.

title: Italian Women's Amateur Stroke Play Championship (Isa Goldschmid Trophy)
notes:
National championship of Italy; 72-hole stroke play 
championship.

title: Italian Women's Amateur Match Play Championship (Giuseppe Silva Trophy)
notes:
National match play championship of Italy; 36-hole 
stroke play qualifying to determine 32 players for 
match play.

title: Nebraska Cup Matches
notes:
Must be a resident of the state of Nebraska or a 
non-
resident student that attends college in Nebraska.  
Open to NGA members only. Format is 72-holes of 
stroke play with the low 60 players and ties playing 
the 
final 36-holes.

title: Richmond City Amateur
notes:
36-hole flighted stroke play tournament that celebrates 
its 90th year in 2021.

title: Berkshire Hills Fall Classic
notes:
2 Man, Best-ball GROSS, Divisions will be set based on Day One Score
Saturday Qualifying round from BLUE tees
Sunday round based on division (Championship flight plays GOLD)

title: Maridoe Amateur Championship
notes:
Introduced in 2020 to provide top-ranked players a 
chance to contend for a Walker Cup berth, this is a U.S. 
Amateur-style competition with 54 holes 
of stroke play followed by a 64-player match-play 
bracket and a 36-hole championship match. The top 
102 players in the World Amateur Golf Ranking (WAGR) 
will be invited, with the rest of the field based off the 
rankings.

title: SLR Academy Invitational
notes:
54-hole stroke play championship that draws a strong 
field from continental Europe.

title: Swiss International Ladies Championship
notes:
72 hole stroke play international championship with a 
cut after 36 holes.

title: Earl Wooten Memorial
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament with Regular, Senior 
and Super Senior divisions. Each division is flighted 
based on first-round score.

title: Connecticut Women's Golf Association Championship
notes:
Match play championship for Connecticut Women's Golf 
Association (CWGA) members whose handicap index 
does not exceed 28.4. Celebrated its 100th playing in 
2019.

title: Greatest Golfer Tournament
notes:
Popular tournament that draws around 300 golfers 
every summer. 54-hole championship with Men's, 
Senior (ages 60+) 
and Legends (70+) divisions, and flights determined by 
handicap. Gross and net scoring. Also a Women's Net 
division.

title: The Tucker Amateur
notes:
A part of the Troon Saguaro Amateur Series, The 
Tucker Amateur is a 54-hole championship open to 
amateur golfers who meet the eligibility and exemption 
requirements which include position in various 
rankings, USGA appearances, and state amateur and 
mid-amateur champions. Maximum handicap 3.0.

title: Silver State Amateur
notes:
A part of the Troon Saguaro Amateur Series, the 
Silver State Amateur is a 54-hole championship open to 
amateur golfers who meet the eligibility and exemption 
requirements which include position in various 
rankings, USGA appearances, and state amateur and 
mid-amateur champions. Maximum handicap 3.0.
courseName: Las Vegas Paiute Resort - Sun Mountain Course

who meet the eligibility and exemption requirements 
which include position in various rankings, USGA 
appearances, and state amateur and mid-amateur 
champions. Maximum handicap 3.0.

title: Heritage Senior Classic
notes:
36-hole stroke play tournament open to all 
Professionals and Amateurs who live 
in the state of Georgia and are age 50 or older. 
Senior 
and Super Senior divisions.

title: Golfweek True Blue Amateur
notes:
**Field expanded to include any amateur player looking for competition, not just college players.

A 54-hole stroke-play event for men's college golfers. Who Can Play: Players who were on a college roster during last college season and incoming freshman who will be on a college roster this fall.

title: Golfweek Caledonia Women's Amateur
notes:
**Field expanded to include any amateur player looking for competition, not just college players.

A 54-hole stroke-play event for women's college golfers. Who Can Play: Players who were on a college roster during last college season and incoming freshman who will be on a college roster this fall.

title: Golfweek Hoosier Amateur
notes:
**Field expanded to include any amateur player looking for competition, not just college players.

notes:

features men’s and women’s teams competing in a 54-
hole stroke play format for individual and team honors.

title: Colorado Fall Amateur Championship
notes:
54 holes of stroke play with no cut. Must currently be 
ages 18-26 with a handicap index lower than 5.0. 
Men's and Women's Championships will be scored and 
awarded separately.
